{{n/a}}\n| {{nom}}\n|-\n|}\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist|30em}}\n\n{{Authority control}}\n{{Songland}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Palmer, Griffen}}\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:Canadian country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Canadian male singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Big Loud artists]]\n[[Category:Bowling Green State University alumni]]\n[[Category:People from Pickering, Ontario]]\n[[Category:Singers from Ontario]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian male singers]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian singers]]\n[[Category:1995 births]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian singer-songwriters]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"The_Bellamy_Brothers","to":"The Bellamy Brothers"}],"pages":{"1745350":{"pageid":1745350,"ns":0,"title":"The Bellamy Brothers","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American music duo}}\n{{Redirect|Howard Bellamy|the Doctors character of the same name|Howard Bellamy (Doctors)}}\n{{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians -->\n| name                = Bellamy Brothers\n| image               = The Bellamy Brothers.jpg\n| landscape           = yes\n| alt                 = The Bellamy Brothers standing before a purple-tinged sunset\n| caption             = The Bellamy Brothers in 2013: Howard (left) and David (right)\n| background          = group_or_band\n| origin              = [[Pasco County, Florida]], U.S.\n| genre               = {{Hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]|[[soft rock]]| [[country rock]]}}\n| years_active        = 1968\u2013present\n| label               = [[Curb Records|Curb]]/[[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]]<br />Curb/[[Elektra Records|Elektra]]<br />Curb/[[MCA Records|MCA]]<br />[[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]]<br />Jupiter<br />Bellamy Bros./[[Intersound Records|Intersound]]<br />Blue Hat\n| website             = [http://bellamybrothers.com bellamybrothers.com]\n| current_members     = David Bellamy<br />Howard Bellamy\n}}\n'''The Bellamy Brothers''' are an American [[pop music|pop]] and [[country music]] duo consisting of brothers David Milton Bellamy (born September 16, 1950)<ref name=\"about\">{{Cite web|url=http://countrymusic.about.com/od/charts/a/blbellamybros.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070212210842/http://countrymusic.about.com/od/charts/a/blbellamybros.htm|url-status=dead|title=Top 100 Country Music Artists of All Time - No.&nbsp;83 - The Bellamy Brothers|archive-date=February 12, 2007}}</ref> and Homer Howard Bellamy (born February 2, 1946),<ref name=\"about\"/> from [[Pasco County, Florida|Dade City, Florida]].<ref name=\"about\"/> The duo had considerable musical success in the 1970s and 1980s, starting with the release of their crossover hit \"[[Let Your Love Flow]]\" in 1976, a number one single on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].<ref name=\"allmusic\">{{cite web\n|url= {{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p1522/biography|pure_url=yes}}\n|title= Biography\n|access-date= 2008-04-01\n|last= Erlewine\n|first= Stephen Thomas\n|author-link= Stephen Thomas Erlewine\n|work= The Bellamy Brothers\n|publisher= [[Allmusic]]\n}}</ref>\n\nStarting in the late 1970s, the Bellamy Brothers found success in country music as well, charting 20 number one singles, 25 top 10 and more than 50 hits overall on the [[Hot Country Songs|country charts]]. To date, they have released more than 50 albums, primarily on [[Curb Records]]. They have also enjoyed success in continental Europe, with a compilation album topping the [[VG-lista|Norwegian charts]] in 2011 and over two dozen hit songs that were released outside the US market. In 2013, their album ''Bellamy Brothers & Friends: Across the Sea'' landed at No. 5 in the [[Swiss Hitparade|Swiss music chart]] and took the top spot in album sales for weeks in Switzerland.<ref name=\"The Boot: New Album\">{{cite web|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=Bellamy Brothers Score International Success With New Album |date=16 July 2013 |url=http://theboot.com/bellamy-brothers-international-success-new-album/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref> It was their third major release in Europe in three years.<ref name=\"Broadway World\">{{cite web|last1=News Desk|title='Bellamy Brothers and Friends' Album Finds Success in Switzerland|url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwmusic/article/Bellamy-Brothers-and-Friends-Album-Finds-Success-in-Switzerland-20130716#|publisher=Broadway World|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref> Their album ''Mermaid Cowgirl'', recorded in Switzerland and released in 2014, won them Gold Record status in Switzerland.<ref name=\"AXS\">{{cite web|last1=Cooke|first1=Sherryjane|title=5 things you didn't know about The Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.axs.com/5-things-you-didn-t-know-about-the-bellamy-brothers-81493|publisher=AXS|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref> They also recorded four albums in Germany with [[Ralph Siegel]] for release to the European market.<ref name=\"CD Universe\">{{cite web|title=The Bellamy Brothers & Friends - Take Me Home CD|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/1014968/a/take+me+home.htm|publisher=CD Universe|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"45 Cat\">{{cite web|title=The Bellamy Brothers: Fly Me To Eden|url=https://www.45cat.com/record/nc318101de&ei=1|publisher=45 Cat|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"American Radio History\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-Billboard/90s/1991/BB-1991-12-07.pdf|publisher=American Radio History|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref>\n\n==Early life==\nDavid and Howard Bellamy were inspired by many musical sources from an early age. Their father played [[country music]] around the house, and was also a member of a local [[Western swing]] band; in addition, they were inspired by the [[rock and roll]] music their sister played. Despite having never had formal music training, both brothers learned how to play [[guitar]], [[mandolin]], and [[banjo]]. In addition, David learned [[accordion]], [[fiddle]], [[organ (music)|organ]], and [[piano]].<ref name=\"allmusic\"/>\n\nTheir first musical gig was in 1968 at a benefit concert with their father in [[San Antonio, Florida]], at the Rattlesnake Roundup.<ref name=\"stage\">{{Cite web|url=http://www.thecountrystage.com/artists/BellamyBrothers/bio.htm|title=Bellamy Brothers - Biography|website=Thecountrystage.com|access-date=October 17, 2019|archive-date=March 21, 2005|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050321201034/http://www.thecountrystage.com/artists/BellamyBrothers/bio.htm|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name=\"bellamy\">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bellamybrothers.com/up_close.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070515143050/http://www.bellamybrothers.com/up_close.htm|url-status=dead|title=BellamyBrothers.com : Up Close|archive-date=May 15, 2007}}</ref>\n\nIn the late sixties the brothers and their band played for dances at the Dade City Civic Center and at Louie's in Brooksville. They played as The Accidents and later as The Heterogeneous Grouping, performing covers of many of the popular rock and roll and [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] tunes of the time. Three of their favorites were \"[[A Whiter Shade of Pale]]\", \"[[My Girl (The Temptations song)|My Girl]]\" and \"[[Little Bit O' Soul]]\".\n\nTheir first paid gigs were playing fraternity parties at the [[University of Florida]].<ref name=\"MTV.FR\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.mtv.fr/musique/artistes/the-bellamy-brothers/hzp1f5|publisher=MTV.FR|access-date=19 December 2016|archive-date=20 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220170544/http://www.mtv.fr/musique/artistes/the-bellamy-brothers/hzp1f5|url-status=dead}}</ref> Soon after, the brothers moved to [[Atlanta]] and formed a band called Jericho.<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> However, playing in bands and clubs proved tiresome for the brothers, who soon moved back home.<ref name=\"allmusic\"/>\n\nThe brothers were soon noticed by a friend of recording artist [[Jim Stafford]], who eventually recorded \"[[Spiders & Snakes (song)|Spiders & Snakes]]\", written by Stafford and David. \"Spiders & Snakes\" went on to become a top five hit, providing the Bellamys with the money to move to [[Los Angeles]].<ref name=\"allmusic\"/><ref name=\"stage\"/> Howard became a [[road manager]] for Stafford.<ref name=\"stage\"/>\n\n==Music career==\n===1970s===\nThe duo signed to [[Curb Records]] in 1975. A single featuring only David, \"Nothin' Heavy\", was unsuccessful. However, at the suggestion of [[Neil Diamond]]'s drummer Dennis St. John, the brothers recorded and released the single \"[[Let Your Love Flow]]\", written by Diamond's roadie Larry Williams. Released in 1976, \"Let Your Love Flow\" was a No.&nbsp;1 single on the U.S. [[Mainstream Top 40|pop charts]], as well as more than a dozen countries worldwide.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/biography.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090928090308/http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/biography.html|url-status=dead|title=\"DUETS WITH THE DUET\": THE BELLAMY BROTHERS HOOK UP WITH COUNTRY SUPERSTARS FOR LONG-AWAITED ANGELS & OUTLAWS VOL. 1, ON CURB RECORDS, MARCH 29|archive-date=September 28, 2009}}</ref>\n\nAlthough \"Let Your Love Flow\" was also a hit on the [[Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart, the Bellamys' country music success was limited until 1979, when \"[[If I Said You Have a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me]]\" was released. The song, with its ''[[double entendre]]'' title derived from a [[Groucho Marx]] quote,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=7458|title=If I Said You Have a Beautiful Body (Would You Hold It Against Me) by The Bellamy Brothers|website=Songfacts.com}}</ref> landed the Bellamys their first country music No.&nbsp;1 in the United States. It was first played on radio in the United Kingdom in [[Northern Ireland]] in 1979 and went on to become Record of the Year in the UK in 1979.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/local-national/article2514572.ece|title=Bellamy brothers are coming ... so don't hold that song against them|website=Belfastelegraph.co.uk|access-date=October 17, 2019}}</ref> In a 2003 issue of ''Country Weekly'' magazine, the title was named the number 1 country [[pick-up line]] of all time.<ref name=\"The Boot Pick Up Lines\">{{cite web|title=Top 10 Pickup Lines in Country Music|url=http://theboot.com/pick-up-lines/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref>\n\n===1980s and 1990s===\nAfter the success of \"If I Said You Have a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me\", the brothers continued with a run of country hits, including tunes such as \"[[Redneck Girl]]\", \"Santa Fe\", and the social commentary pieces \"[[Old Hippie]]\" and \"[[Kids of the Baby Boom]]\".<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' named the Bellamy Brothers as Top Country Duo,<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> and they eventually went on to set the record for most duo nominations from both the [[Academy of Country Music]] and [[Country Music Association]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.classicbands.com/BellamyBrothersInterview.html|title=Gary James' Interview With Howard Bellamy Of The Bellamy Brothers|website=Classicbands.com|access-date=October 17, 2019}}</ref>\n\nThe brothers worked on a number of collaborative efforts with other musicians during this period. They recorded \"Too Much Is Not Enough\" with [[The Forester Sisters]] in 1986<ref name=\"YouTube Forester Sisters\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers & The Forester Sisters - Too Much Is Not Enough| date=12 March 2009 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-IvEnIdQ3M |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/Y-IvEnIdQ3M |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref> and \"[[Drive South]]\" with them in 1990.<ref name=\"YouTube Forester Sisters 1990\">{{cite web|title=\"1990\" \"Drive South\", Forester Sisters & Bellamy Brothers|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XEWi_ArYHqs|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref> In 1993, they recorded \"Stayin' in Love\" with [[Freddy Fender]] and [[Flaco Jim\u00e9nez]].<ref name=\"YouTube Freddy Fender & The Bellamy Brothers\">{{cite web|title=Freddy Fender & The Bellamy Brothers| date=10 March 2012 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=44Nm2LAOeoY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/44Nm2LAOeoY |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube}}{{cbignore}}</ref> In 1997, they recorded \"Catahoula\" with [[Eddy Raven]] and [[Jo-El Sonnier]],<ref name=\"Google Books\">{{cite web|last1=Evans Price|first1=Deborah|title=Bellamys Take a Step Over the Line|date=1997-05-24|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fA8EAAAAMBAJ&q=Catahoula+with+Eddy+Raven+and+Jo-El+Sonnier+and+bellamy+brothers&pg=PA36|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref> while in 1997 they recorded \"Everyone's Somebody's Darlin'\" with [[Nicolette Larson]]. In 1999, they recorded \"(Don't Put Me In) The Ex Files\" with [[Buck Owens]],<ref name=\"YouTube Buck Owens\">{{cite web|title=Dont Put Me In The X files (Bellamy Brothers featuring Buck Owens)| date=6 July 2014 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kex7zl4WVSA |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/Kex7zl4WVSA |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref> and that same year they recorded \"Vertical Expression\" with Freddy Fender and then with [[Eduardo Araujo]].<ref name=\"YouTube Freddy Fender\">{{cite web|title=Vertical Expression of Horizontal Desire - The Bellamy Brothers featuring Freddy Fender| date=3 June 2011 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OIx7EyqlqVY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/OIx7EyqlqVY |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=[[YouTube]]|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\nIn 1991, the Bellamys switched to [[Atlantic Records]]. Their tenure there produced one album before the duo formed their own label, Bellamy Brothers Records. They were one of the first country music artists to have their own record label, and have been licensing albums from their own record label for 25 years.<ref name=\"All Music Biography\">{{cite web|last1=Erlewine|first1=Stephen Thomas|title=Artist Biography by Stephen Thomas Erlewine|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-bellamy-brothers-mn0000037026/biography|publisher=All Music|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"All Music Artists\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-bellamy-brothers-mn0000037026|publisher=All Music|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref> In 1999, they switched to Blue Hat Records for their ''Lonely Planet'' album.\n\n===2000s===\nIn 2005, the Bellamys returned to Curb Records to record ''Angels & Outlaws, Volume 1'', a compilation album featuring re-recordings of the duo's older hits with additional artists, including [[Dolly Parton]], [[George Jones]], [[Alan Jackson]], [[Tanya Tucker]] and [[Montgomery Gentry]].<ref name=\"luck\">{{Cite web|url=http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/pressrelease.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070623201054/http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/pressrelease.html|url-status=dead|title=Luck Media & Marketing INC.|archive-date=June 23, 2007}}</ref> A re-recorded version of \"If I Said You Had a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me\", featuring Dolly Parton, spent one week at No.&nbsp;60 on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart in 2005.\n\nIn March 2007, \"Redneck Girl\" was covered by [[Blake Shelton]] on the soundtrack to ''[[The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning]]''.\n\nThe Bellamys released an album of [[gospel music]], titled ''Jesus Is Coming'', on May 8, 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/music-christian-dc-idUSN2023183320070521|title=Bellamy Brothers celebrate outlaw gospel spirit|date=May 21, 2007|website=Reuters.com|access-date=October 17, 2019}}</ref> Its title track was previously recorded on ''Native American'' in 1995. The album received two [[GMA Dove Award|Dove Award]] nominations, and a second gospel album, ''Pray for Me'', was released in 2012.<ref name=\"Taste of Country\">{{cite web|last1=Conaway|first1=Alanna|title=The Bellamy Brothers to Release New Gospel Album 'Pray for Me' on September 4 |date=12 August 2012 |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/bellamy-brothers-pray-for-me-album-release-date/|publisher=Taste of Country|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref> They had many guest singers on this album. Their sister Ginger sang with them on the song \"Suppertime\", and Deborah Allen sang background vocals with Vicky Hampton on the album. Irish actor and musician Kieran McHugh played penny whistle for the song \"Hymn to Him\".<ref name=\"The Boot New Gospel Album\">{{cite web|last1=Evans-Price|first1=Deborah|title=The Bellamy Brothers Pack Emotional Punch on New Gospel Album |date=17 September 2012 |url=http://theboot.com/the-bellamy-brothers-gospel-album/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref>\n\nIn 2008, the song \"Let Your Love Flow\" was used in the [[Barclaycard]] advert for their new contactless cards. The song re-entered the UK singles chart at No.&nbsp;48 based on downloads, peaked at No.&nbsp;21 in the pop charts in March 2009,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/40093 |title=The Bellamy Brothers - Let Your Love Flow - Music Charts |publisher=Acharts.us |access-date=2012-05-03}}</ref> and was listed on BMI's list of Top 100 Song of the Century at No.&nbsp;68 that same year.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/current_articles/preshias.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091120073620/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/current_articles/preshias.htm|url-status=dead|title=Preshias' Monthly Column: Music News|archive-date=November 20, 2009}}</ref> A cover by Petra Haden was used in a 2010 [[Toyota Prius]] commercial.\n\n''The Anthology, Vol. 1'' was released in 2009 and includes the single \"Guilty of the Crime\", which is a collaboration with the [[Bacon Brothers]]. The video features [[Shannen Doherty]] of ''[[Beverly Hills, 90210]]'' fame.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://top40-charts.com/news/Country/Bellamy-Brothers-Bacon-Brothers-Guilty-Of-The-Crime--New-Video-Debuts-On-CMT-Pure/49799.html|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20091129145316/http://top40-charts.com/news/Country/Bellamy-Brothers-Bacon-Brothers-Guilty-Of-The-Crime--New-Video-Debuts-On-CMT-Pure/49799.html|archive-date = 2009-11-29|title = Bellamy Brothers, Bacon Brothers 'Guilty of the Crime' - New Video Debuts on CMT Pure}}</ref> Both sets of brothers performed the song together on the [[Grand Ole Opry]] in Nashville, Tennessee, on September 1, 2009.\n\nIn 2010, the Bellamys recorded ''The Greatest Hits Sessions'' with Swiss rock star [[G\u00f6l\u00e4]] (Marco Pfeuti) and the project sold double platinum in Europe.<ref name=\"American Country Music Chart\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers Strike Platinum in Europe with BB&G Album!|url=http://americancountrymusicchart.com/bellamy-brothers-strike-platinum-in-europe-with-bbg-album/|publisher=American Country Music Chart|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref> It was at number one of the Swiss Schweizer Hitparade for 7 weeks. In 2011, they created ''BB&G Platinum'' with G\u00f6l\u00e4. Then, in 2014, they teamed up again with G\u00f6l\u00e4 and recorded ''Mermaid Cowgirl'' in Switzerland. They achieved gold record status in Switzerland with this album.<ref name=\"AXS\" />\n\nIn June 2010, their song \"Jalepe\u00f1os\", about the problems of political correctness, was banned before it could even be released to radio because of its profanity.<ref>Buie, Lisa, St. Petersburg Times, Music: No rockin' chairs for Bellamy Brothers, June 4, 2010</ref> The video became a major [[YouTube]] hit with almost 3 million views.<ref name=\"YouTube The Bellamy Brothers - Jalapenos\">{{cite web|title=The Bellamy Brothers - Jalapenos| date=2 June 2010 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B4j_9IQ6wzk |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/B4j_9IQ6wzk |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\nIn 2012, the Bellamy Brothers collaborated with Austrian schlager singer [[DJ \u00d6tzi]] to create the album ''Simply the Best''. It was DJ \u00d6tzi's first full English-language album, and entered the [[GfK Entertainment Charts|German album charts]] at number three.<ref name=\"All Music  DJ Otzi\">{{cite web|title=DJ \u00d6tzi / The Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/simply-the-best-mw0002352473|publisher=All Music|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref>\n\nIn June 2014, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine ranked \"[[Old Hippie]]\" #95 in their list of the 100 greatest country songs.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/100-greatest-country-songs-of-all-time-11200/|title=100 Greatest Country Songs of All Time|date=2014-06-01|magazine=Rolling Stone|language=en-US|access-date=2019-07-24}}</ref>\n\nDuring these years the brothers worked on many other collaborative song efforts as well. They recorded \"Hello, Lady Harley\" with [[Truck Stop (band)|Truck Stop]] in 2003,<ref name=\"YouTube with Truck Stop\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers & Truck Stop -- Hello, Lady Harley - Live @ Country Night Schupfart -- 24.9.2011| date=27 September 2011 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7tUmSGEEZ-Q |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/7tUmSGEEZ-Q |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref> worked with Alan Jackson in 2005,<ref name=\"Daily Motion Alan Jackson\">{{cite web|title=The Bellamy Brothers & Alan Jackson - You Ain't Just Whistling Dixie|date=23 December 2015 |url=http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x3j688y_the-bellamy-brothers-alan-jackson-you-ain-t-just-whistling-dixie_music|publisher=Daily Motion|access-date=21 December 2016}}</ref> and collaborated with Tom Astor in 2007.<ref name=\"YouTube Tom Astor\">{{cite web|title=Tom Astor, The Bellamy Brothers - I Need More Of You| date=24 October 2009 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N9dWbpatPH4 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/N9dWbpatPH4 |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\nIn April 2018, the group released the memoir ''Let Your Love Flow - The Life and Times of the Bellamy Brothers''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/let-your-love-flow-the-life-and-times-of-the-bellamy-brothers-by-david-bellamy-and-howard-bellamy|publisher=Fox News |date=April 17, 2018|title='Let Your Love Flow: The Life and Times of the Bellamy Brothers' by David Bellamy and Howard Bellamy}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.tampabay.com/news/Bellamy-Brothers-let-their-love-flow-on-Pasco-based-reality-TV-show_166871619/|publisher=Tampa Bay Times |author=Phyllis Day|date=April 3, 2018|title=Bellamy Brothers let their love flow}}</ref> The Bellamys then released their album ''Over the Moon'' in 2019, which consisted of 14 original songs written and recorded at the Bellamys' studio on their Darby ranch.<ref name=Billboard />\n\n==''Honky Tonk Ranch''==\n{{main article|Honky Tonk Ranch}}\nIn 2018 the brothers became the feature of the reality television series ''[[Honky Tonk Ranch]]'', which aired on the [[Cowboy Channel]], [[RFD-TV]] and now on the Circle Network. The series follows the Bellamys in addition to their friends and family. A second season of ''Honky Tonk Ranch'' aired in 2019.<ref name=Billboard />  In 2020, the show moved to the [[Circle (TV network)|Circle Network]] where seasons one and two aired along with season three.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://countryrebel.com/bellamy-brothers-honky-tonk-ranch-show-moves-to-brand-new-circle-network/|title=Bellamy Brothers' 'Honky Tonk Ranch' Show Moves To Brand-New Circle Network|date=13 January 2020 }}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nIn the late 1990s, David's sons Noah and Jesse became active in the music scene and the sons currently perform as the duo [[Jesse and Noah]].\n\nThe Bellamy Brothers live in Darby, Florida, on a 200-acre ranch, where they raise [[Brahman (cattle)|Brahman cattle]] and [[American Quarter Horse|quarter horses]], with three generations of their family living in the compound.<ref name=\"Stub Wire\" /> The ranch is also the location of the recording studio where much of their work is recorded.\n\nIn 2020, the brothers partnered with Florida [[medical cannabis]] company [[Trulieve]] to produce a signature line of [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]] products named \"Old Hippie Stash\".<ref>{{cite press release |date=April 9, 2020 |title=Trulieve Announces Partnership With Iconic International Duo Bellamy Brothers |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/trulieve-announces-partnership-iconic-international-160800494.html |location=Tallahassee, FL |publisher=Yahoo Finance |agency=CNW Group |access-date=April 11, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200607040702/https://finance.yahoo.com/news/trulieve-announces-partnership-iconic-international-160800494.html |archive-date=June 7, 2020 |url-status=dead}}</ref> Said David: {{Nowrap|\"[Cannabis}} has] helped Howard and me on many levels. There was a stigma for so long, but now people are talking about it seriously and considering cannabis as an alternative for stress, anxiety, pain management and many other health factors.\"<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Reuter |first1=Annie |title=Bellamy Brothers Partner With Cannabis Company Trulieve for 'Old Hippie Stash' Line: Exclusive |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/9354402/bellamy-brothers-old-hippie-stash-weed-trulieve |access-date=April 11, 2020 |magazine=Billboard |date=April 9, 2020}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{For|a complete listing of The Bellamy Brothers albums and singles|The Bellamy Brothers discography}}\n\n==Honors and awards==\n*[[Grammy Award|Grammy]] nomination for Best Country Performance by a duo or group and Best Country & Western Song (1980)<ref name=\"Awards & Shows\">{{cite web|title=Grammy Awards 1980|url=http://www.awardsandshows.com/features/grammy-awards-1980-228.html|publisher=Awards & Shows|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref>  \n*Named the Most Promising Group of the Year by CMA (1980){{citation needed|date=April 2020}}\n*Lifetime Membership of the Federation of International Country Air Personalities (1982)<ref name=\"allmusic\" />\n*Named Top Country Duo by ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' (1982){{citation needed|date=April 2020}}\n*Record for the most duo nominations in both the [[Academy of Country Music]] (ACM) and the [[Country Music Association Awards]] (CMA)<ref name=\"AXS\" /> \n*\"Let Your Love Flow\" placed on the BMI list of the top 100 most played songs of the 20th century (1999)<ref name=\"Archer 2000\">{{cite web|title=BMI Top 100 Songs of the Century|url=http://www.archer2000.net/sbs/awardsbmi.html|publisher=Archer 2000|access-date=25 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140713064201/http://www.archer2000.net/sbs/awardsbmi.html|archive-date=13 July 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name=\"BMI\">{{cite web|title=BMI Announces Top 100 Songs of the Century|date=13 December 1999|url=http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/19991214_bmi_announces_top_100_songs_of_the_century|publisher=BMI|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref>  \n*Received two [[GMA Dove Award|Dove]] nominations for \"Jesus Is Coming\"<ref name=\"Taste of Country\"/> \n*Members of the German Country Music Hall of Fame (only American members with the exception of Johnny Cash)<ref name=\"Top 40 Charts\">{{cite web|title=German Country Music Hall Of Fame says 'Gluckwunsche' to Lynn Anderson, January 29th|url=http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=12243|publisher=Top 40 Charts|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref> \n*\"Old Hippie\" named by ''Rolling Stone'' as one of its top 100 greatest country songs of all time (2014)<ref name=\"Rolling Stone\">{{cite web|title=100 Greatest Country Songs of All Time|date=June 2014|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/pictures/100-greatest-country-songs-of-all-time-20140601/95-bellamy-brothers-old-hippie-1985-0243162|publisher=Rolling Stone|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref>\n*Inducted into the [[Florida Artists Hall of Fame]] (2018)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dos.myflorida.com/cultural/programs/florida-artists-hall-of-fame/the-bellamy-brothers/|title=The Bellamy Brothers - Division of Cultural Affairs - Florida Department of State|website=dos.myflorida.com|access-date=2019-07-24}}</ref>\n\n==Tours==\nThe brothers have 200 or more concert dates worldwide each year.<ref name=\"Stub Wire\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers With Special Guest Drew Fish Band|url=http://www.stubwire.com/event/bellamybrotherswithspecialguestdrewfishband/silversaloon/terrell/13268/|publisher=Stub Wire|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref>  They have had concerts in the United States, Europe, [[Australia]] and [[South Africa]] and have been to distant (from their US base) places like [[Dubai]], [[Saudi Arabia]], [[India]], [[Sri Lanka]], [[New Caledonia]], [[Qatar]], the [[Faroe Islands]] and the [[Czech Republic]].<ref name=\"American Cowboy Magazine\">{{cite web|last1=Huff|first1=Sandy|title=Riding on a Song|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=6uoCAAAAMBAJ&q=unusual+tour+locations+for+Bellamy+brothers&pg=PA59|publisher=American Cowboy Magazine|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"AXS Playing Around World\">{{cite web|last1=Lealos|first1=Shawn S.|title=Bellamy Brothers talk about playing all over the world|url=https://www.axs.com/news/bellamy-brothers-talk-about-playing-all-over-the-world-88572|publisher=AXS|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref> In 1999, The Bellamy Brothers played for American troops stationed in [[Bosnia]], and on [[Easter Sunday]] 2000, they gave a concert for American troops in war-torn [[Kosovo]] as well as a concert at a remote camp in Macedonia. In 2014, they toured in [[India]] and [[Sri Lanka]] and made history as the first country music act touring in those Asian countries.<ref name=\"For The Country Record\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers Make Touring History \u2013 First Country Act To Tour India & Sri Lanka|url=http://forthecountryrecord.com/2014/02/20/bellamy-brothers-make-touring-history-first-country-act-to-tour-india-sri-lanka/|publisher=For The Country Record|access-date=19 December 2016}}</ref> In 2019 and 2020, the Bellamy Brothers participated in [[Blake Shelton]]'s \"Friends and Heroes Tour\".<ref name=Billboard>{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8497193/bellamy-brothers-interview-blake-shelton-tour-new-album-honky-tonk-ranch|publisher=Billboard|title=Bellamy Brothers Gear Up for Blake Shelton Tour, New Album & Second Season of 'Honky Tonk Ranch'|date=February 9, 2019 |author=Deborah Evans Price}}</ref>\n\n==Charities==\nThe brothers have traveled around the world playing benefit concerts for [[United States Armed Forces|American troops]] abroad including performances throughout [[Germany]], [[Italy]], [[Japan]], [[Guam]], [[South Korea]], [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]] and [[Kosovo]]. When they played at [[Camp Bondsteel]] in Kosovo in 2000, it was the first time that the base had allowed a band to play.<ref name=\"MTV News\">{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers To Brighten Easter For U.S. Troops In Kosovo|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/820021/bellamy-brothers-to-brighten-easter-for-us-troops-in-kosovo/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161225144917/http://www.mtv.com/news/820021/bellamy-brothers-to-brighten-easter-for-us-troops-in-kosovo/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 25, 2016|publisher=MTV News|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref> In 2011, the brothers supported [[2011 Christchurch earthquake|earthquake]] victims in [[New Zealand]] when they joined the [[New Zealand Red Cross]] and Judy Seale International to raise support through live auctions.<ref name=\"The Boot Earthquake Help\">{{cite web|last1=Dunham|first1=Nancy|title=Bellamy Brothers Reach Out to New Zealand Earthquake Victims|date=17 March 2011 |url=http://theboot.com/bellamy-brothers-new-zealand-earthquake-auction/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref> In 2016, the Bellamy Brothers partnered with the [[Susan G. Komen for the Cure|Susan G. Komen Foundation]] to release a video for \"Let Your Love Flow.\" They supported the foundation's breast cancer research by donating one dollar for every digital download of their 40 Year package.<ref name=\"Taste of Country 40 Year\">{{cite web|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=Interview: The Bellamy Brothers Still Rolling Down the Road After 40 Years|date=15 November 2015 |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/bellamy-brothers-40-years-interview/|publisher=Taste of Country|access-date=25 December 2016}}</ref>\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist}}\n\n==External links==\n* {{Official website|http://www.bellamybrothers.com/}}\n* {{Discogs artist|artist=Bellamy Brothers}}\n* {{Musicbrainz artist|id=252b5d32-5bd5-4cae-9d48-6aafa2145c33|name=Bellamy Brothers}}\n\n{{The Bellamy Brothers}}\n{{Authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Bellamy Brothers, The}}\n[[Category:Country music groups from Florida]]\n[[Category:Atlantic Records artists]]\n[[Category:Businesspeople in the cannabis industry]]\n[[Category:American country music duos]]\n[[Category:Curb Records artists]]\n[[Category:Elektra Records artists]]\n[[Category:MCA Records artists]]\n[[Category:Musical groups established in 1968]]\n[[Category:People from Pasco County, Florida]]\n[[Category:Sibling musical duos]]\n[[Category:Warner Records artists]]\n[[Category:Pasco High School (Florida) alumni]]\n[[Category:Intersound Records artists]]\n[[Category:Country pop duos]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Texas_Lightning_(band)","to":"Texas Lightning (band)"}],"pages":{"4502631":{"pageid":4502631,"ns":0,"title":"Texas Lightning (band)","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|German band}}\n{{Infobox musical artist  <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians -->\n| name                = Texas Lightning\n| image                 = Jane&Jonny.png\n| caption            = [[Jane Comerford]] and Jon Flemming Olsen\n| image_size            = <!-- Only for images narrower than 220 pixels -->\n| landscape           = yes\n| background          = group_or_band\n| alias               = \n| origin              = [[Hamburg]], [[Germany]]\n| instrument          = \n| genre               = [[Country pop]]\n| occupation          = \n| years_active        = 2000\u2013present\n| label               = \n| associated_acts     = \n| website                 = http://www.texaslightning.net\n| current_members     = [[Jane Comerford]]<br />Malte Pittner<br />Markus Schmidt<br />Uwe Frenzel<br />[[Olli Dittrich]]\n| past_members        = Chris Walther<br />Little Mick Schulz<br />Miss Susu Belle<br />Stefan Hansch<br />Larry Kils<br />Jonny Olsen\n}}\n\n'''Texas Lightning''' is a German [[quintet]] from Hamburg which fits in the [[country music]] genre and describes itself as old fashioned and hip.  Their music is a mix of country and [[Popular music|pop]] drawing from country classic stars like [[Patsy Cline]], [[Loretta Lynn]], [[Johnny Cash]] and [[Tammy Wynette]] and pop stars such as [[ABBA]], [[Nancy Sinatra]], [[Linda Ronstadt]], [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Michael Jackson]] and the [[Beatles]], performed with some country humour. The band members are [[Olli Dittrich]] as Ringofire (drums and vocals), [[Jon Flemming Olsen]] as The Flame (vocals and guitar), [[Markus Schmidt (musician)|Markus Schmidt]] as Fastfinger (electric guitar and banjo), [[Uwe Frenzel]] as Friendly (doublebass and vocals) and Australian [[Jane Comerford]] (vocals and ukulele). The band's first performance took place on December 23, 2000, in the music club \"Knust\" in [[Hamburg]], as Texas Lightning & The Rodeo Rockets, although there have been various changes in the lineup of the band since.\n\n==Eurovision Song Contest==\nOn March 9, 2006, Texas Lightning won the German heat for the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2006]] and represented Germany in the Finals on May 20, 2006, in [[Athens]], [[Greece]].  The winning song was \"[[No No Never]]\", written and composed by Jane Comerford.{{Citation needed|date=May 2022}} They became the first country band to participate in the ESC.  The song finished 14th place with 36 points.\n\n\"No No Never\" was released as a single in Germany, Austria and Switzerland.  It reached number 1 on the German [[Media Control Charts]], number 4 in Austria and number 6 in Switzerland.\n\n== Honorary Texas Citizenship ==\nThrough a nomination by Steve Sivek of [[Baytown, Texas]] and the submittal by [[Texas Senate|Texas State Senator]] [[Tommy Williams (Texas politician)|Tommy Williams]], the members of Texas Lightning were, by Proclamation 603 before the Texas Senate, declared to be Honorary Texans. The proclamation was passed by the senate in June 2006.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Klier |first=Marcus |date=2006-08-25 |title=Eurovision Texas Lightning become honorary citizens - in Texas! - ESCToday.com |url=https://esctoday.com/6353/texas_lightning_become_honorary_citizens_-_in_texas/ |access-date=2022-05-30 |website=Eurovision News, Polls and Information by ESCToday |language=en-US}}</ref>\n\n== Discography ==\n=== Album ===\n*2006 \"[[Meanwhile, Back at the Ranch (album)|Meanwhile, Back at the Ranch]]\" (Gold Status)\n*2009 \"[[Western Bound]]\"\n\n=== Singles ===\n*2005 \"Like a Virgin\"\n*2006 \"No No Never\" (Platinum Status)\n*2006 \"I Promise\"\n*2009 \"Seven Ways to Heaven\"\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist}}\n\n== External links ==\n{{Commons category-inline|Texas Lightning}}\n* [http://www.texaslightning.net Texas Lightning] website in German and English\n\n{{s-start}}\n{{succession box\n| before=[[Gracia Baur|Gracia]]<br>with ''[[Run & Hide (Gracia Baur song)|Run & Hide]]''\n| title=[[Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest]]\n| years='''[[Eurovision Song Contest 2006|2006]]'''\n| after=[[Roger Cicero]]<br>with ''[[Frauen regier'n die Welt]]''\n}}\n{{s-end}}\n{{Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest|state=autocollapse}}\n{{Eurovision Song Contest 2006|state=autocollapse}}\n{{Authority control}}\n\n[[Category:German country music groups]]\n[[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants for Germany]]\n[[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 2006]]\n[[Category:Musical groups from Hamburg]]\n[[Category:Culture in Hamburg]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. (born 1990)}}\n{{good article}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2022}}\n{{Infobox person\n| name               = Maren Morris\n| image              = Maren Morris 2019 by Glenn Francis.jpg\n| caption
