<https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Dan_+_Shay","to":"Dan + Shay"}],"pages":{"40936513":{"pageid":40936513,"ns":0,"title":"Dan + Shay","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American pop music duo}}\n{{For|the duo's 2018 album|Dan + Shay (album){{!}}''Dan + Shay'' (album)}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Dan + Shay\n| image           = Dan + Shay in 2017.jpg\n| caption         = Dan + Shay performing in 2017\n| alt             = Dan + Shay performing on stage.\n| image_size      =\n| landscape       = yes \n| origin          = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S.\n| genre           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Country music|Country]]\n* [[country pop]]\n* [[Pop music|pop]]\n}}\n| discography    = [[Dan + Shay discography]]\n| years_active    = 2013\u2013present\n| label           = [[Warner Records|Warner Music Nashville]]\n| current_members = \n* Dan Smyers\n* Shay Mooney\n}}\n\n'''Dan + Shay''' is an American [[country music]] duo composed of vocalists and songwriters Dan Smyers and Shay Mooney.<ref>{{cite web|first=Sarah|last=Wyland|url=http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2013/10/16/dan-shay-release-debut-single-to-country-radio/|title=Dan + Shay Release Debut Single To Country Radio &#124; Great American Country|publisher=Blog.gactv.com|date=October 16, 2013|access-date=July 29, 2015|archive-date=November 2, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102043353/http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2013/10/16/dan-shay-release-debut-single-to-country-radio/|url-status=dead}}</ref> They are signed to [[Warner Records|Warner Records Nashville]] and have released five albums, ''[[Where It All Began (Dan + Shay album)|Where It All Began]]'', ''[[Obsessed (Dan + Shay album)|Obsessed]]'', ''[[Dan + Shay (album)|Dan + Shay]]'', ''[[Good Things (Dan + Shay album)|Good Things]]'' and ''[[Bigger Houses]]''. Of their nine singles, five have topped the [[Country Airplay]] chart and three have topped the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart. The duo have collaborated with [[Justin Bieber]], [[Charlie Puth]], [[Rascal Flatts]], [[Lindsey Stirling]], [[RaeLynn]], and [[Kelly Clarkson]]. From 2019 to 2021, the duo won three consecutive [[Grammy Award for Best Country Duo/Group Performance|Grammy Awards for Best Country Duo/Group Performance]] for the songs \"[[Tequila (Dan + Shay song)|Tequila]]\", \"[[Speechless (Dan + Shay song)|Speechless]]\", and \"[[10,000 Hours]]\" (with Justin Bieber).\n\n==Career==\n===2013\u20132015: ''Where It All Began''===\n{{Main|Where It All Began (Dan + Shay album)|l1=''Where It All Began'' (Dan + Shay album)}}\nBefore the duo's foundation, Mooney was a solo artist on [[T-Pain]]'s [[Nappy Boy Entertainment]] label and Smyers was a member of a group called Bonaventure as well as a previous member of the band Transition on [[Floodgate Records]].<ref name=\"taste\">{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-19-you-and-me/|title=Dan + Shay, '19 You + Me' [Listen&#93;|work=Taste of Country|date=October 16, 2013|access-date=July 29, 2015|archive-date=September 3, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200903024511/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-19-you-and-me/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\">{{cite web|first=Grace|last=Lenehan Vaughn|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/10-things-you-may-not-know-about-dan-shay/|title=10 Things You May Not Know About Dan + Shay|work=Sounds Like Nashville|date=August 24, 2021|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206184314/https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/10-things-you-may-not-know-about-dan-shay/|url-status=live}}</ref> The two met in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], in December 2012 at Dan's house during a party.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web|first=Christina|last=Vinson|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/how-did-dan-and-shay-meet/|title=Dan-Shay Reveal How They Met ... in a Living Room Tent|work=Taste of Country|date=November 10, 2013|access-date=May 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131111040255/https://tasteofcountry.com/how-did-dan-and-shay-meet/|archive-date=November 11, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> There they would perform together for the first time and started writing the day after they met.<ref name=\"5 Things\">{{cite news|first=Jess|last=Cohen|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1025796/5-things-you-didn-t-know-about-dan-shay|title=5 Things You Didn't Know About Dan + Shay|work=[[E!]]|date=April 5, 2019|access-date=February 6, 2022}}</ref> The first song they ever wrote together got put on hold for [[Rascal Flatts]]. Within two months, the duo had multiple publishing offers and signed with [[Warner/Chappell Music]].<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Andrew|last=Hampp|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/5785939/inside-guy-oseary-and-paul-mcguinness-30m-live-nation-deal-new-roles-more|title=Inside Guy Oseary and Paul McGuinness' $30M Live Nation Deal|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=November 13, 2013|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=June 7, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190607162328/https://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/5785939/inside-guy-oseary-and-paul-mcguinness-30m-live-nation-deal-new-roles-more|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nOn October 14, 2013, the debut single, \"[[19 You + Me]]\", was released to country radio.<ref name=\"taste\"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=7471|title=Dan + Shay offer debut single|work=[[Country Standard Time]]|date=October 15, 2013|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-date=May 17, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230517025347/https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=7471|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|first=Gary|last=Trust|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5762985/bubbling-under-glee-star-naya-rivera-graduates-to-first-solo-hit|title=Bubbling Under: 'Glee' Star Naya Rivera Graduates To First Solo Hit|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=October 18, 2013|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-date=September 22, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200922063533/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5762985/bubbling-under-glee-star-naya-rivera-graduates-to-first-solo-hit|url-status=live}}</ref>  Dan + Shay wrote the song with Danny Orton. The song received a positive review at ''[[Taste of Country]]'' which praised the \"warm details\" and \"emotion\".<ref name=\"taste\"/> Their debut album, ''[[Where It All Began (Dan + Shay album)|Where It All Began]]'',<ref>{{cite web|first=Hannahlee|last=Allers|url=http://theboot.com/dan-shay-where-it-all-began-cover-track-listing/|title=Dan + Shay Reveal Title, Cover + Track Listing for Debut|work=The Boot|date=February 13, 2014|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=December 5, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191205131103/https://theboot.com/dan-shay-where-it-all-began-cover-track-listing/|url-status=live}}</ref> was released on April 1, 2014,<ref>{{cite web|first=Mark|last=Deming|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/where-it-all-began-mw0002621058|title=''Where It All Began'' - Dan + Shay|date=March 30, 2014|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231349/https://www.allmusic.com/album/where-it-all-began-mw0002621058|url-status=live}}</ref> which Orton produced with [[Scott Hendricks]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.warnermusicnashville.com/news/2014-acm-award-nominees-dan-shay-to-release-debut-album-april-1st-on-warner-bros-records|title=2014 ACM Award Nominees Dan + Shay to Release Debut Album April 1st on Warner Bros. Records'|work=Warner Music Nashville|date=February 4, 2014|access-date=February 6, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222221340/http://www.warnermusicnashville.com/news/2014-acm-award-nominees-dan-shay-to-release-debut-album-april-1st-on-warner-bros-records|archive-date=February 22, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album's second single, \"[[Show You Off]]\", was released to country radio on May 12, 2014.<ref name=\"Show You Off Adds\">{{cite web|url=http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/PublishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=05/12/2014&Format=4|title=R&R :: Going For Adds :: Country|work=[[Radio & Records]]|access-date=April 28, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140429044230/http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/PublishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=05%2F12%2F2014&Format=4|archive-date=April 29, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> They performed on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'', performing \"19 You + Me\" in 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-awarded-gold-certification-19/|title=Dan + Shay Awarded Gold Certification For '19 You + Me'|work=Sounds Like Nashville|date=April 28, 2014|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206213757/https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-awarded-gold-certification-19/|url-status=live}}</ref> They made their ''[[Grand Ole Opry]]'' debut on February 1, 2014.<ref name=\":1\">{{cite web|url=http://www.opry.com/artist/dan-shay|title=Dan + Shay Grand Ole Opry'|work=Opry|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150112145753/http://www.opry.com/artist/dan-shay|archive-date=January 12, 2015|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Mark|last=Deming|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-release-debut-album-april-1/|title=Dan + Shay to Release Debut Album on April 1|work=Sound Like Nashville|date=February 4, 2014|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-date=November 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221111202347/https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-release-debut-album-april-1/|url-status=live}}</ref> They also received a 2014 [[Academy of Country Music Awards]] Vocal Duo of the Year nomination.<ref name=\"January 29, 2014\">{{cite web|url=http://www.acmawards.com/nominees/|title=ACM Awards Nominees'|publisher=acmcountry.com/|date=January 29, 2014|access-date=January 29, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140215094941/http://www.acmawards.com/nominees/|archive-date=February 15, 2014}}</ref> The album's third single, \"[[Nothin' Like You]]\", was released to country radio on February 23, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|first=Dayne|last=Shuda|url=https://countrymusiclife.com/nothin-like-you-by-dan-shay-danandshay/|title=Nothin' Like You by Dan + Shay (@DanAndShay)|work=Country Music Life|date=February 23, 2015|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206213803/https://countrymusiclife.com/nothin-like-you-by-dan-shay-danandshay/|url-status=live}}</ref> It reached number one on the [[Country Airplay]] chart in December 2015.<ref>{{cite web|first=Edward|last=Morris|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1763823/dan-shay-revel-in-their-first-no-1-nothin-like-you/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160318201048/http://www.cmt.com/news/1763823/dan-shay-revel-in-their-first-no-1-nothin-like-you/|url-status=dead|archive-date=March 18, 2016|title=Dan + Shay Revel in Their First No. 1, \"Nothin' Like You\"|work=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]]|date=March 17, 2016|access-date=February 6, 2022}}</ref>\n\nDan + Shay was the opening act for [[Hunter Hayes]] on his [[We're Not Invisible Tour]], which began in March 2014.<ref name=\"We're Not Invisible Tour 2014\">{{cite web|first=Sterling|last=Whitaker|url=https://theboot.com/hunter-hayes-2014-were-not-invisible-tour-dates/|title=Hunter Hayes Announces 2014 We're Not Invisible Tour|work=The Boot|date=January 27, 2014|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206213801/https://theboot.com/hunter-hayes-2014-were-not-invisible-tour-dates/|url-status=live}}</ref> Dan + Shay opened for [[Blake Shelton]] on the 2014 leg of his [[Ten Times Crazier Tour]]. The tour began in June 2014 and ended in October 2014.<ref name=\"blakeshelton 2014 tour\">{{cite web|url=http://www.blakeshelton.com/news/blake-announces-ten-times-crazier-tour-433701|title=Blake Announces Ten Times Crazier Tour'|publisher=BlakeShelton.com|date=January 17, 2014|access-date=January 17, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140120051827/http://www.blakeshelton.com/news/blake-announces-ten-times-crazier-tour-433701|archive-date=January 20, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> Following the end of the [[Ten Times Crazier Tour]], Dan + Shay embarked on their own 10-date headlining tour, the Where It All Began Tour.<ref name=\"2014 tour\">{{cite web|first=Sarah|last=Wyland|url=http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2014/05/24/dan-shay-announce-where-it-all-began-tour/|title=Dan + Shay Announce Where It All Began Tour|work=Great American Country|date=May 24, 2014|access-date=August 13, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140525235333/http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2014/05/24/dan-shay-announce-where-it-all-began-tour/|archive-date=May 25, 2014}}</ref><ref name=\"Where It All Began Tour 2014\">{{cite web|first=Carrie|last=Horton|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-shay-where-it-all-began-tour/|title=Dan + Shay Announce Where It All Began Tour|work=Taste of Country|date=May 20, 2014|access-date=February 10, 2022|archive-date=February 10, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220210195752/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-shay-where-it-all-began-tour/|url-status=live}}</ref> The tour began on October 9, 2014, in [[Minneapolis]] and concluded in [[Columbus, Ohio]], on October 26, 2014.<ref name=\"2014 tour\"/> After the conclusion of the \"Where It All Began Tour\", Dan + Shay set out on the road once more with [[Hunter Hayes]] on his [[Tattoo (Your Name) Tour]].<ref name=\"Tattoo Tour 2014\">{{cite magazine|first=Chuck|last=Dauphin|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/hunter-hayes-talks-tattoo-your-name-tour-collaborations-more-during-cma-awards-week-6312137/|title=Hunter Hayes Talks Tattoo Your Name Tour, Collaborations & More During CMA Awards Week|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=November 8, 2014|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206213800/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/hunter-hayes-talks-tattoo-your-name-tour-collaborations-more-during-cma-awards-week-6312137/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2015\u20132017: ''Obsessed''===\n{{Main|Obsessed (Dan + Shay album)|l1=''Obsessed'' (Dan + Shay album)}}\nIn August 2015, the duo announced the Just the Right Kind of Crazy Tour across the Midwest and eastern United States.<ref name=\"2015 tour\">{{cite web|first=Philip|last=Cosores|url=http://radio.com/2015/08/10/dan-shay-just-the-right-kind-of-crazy-tour/|title=Dan + Shay Announce 'Just The Right Kind of Crazy' Tour| publisher=Radio.com|date=August 13, 2015|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304113433/http://radio.com/2015/08/10/dan-shay-just-the-right-kind-of-crazy-tour/|archive-date=March 4, 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> Their second album's first single, \"[[From the Ground Up (song)|From the Ground Up]]\", was released to country radio in February 2016. On June 3, 2016, the duo released their second studio album, ''[[Obsessed (Dan + Shay album)|Obsessed]]''.<ref name=\"AllMusic Obsessed\">{{cite web|first=Stephen Thomas|last=Erlewine|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/obsessed-mw0002940668|title=Dan + Shay Obsessed|publisher=AllMusic|access-date=February 7, 2022|archive-date=February 8, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220208034000/https://www.allmusic.com/album/obsessed-mw0002940668|url-status=live}}</ref> The album's second single, \"[[How Not To]]\", was released to country radio on September 26, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allaccess.com/country/future-releases|title=Future Release for Country Radio Stations|publisher=All Access Media Group|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160914072608/http://www.allaccess.com/country/future-releases|archive-date=September 14, 2016}}</ref> The duo joined [[Darius Rucker]] on his Good for a Good Time Tour from June - September 2016.<ref name=\"Good for a Good Time Tour 2016\">{{cite web|first=Angela|last=Stefano|url=https://theboot.com/darius-rucker-dan-and-shay-michael-ray-2016-good-for-a-good-time-tour/|title=Darius Rucker Invites Dan + Shay, Michael Ray for 2016 Good for a Good Time Tour|work=The Boot|date=January 20, 2016|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212035316/https://theboot.com/darius-rucker-dan-and-shay-michael-ray-2016-good-for-a-good-time-tour/|url-status=live}}</ref> In November 2016, the duo started their The Obsessed Tour and continued to support it until April 2017.<ref name=\"The Obsessed Tour 2016-2017\">{{cite web|first=Annie|last=Reuter|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-2017-obsessed-tour-dates/|title=Dan + Shay Extend Obsessed Tour into 2017|work=Taste of Country|date=November 16, 2016|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231349/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-2017-obsessed-tour-dates/|url-status=live}}</ref> It reached number one on the Country Airplay chart in July 2017. The album's third single, \"[[Road Trippin' (Dan + Shay song)|Road Trippin']]\", was released to country radio on July 17, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|first=Billy|last=Dukes|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-road-trippin/|title=Dan + Shay, 'Road Trippin'<nowiki/>' [Listen]|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=June 20, 2017|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-date=February 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220202222048/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-road-trippin/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2017, the duo supported [[Thomas Rhett]] on his [[Home Team Tour]].<ref name=\"Home Team Tour\">{{cite web|first=Jim|last=Casey|url=https://www.thecountrydaily.com/2017/06/20/thomas-rhett-extends-his-home-team-tour-with-more-fall-dates/|title=Thomas Rhett Extends His Home Team Tour With More Fall Dates|work=The Country Daily|date=June 20, 2017|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212035316/https://www.thecountrydaily.com/2017/06/20/thomas-rhett-extends-his-home-team-tour-with-more-fall-dates/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2018: ''Dan + Shay''===\n{{Main|Dan + Shay (album)|l1=''Dan + Shay'' (album)}}\nIn January 2018, it was announced that the duo joined [[Rascal Flatts]] on the Back to Us Tour.<ref name=\"The Back to Us Tour\">{{cite web|first=Annie|last=Reuter|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/rascal-flatts-tour-dates-2018-back-to-us/|title=Rascal Flatts Book 2018 With Back to Us Tour Featuring Carly Pearce, Dan + Shay|work=Taste of Country|date=January 10, 2018|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212035316/https://tasteofcountry.com/rascal-flatts-tour-dates-2018-back-to-us/|url-status=live}}</ref> In January 2018, the duo released \"[[Tequila (Dan + Shay song)|Tequila]]\", the lead single from their [[Dan + Shay (album)|self-titled third studio album]],<ref name=\"rolling stone\">{{cite magazine|first=Stephen L.|last=Betts|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/dan-shays-tequila-hear-new-song-w515288|title=Hear Dan + Shay's Forlorn New Song 'Tequila'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=January 10, 2018|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180110181330/https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/dan-shays-tequila-hear-new-song-w515288|archive-date=January 10, 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref> which was released on June 22, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|first=Stephen Thomas|last=Erlewine|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/dan-shay-mw0003180156|title=''Dan + Shay''|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-date=June 29, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180629022311/https://www.allmusic.com/album/dan-shay-mw0003180156|url-status=live}}</ref> \"Tequila\" has since become their highest-charting song on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], with it reaching the top 40.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Gary|last=Trust|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8459439/selena-gomez-maroon-5-hot-100-chart-moves|title=Hot 100 Chart Moves: Selena Gomez's 'Back to You' Hits Top 40, Maroon 5's 'Girls Like You' Debuts|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=June 5, 2018|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180609161629/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8459439/selena-gomez-maroon-5-hot-100-chart-moves|archive-date=June 9, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> On August 6, 2018, the duo released the second single from the album \"[[Speechless (Dan + Shay song)|Speechless]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/calendars-2/single-releases/|title=Single Releases : MusicRow|work=[[MusicRow]]|access-date=August 23, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180717182211/https://musicrow.com/calendars-2/single-releases/|archive-date=July 17, 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album also features a collaboration with [[Kelly Clarkson]] on \"Keeping Score\".<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Jon|last=Freeman|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/hear-dan-and-shay-kelly-clarksons-sweeping-duet-keeping-score-628827/|title=Hear Dan and Shay, Kelly Clarkson's Sweeping Duet 'Keeping Score'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 15, 2018|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200605150415/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/hear-dan-and-shay-kelly-clarksons-sweeping-duet-keeping-score-628827/|archive-date=June 5, 2020|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Sterling|last=Whitaker|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-kelly-clarkson-keeping-score/|title=Hear Dan + Shay Shine on New Kelly Clarkson Collaboration, 'Keeping Score'|work=Taste of Country|date=June 15, 2018|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-date=November 13, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221113005112/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-kelly-clarkson-keeping-score/|url-status=live}}</ref> From October to December the duo supported [[Chris Young (singer)|Chris Young]] on his Losing Sleep World Tour.<ref name=\"Losing Sleep World Tour\">{{cite magazine|first=Jeff|last=Gage|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/chris-young-extends-2018-losing-sleep-world-tour-665996/|title=Chris Young Extends 2018 Losing Sleep World Tour|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 20, 2018|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201203020905/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/chris-young-extends-2018-losing-sleep-world-tour-665996/|archive-date=December 3, 2020|url-status=live}}</ref> On February 11, 2019, the duo released the third single from the album \"[[All to Myself (Dan + Shay song)|All to Myself]]\".<ref>{{cite web|first=Billy|last=Dukes|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-all-to-myself/|title=Dan + Shay's 'All to Myself' is another honest love song, with a twist [listen]|work=Taste of Country|date=January 31, 2019|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-date=February 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220202171452/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-all-to-myself/|url-status=live}}</ref> In August, they released ''Dan + Shay (The Vocals)'', which includes the vocal tracks of the two singles from the album.<ref>{{cite web|first=Angela|last=Stefano|url=https://theboot.com/dan-and-shay-isolated-vocals-tequila/|title=Dan + Shay's 'Tequila' Isolated Vocal Track Is Pitch-Perfect|work=The Boot|date=August 9, 2018|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-date=November 13, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221113005123/https://theboot.com/dan-and-shay-isolated-vocals-tequila/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2019\u20132023: ''Good Things''===\n{{Main|Good Things (Dan + Shay album)|l1=''Good Things'' (Dan + Shay album)}}\nFrom February to April, the duo went on their 2019 Dan + Shay Tour.<ref name=\"2019 Headlining Tour\">{{cite web|first=Annie|last=Reuter|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-2019-headlining-tour-dates/|title=Dan + Shay Announce 2019 Headlining Tour|work=Taste of Country|date=October 22, 2018|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212035314/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-2019-headlining-tour-dates/|url-status=live}}</ref> On March 27, 2019, it was announced that the duo would join [[Shawn Mendes]] in Australia and New Zealand on his [[Shawn Mendes: The Tour|2019 tour]].<ref name=\"Shawn Mendes Tour\">{{cite magazine|first=Tallie|last=Spencer|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/shawn-mendes-dan-and-shay-ruel-australia-new-zealand-tour-8504457/|title=Shawn Mendes Adds Dan + Shay, Ruel as Australia & New Zealand Tour Openers|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=March 27, 2019|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212035314/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/shawn-mendes-dan-and-shay-ruel-australia-new-zealand-tour-8504457/|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 4, 2019, they released \"[[10,000 Hours]]\", a collaboration with Canadian singer [[Justin Bieber]], after his and [[Hailey Bieber]]'s wedding in South Carolina four days before.<ref>{{cite magazine|first1=Melinda|last1=Newman|first2=Taylor|last2=Weatherby|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8531925/justin-bieber-dan-shay-song|title=Dan + Shay and Justin Bieber to Release New Single Together: Exclusive Details|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=October 2, 2019|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-date=October 4, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191004235214/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8531925/justin-bieber-dan-shay-song|url-status=live}}</ref> The song debuted at number 4 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Billboard Hot 100|Hot 100]] and also won the Grammy Award for Best Country Duo/Group Performance. The duo co-wrote [[Eric Ethridge]]'s 2020 single \"[[Dream Girl (Eric Ethridge song)|Dream Girl]]\".<ref>{{cite web|first=Cillea|last=Houghton|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/eric-ethridges-dream-girl-dan-and-shay/|title=Eric Ethridge's 'Dream Girl' Becomes a Precious Memory in Dan + Shay-Penned Single [Exclusive Premiere]|work=Taste of Country|date=February 20, 2020|access-date=January 5, 2021|archive-date=January 9, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210109110711/https://tasteofcountry.com/eric-ethridges-dream-girl-dan-and-shay/|url-status=live}}</ref> From June to September 2019, the duo supported [[Florida Georgia Line]] on their [[Can't Say I Ain't Country Tour]].<ref name=\"Can't Say I Ain't Country Tour\">{{cite web|first=Sterling|last=Whitaker|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/florida-georgia-line-2019-cant-say-i-aint-country-tour-dates/|title=Florida Georgia Line Announce 2019 Can't Say I Ain't Country Tour|work=Taste of Country|date=January 9, 2019|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212035315/https://tasteofcountry.com/florida-georgia-line-2019-cant-say-i-aint-country-tour-dates/|url-status=live}}</ref> In October 2019, the duo announced their Dan + Shay [[The (Arena) Tour]] originally set to start in March 2020.<ref name=\"The (Arena) Tour\">{{cite magazine|first=Brittany|last=Spanos|author-link=Brittany Spanos|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-shay-2020-tour-dates-895150/|title=Dan + Shay Announce Massive 2020 'The (Arena) Tour'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=October 7, 2019|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210305174340/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-shay-2020-tour-dates-895150/|archive-date=March 5, 2021|url-status=live}}</ref> [[The Band Camino]] and [[Ingrid Andress]] were announced as opening acts.<ref>{{cite web|first=Logan|last=White|url=https://substreammagazine.com/2019/12/dan-shay-camino-ingrid-tour/|title=Dan + Shay add The Band Camino + Ingrid Andress to spring tour|work=Substream Magazine|date=December 13, 2019|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221112173857/https://substreammagazine.com/2019/12/dan-shay-camino-ingrid-tour/|url-status=live}}</ref> On March 12, 2020, after performing in Columbus, the duo announced the tour would be postponed to summer and fall 2020.<ref name=\"Postponed\">{{cite magazine|first=Annie|last=Reuter|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/touring/9333671/dan-shay-postpone-tour-new-dates|title=Dan + Shay Reschedule 2020 Spring Tour: See the New Dates|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=March 12, 2020|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=April 10, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200410145750/https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/touring/9333671/dan-shay-postpone-tour-new-dates|url-status=live}}</ref> Dates were postponed again to 2021, which also led to some cancellations after they were unable to reschedule from 2020 postponements.<ref name=\"Postponed2\">{{cite web|first=Billy|last=Dukes|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-2021-arena-tour-dates/|title=Dan + Shay Announce 2021 the Arena Tour Dates|work=Taste of Country|date=August 11, 2020|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212040737/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-2021-arena-tour-dates/|url-status=live}}</ref> On July 31, 2020, the duo released the second single from the album, \"[[I Should Probably Go to Bed]]\".<ref>{{cite web|first=Alison|last=Bonaguro|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1823577/listen-dan-shay-release-i-should-probably-go-to-bed/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200801020056/http://www.cmt.com/news/1823577/listen-dan-shay-release-i-should-probably-go-to-bed/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 1, 2020|title=Listen: Dan + Shay Release \"I Should Probably Go to Bed\"|work=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]]|date=July 31, 2020|access-date=February 2, 2022}}</ref> On February 5, 2021, they released the third single from the album, \"[[Glad You Exist]]\".<ref>{{cite web|first=Tom\u00e1s|last=Mier|url=https://people.com/country/dan-shay-drop-glad-you-exist-reminder-of-gratitude/|title=Dan + Shay Drop 'Glad You Exist' as a Reminder of 'How Grateful We Are' for Fans and Family|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=February 5, 2021|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-date=August 18, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210818212218/https://people.com/country/dan-shay-drop-glad-you-exist-reminder-of-gratitude/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|first=Jon|last=Freeman|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-and-shay-glad-you-exist-1124238/|title=Dan + Shay Give Thanks in New Song 'Glad You Exist'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=February 5, 2021|access-date=February 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210613080147/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-and-shay-glad-you-exist-1124238/|archive-date=June 13, 2021|url-status=live}}</ref> On July 16, 2021, the duo announced their fourth album ''Good Things'' while releasing the album's title track \"[[Good Things (Dan + Shay song)|Good Things]]\" as a single and revealing the album's release date of August 13, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|first=Abigail|last=Adams|url=https://people.com/country/dan-shay-announce-album-good-things/|title=Dan + Shay to Drop Album 'Good Things' Next Month: 'We Poured Every Bit of Our Hearts Into This'|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=July 16, 2021|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221112173856/https://people.com/country/dan-shay-announce-album-good-things/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Chris|last=Parton|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-fourth-studio-album-good-things/|title=Dan + Shay Reveal Details of Fourth Studio Album, 'Good Things'|work=Sounds Like Nashville|date=July 16, 2021|access-date=July 20, 2021|archive-date=July 19, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210719141143/https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-fourth-studio-album-good-things/|url-status=live}}</ref> On August 16, 2021, \"[[Steal My Love]]\" was released as the album's fourth single.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Joseph|last=Hudak|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-and-shay-steal-my-love-video-1213957/|title=Dan + Shay Rob a Bank, Lead a Group Dance in 'Steal My Love' Video|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=August 18, 2021|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221112173855/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-and-shay-steal-my-love-video-1213957/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Billy|last=Dukes|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-steal-my-love/|title=Dan + Shay's 'Steal My Love' Furthers Boy Band Sound [Listen]|work=Taste of Country|date=August 13, 2021|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-date=November 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221112173855/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-steal-my-love/|url-status=live}}</ref> In August 2021, the duo collaborated with [[Carrie Underwood]] on a cover of \"[[Only Us (Dear Evan Hansen song)|Only Us]]\" from ''[[Dear Evan Hansen]]'', which they recorded for the soundtrack album of the musical's [[Dear Evan Hansen (film)|2021 film adaptation]].<ref name=\"Dear Evan Hansen 1\">{{cite web|first=Marcus K.|last=Dowling|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1837541/carrie-underwood-dan-shay-collaborate-on-new-single-only-us/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210901215258/http://www.cmt.com/news/1837541/carrie-underwood-dan-shay-collaborate-on-new-single-only-us/|url-status=dead|archive-date=September 1, 2021|title=Carrie Underwood, Dan + Shay Collaborate On New Single \"Only Us\"|work=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]]|date=September 1, 2021|access-date=September 4, 2021}}</ref><ref name=\"Dear Evan Hansen 2\">{{cite web|first=Billy|last=Dukes|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/carrie-underwood-dan-and-shay-only-us-dear-evan-hansen/|title=Carrie Underwood, Dan + Shay Team Up for 'Only Us,' From the 'Dear Evan Hansen' Movie Soundtrack [Listen]|work=Taste of Country|date=September 3, 2021|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=February 12, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212040734/https://tasteofcountry.com/carrie-underwood-dan-and-shay-only-us-dear-evan-hansen/|url-status=live}}</ref> It was released as a single on September 3, 2021.<ref name=\"Dear Evan Hansen 1\"/><ref name=\"Dear Evan Hansen 2\"/> On November 2, 2021, the duo revealed they had to cancel two shows, in Orlando and Atlanta, on their Dan + Shay The (Arena) Tour due to a positive COVID-19 test within their touring camp.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Jessica|last=Nicholson|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/9654520/dan-and-shay-cancel-concerts-covid-19/|title=Dan + Shay Cancel Two Arena Concerts Due to COVID-19|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=November 2, 2021|access-date=November 2, 2021|archive-date=November 2, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211102224721/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/9654520/dan-and-shay-cancel-concerts-covid-19/|url-status=live}}</ref> On July 18, 2022, \"[[You (Dan + Shay song)|You]]\" was released as the album's fifth single.<ref>{{cite web|author=Grace Lenehan Vaughn|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-shay-you-speechless-part-two/|title=Dan + Shay's Latest Single, 'You,' Picks Up Where 'Speechless' Left Off|work=Taste of Country|date=July 23, 2022|access-date=November 12, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231350/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-shay-you-speechless-part-two/|url-status=live}}</ref> On March 31, 2023, Dan + Shay were featured on the single \"[[That's Not How This Works]]\" by American singer-songwriter [[Charlie Puth]], which was their first song to be featured on.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Jack|last=Irvin|url=https://people.com/music/dan-shay-charlie-puth-release-thats-not-how-it-works-sabrina-carpenter-music-video/|title=Dan + Shay Team Up with Charlie Puth for New Breakup Song \u2014 and Sabrina Carpenter Stars in the Video|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=March 31, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-date=August 9, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230809192459/https://people.com/music/dan-shay-charlie-puth-release-thats-not-how-it-works-sabrina-carpenter-music-video/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Jeremy|last=Chua|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-shay-charlie-puth-thats-not-how-this-works/|title=Dan + Shay join Charlie Puth On New Breakup Song, 'That's Not How This Works'|work=Taste of Country|date=March 31, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-date=July 14, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230714042017/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-shay-charlie-puth-thats-not-how-this-works/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2023\u2013present: ''Bigger Houses''===\nIn July 2023, Dan + Shay revealed that they almost broke up after their 2021 tour. Dan Smyers stated, \"I was in, like, the lowest low of my entire life. Came off the road, and I was like, 'Man, I f---ing hate music. I'm ready to quit\".<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Jack|last=Irvin|url=https://people.com/dan-shay-almost-broke-up-after-wrapping-2021-tour-7558768|title=Dan + Shay Reveal They Almost Broke Up After Wrapping 2021 Tour: 'We Let Things Get in the Way'|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=July 10, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-date=July 14, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230714041540/https://people.com/dan-shay-almost-broke-up-after-wrapping-2021-tour-7558768|url-status=live}}</ref> They also confirmed their fifth studio album, ''[[Bigger Houses]]'' and released three singles, \"[[Save Me the Trouble]]\", \"Bigger Houses\", and \"Heartbreak on the Map\" on July 14, 2023. The album was released on September 15, 2023.<ref>{{cite web|first=Billy|last=Dukes|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-bigger-houses-album/|title=Dan + Shay Announce New ''Bigger Houses'' Album|work=Taste of Country|date=July 13, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-date=July 14, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230714013511/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-bigger-houses-album/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n==In popular culture==\nThe Dan + Shay song \"Stop Drop + Roll\" was featured on the ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]'' season two episode \"Your Good Girl's Gonna Go Bad\".<ref>{{cite web|first=Megan|last=Spinelli|url=https://tvline.com/2014/05/03/songs-from-parks-and-recreation-the-blacklist-nashville-tvline-mixtape-music/|title=TVLine Mixtape: Your Favorite Songs From TVD, Parks and Rec, The Blacklist, Nashville and More|work=[[TVLine]]|date=May 3, 2014|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206090101/https://tvline.com/2014/05/03/songs-from-parks-and-recreation-the-blacklist-nashville-tvline-mixtape-music/|url-status=live}}</ref> They were also featured on ''[[The Bachelorette (American TV series)|The Bachelorette]]'' in an episode that aired on June 7, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|first=Nicholas|last=Rees|url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/dan-shay-dish-about-their-bachelorette-experience-w209233/|title=Country Singers Dan + Shay Dish About The Bachelorette's Jordan Rodgers and Luke \u2014 Watch!|work=[[Us Weekly|US Magazine]]|date=June 7, 2016|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206090101/https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/dan-shay-dish-about-their-bachelorette-experience-w209233/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nThe duo also collaborated with violinist, dancer, and YouTuber [[Lindsey Stirling]] on a song from her third album ''[[Brave Enough]]''.<ref name=\"abcnewsradioonline1\">{{cite web|url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2016/6/28/lindsey-stirling-enlists-christina-perri-for-new-album-brave.html|title=Lindsey Stirling Enlists Christina Perri for New Album, \"Brave Enough\" - Music News - ABC News Radio|work=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|date=June 28, 2016|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=September 17, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160917022343/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2016/6/28/lindsey-stirling-enlists-christina-perri-for-new-album-brave.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song was entitled \"Those Days\", and the album was released on August 19, 2016.<ref name=\"abcnewsradioonline1\"/> In 2017, the duo were featured on ''[[CMT Crossroads]]'', along with [[Earth, Wind & Fire]].<ref name=\"CMT Crossroads 2017\">{{cite magazine|first=Jon|last=Gugala|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/see-darius-rucker-earth-wind-fires-funky-shining-star-on-crossroads-193862/|title=See Darius Rucker, Earth, Wind & Fire's Funky 'Shining Star' on 'Crossroads'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 28, 2017|access-date=February 7, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221105124054/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/see-darius-rucker-earth-wind-fires-funky-shining-star-on-crossroads-193862/|archive-date=November 5, 2022|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn 2018, the duo was featured on ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]'' with [[Chevel Shepherd]].<ref name=\"The Voice 2018\">{{cite news|first=Susan|last=Haas|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/tv/2018/12/18/voice-chevel-shepherd-wins-season-15-giving-kelly-clarkson-repeat-coach/2357923002/|title='The Voice': Chevel Shepherd wins Season 15, giving Kelly Clarkson a repeat win as coach|work=[[USA Today]]|date=December 18, 2018|access-date=February 7, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231350/https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/tv/2018/12/18/voice-chevel-shepherd-wins-season-15-giving-kelly-clarkson-repeat-coach/2357923002/|url-status=live}}</ref> On May 19, 2019, the duo performed their song \"Speechless\" with ''[[American Idol]]'' Top 3 contestant Madison VanDenburg.<ref name=\"American Idol 2019\">{{cite news|first=Jacklyn|last=Krol|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-american-idol-finale-madison-vandenburg/|title=Dan + Shay Perform 'Speechless' With 'American Idol' Finalist Madison VanDenburg|work=Taste of Country|date=May 19, 2019|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 7, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220207023725/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-american-idol-finale-madison-vandenburg/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2020, the duo was featured on ''The Not-Too-Late Show with [[Elmo]]!''.<ref name=\"Elmo 2020\">{{cite web|first=Lauren Jo|last=Black|url=https://countrynow.com/watch-dan-shay-sing-a-sesame-street-classic-on-the-not-too-late-show-with-elmo/|title=Watch Dan + Shay Sing a 'Sesame Street' Classic on 'The Not-Too-Late Show with Elmo!'|work=Country Now|date=June 26, 2020|access-date=February 7, 2022|archive-date=February 8, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220208041231/https://countrynow.com/watch-dan-shay-sing-a-sesame-street-classic-on-the-not-too-late-show-with-elmo/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2021, the duo was featured on ''The Voice'' for a second time as [[Blake Shelton]]'s Battle advisors.<ref name=\"The Voice 2021\">{{cite web|first=Carena|last=Liptak|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-blake-shelton-the-voice-battle-advisors/|title=Dan + Shay Will Be Blake Shelton's Battle Advisors for Season 20 of 'The Voice'|work=Taste of Country|date=February 1, 2021|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 7, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220207024708/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-blake-shelton-the-voice-battle-advisors/|url-status=live}}</ref> In June 2023, it was announced that the duo would become coaches on the [[The Voice (American season 25)|25th season]] of ''The Voice'' as the first ever duo coach on the American version on the show.<ref name=\"Voice 2024\">{{cite web|first=Jack|last=Irvin|url=https://people.com/dan-shay-join-the-voice-as-coaches-alongside-reba-mcentire-john-legend-chance-the-rapper-7551800|title=Dan + Shay to Join 'The Voice' as Coaches for Season 25 \u2014 Alongside Familiar Faces!|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=June 22, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-date=June 22, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230622181653/https://people.com/dan-shay-join-the-voice-as-coaches-alongside-reba-mcentire-john-legend-chance-the-rapper-7551800|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Voice 2024 2\">{{cite web|first=Eric|last=Lagatta|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/tv/2023/06/26/the-voice-dan-shay-judges-season-25/70355892007/|title=Country act Dan + Shay to join Season 25 of 'The Voice' as the show's first coaching duo|work=[[USA Today]]|date=June 26, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231350/https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/tv/2023/06/26/the-voice-dan-shay-judges-season-25/70355892007/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n==Musical style and influences==\nDan + Shay's musical style has been described as [[Country music|country]],<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Jon|last=Freeman|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/review-dan-shays-dan-shay-w521937|title=Review: Dan + Shay Kick up a Quiet Country Storm on Self-Titled LP|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 28, 2018|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180628215356/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/review-dan-shays-dan-shay-w521937|archive-date=June 28, 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Kristin M.|last=Hall|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/dan-shay-found-time-reflection-global-success-79421456|title=Dan + Shay found time for reflection after global success|work=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|date=August 12, 2021|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220202010203/https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/dan-shay-found-time-reflection-global-success-79421456|archive-date=February 2, 2022|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Daniela|last=Avila|url=https://people.com/country/justin-bieber-and-dan-shay-sued-over-copyright-infringement-for-song-10000-hours/|title=Justin Bieber and Dan + Shay Sued for Copyright Infringement Over Hit Song '10,000 Hours'|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=April 21, 2022|access-date=November 11, 2022|archive-date=November 11, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221111204207/https://people.com/country/justin-bieber-and-dan-shay-sued-over-copyright-infringement-for-song-10000-hours/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Taylor|last=Weatherby|url=https://www.grammy.com/news/dan-shay-GRAMMY-interview-good-things-new-album-tour-plans-lizzo-dream-collaborator|title=Dan + Shay On Bringing 'Good Things' With New Album, Tour Plans & Why Lizzo Is Their Dream Collaborator|work=[[The Recording Academy]]|date=August 26, 2021|access-date=February 1, 2022|archive-date=February 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220202004713/https://www.grammy.com/news/dan-shay-GRAMMY-interview-good-things-new-album-tour-plans-lizzo-dream-collaborator|url-status=live}}</ref> [[country pop]],<ref name=\"AllMusic Obsessed\"/><ref name=\"AllMusic genres\">{{cite web|author=Stephen Thomas Erlewine|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/dan-shay-mn0003200207/biography|title=Dan + Shay AllMusic Bio|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=October 13, 2020|archive-date=October 17, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201017183750/https://www.allmusic.com/artist/dan-shay-mn0003200207/biography|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Tiffany|last=Goldstein|url=https://www.cmt.com/news/s07jzx/dan-shay-brings-fans-behind-the-scenes-of-their-steal-my-love-music-video|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221111204210/https://www.cmt.com/news/s07jzx/dan-shay-brings-fans-behind-the-scenes-of-their-steal-my-love-music-video|url-status=dead|archive-date=November 11, 2022|title=Dan + Shay Brings Fans Behind The Scenes Of Their \"Steal My Love\" Music Video.|work=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]]|date=April 4, 2022|access-date=November 11, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|first=Claire|last=Shaffer|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-shay-late-show-with-stephen-colbert-1214156/|title=Dan + Shay Perform Soulful 'You' on 'Late Show With Stephen Colbert'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=August 19, 2021|access-date=February 1, 2022|archive-date=February 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220202004710/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/dan-shay-late-show-with-stephen-colbert-1214156/|url-status=live}}</ref> and [[Pop music|pop]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Ves|last=Garcia|url=https://entertainment.inquirer.net/385674/dan-shay-collab-bts-jungkook-10000-hours-cover|title=Dan + Shay 'would love to collab' with BTS' Jungkook as he nails '10,000 Hours' cover|work=Inquirer|date=August 1, 2020|access-date=October 13, 2020|archive-date=October 14, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201014111350/https://entertainment.inquirer.net/385674/dan-shay-collab-bts-jungkook-10000-hours-cover|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Greg|last=Payne|url=https://www.kctv5.com/news/johnson-county-kid-goes-viral-after-playing-with-dan-shay/article_eac85bd0-4a88-11ec-b0a3-4f7619517467.html|title=Johnson County kid goes viral after playing with Dan + Shay|work=[[KCTV|KCTV 5]]|date=November 20, 2021|access-date=May 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211126001836/https://www.kctv5.com/news/johnson-county-kid-goes-viral-after-playing-with-dan-shay/article_eac85bd0-4a88-11ec-b0a3-4f7619517467.html|archive-date=November 26, 2021|url-status=dead}}</ref> They also utilize elements of pop,<ref name=\"countrystandardtime.com\">{{cite web|url=http://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=7471|title=Dan + Shay offer debut single|work=[[Country Standard Time]]|date=October 15, 2013|access-date=February 7, 2022|archive-date=February 8, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220208035358/https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=7471|url-status=live}}</ref> [[country rock]],<ref name=\"countrystandardtime.com\"/> [[soft rock]],<ref name=\"Good Things AllMusic\">{{cite web|first=Stephen Thomas|last=Erlewine|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/good-things-mw0003572086|title=Dan + Shay Good Things|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=February 7, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231350/https://www.allmusic.com/album/good-things-mw0003572086|url-status=live}}</ref> and [[R&B]].<ref name=\"Good Things AllMusic\"/> In describing their sound, Stephen Thomas Erlewine of [[AllMusic]] stated, \"specializing in country-pop so smooth it would also sound at home on adult contemporary radio\" and \"their inherent sweetness served as a counterpoint to the swaggering [[bro-country]] that dominated mainstream country during the mid-2010s.\"<ref name=\"AllMusic genres\"/> ''Taste of Country'' compared them to [[Rascal Flatts]] and [[Love and Theft (duo)|Love and Theft]].<ref name=\"taste\"/>\n\nThe duo has cited many musical influences. Dan Smyers cited artists such as [[Ryan Adams]], [[Tom Petty]], [[Kenny Chesney]] and [[Alison Krauss]] as musical influences.<ref name=\":1\" /> Shay Mooney cited artists such as Rascal Flatts, [[Dave Matthews Band]], [[Usher (musician)|Usher]] and Kenny Chesney as musical influences.<ref name=\":1\" /> ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' noted musical influences from [[The Beach Boys]], [[Electric Light Orchestra]], [[Alan Jackson]] and [[Brooks & Dunn]] on the duo's fourth album, ''[[Good Things (Dan + Shay album)|Good Things]]''.<ref name=\"Billboard influences\">{{cite magazine|first=Melinda|last=Newman|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/dan-shay-interview-good-things-album-9614833/|title=Dan + Shay Talk New Album, 'Good Things,' Writing with Shawn Mendes and Drake's Influence|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=August 13, 2021|access-date=February 11, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231351/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/dan-shay-interview-good-things-album-9614833/|url-status=live}}</ref> According to Dan Smyers in an interview:\n\n{{Blockquote|\"We write country songs \u2014 the topline, the lyrics of these songs...We grew up listening to all kinds of music, not just country but pop, [[Rock music|rock]], R&B, [[Hip hop music|hip-hop]], everything\u2026 and you hear that in the music.\"<ref name=\"Billboard influences\"/>}}\n\n==Members==\n===Dan Smyers===\n[[File:Dan Smyers of Dan + Shay in 2017.jpg|thumb|upright=0.9|Dan Smyers]]\nDaniel \"Dan\" Smyers, born {{birth date and age|1987|8|16|mf=y}}<ref name=\"cafenashville\">{{cite web|url=https://www.cafenashville.com/artistprofiles/danandshay/|title=Dan + Shay - Cafe Nashville|website=Cafe Nashville|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206182810/https://www.cafenashville.com/artistprofiles/danandshay/|url-status=live}}</ref> was raised in [[Wexford, Pennsylvania]],<ref name=\"Grand Ole Opry\">{{cite web |title=Dan + Shay - Grand Ole Opry |url=https://www.opry.com/artists/dan-shay/#:~:text=Dan%20%2B%20Shay%20Bio,-Website&text=Musical%20influences%20range%20from%20Ryan,he%20started%20learning%20the%20guitar. |access-date=February 11, 2022 |website=Opry |archive-date=February 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220212043604/https://www.opry.com/artists/dan-shay/#:~:text=Dan%20%2B%20Shay%20Bio,-Website&text=Musical%20influences%20range%20from%20Ryan,he%20started%20learning%20the%20guitar. |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"pittsburghmagazine\">{{cite web|first=Tricia|last=Depres|url=https://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/you-should-know-dan-smyers/|title=You Should Know: Dan Smyers|work=Pittsburgh Magazine|date=February 19, 2015|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206182809/https://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/you-should-know-dan-smyers/|url-status=live}}</ref> where he attended [[North Allegheny Senior High School]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Aaron|last=Jentzen|url=http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/in-between/Content?oid=1337222|title=Local rockers Transition straddle commercialism and conviction'|publisher=Pghcitypaper.com|date=June 8, 2006|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 8, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180208123525/https://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/in-between/Content?oid=1337222|url-status=live}}</ref> He started playing music at the age of 12.<ref name=\"Grand Ole Opry\"/> Smyers attended [[Carnegie Mellon University]] with plans to study finance and play football.<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/><ref name=\"pittsburghmagazine\"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://lescheminsdurock.wordpress.com/2012/05/12/bonaventure-our-dream-is-to-touch-people-with-our-music/|title=Bonaventure: 'Our dream is to touch people with our music'|publisher=Patriciatanne.com/|date=May 12, 2012|access-date=May 12, 2012|archive-date=November 21, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161121105933/https://lescheminsdurock.wordpress.com/2012/05/12/bonaventure-our-dream-is-to-touch-people-with-our-music/|url-status=live}}</ref> He moved to Nashville in 2010,<ref name=\":1\" /> after graduating from college the same year.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Where It All Began - Carnegie Mellon University {{!}} CMU |url=https://www.cmu.edu/homepage/creativity/2014/fall/where-it-all-began.shtml#:~:text=Dan%20Smyers?,(TPR%2710)%20said. |access-date=2022-04-06 |website=www.cmu.edu |archive-date=2021-06-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210613120339/https://www.cmu.edu/homepage/creativity/2014/fall/where-it-all-began.shtml#:~:text=Dan%20Smyers?,(TPR%2710)%20said. |url-status=live }}</ref> Two years later he would meet Shay.<ref name=\":0\" />\n\nPrior to joining Dan + Shay, Smyers fronted an [[emo]] band called Transition, which also includes members like Harrison Wargo (who later formed [[The Morning Light]]) and Dustin Hook (who left to join [[My American Heart]] and is now the full-time touring bassist for Dan + Shay ), the band released one full-length record in 2006 on [[Floodgate Records]] produced by [[Mike Herrera]], who is best known for his work with [[MxPx]].<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/><ref>{{Cite web|first=Rachael|last=Dowd|url=https://www.altpress.com/news/dan-and-shay-dan-smyers-emo-band-all-time-low/|title=Dan Smyers' emo band before Dan + Shay once opened for All Time Low|website=[[Alternative Press (magazine)|Alternative Press]]|date=January 21, 2021|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128031456/https://www.altpress.com/news/dan-and-shay-dan-smyers-emo-band-all-time-low/|archive-date=January 28, 2021}}</ref> Transition appeared on the [[Vans Warped Tour]] in both 2004 and 2006, and had opened for bands including [[All Time Low]], MxPx, [[Streetlight Manifesto]] & [[Reel Big Fish]]<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://www.setlist.fm/setlist/transition/2006/congress-theater-chicago-il-6bf5da6a.html|title = Transition Setlist at Congress Theater, Chicago|website = setlist.fm|access-date = 2021-01-22|archive-date = 2021-01-28|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20210128075636/https://www.setlist.fm/setlist/transition/2006/congress-theater-chicago-il-6bf5da6a.html|url-status = live}}</ref> He was also in a [[Rock music|rock]] band called Bonaventure.<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/><ref name=\"pittsburghmagazine\"/>\n\nInstruments: Vocals, guitar, bass, piano\n\nSmyers and Abby Law were in a relationship for many years before becoming engaged in 2016 and were married on May 13, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|first=Sterling|last=Whitaker|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-dan-smyers-married/|title=Dan Smyers of Dan + Shay Gets Married - Taste of Country|website=Taste of Country|date=May 14, 2017|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206151212/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-and-shay-dan-smyers-married/|url-status=live}}</ref>  Law made a cameo in a Dan + Shay videos for their songs \"Nothin' Like You\", \"Speechless\"<ref>{{cite web|first=Annie|last=Reuter|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-wedding-song-speechless/|title=Dan + Shay Release Sentimental Wedding Song, 'Speechless'|work=Sounds Like Nashville|date=May 19, 2018|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=December 28, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191228131608/https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dan-shay-wedding-song-speechless/|url-status=live}}</ref> and \"10,000 Hours\".<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Heran|last=Mamo|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/justin-bieber-hailey-bieber-10000-hours-video-dan-shay-8532203/|title=Bask in Justin & Hailey Bieber's Newlywed Bliss in Romantic '10,000 Hours' Video With Dan + Shay|magazine=Billboard|date=October 4, 2019|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206182808/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/justin-bieber-hailey-bieber-10000-hours-video-dan-shay-8532203/|url-status=live}}</ref> Smyers and Abby work with Wags & Walks Rescue Nashville to save dogs and place them in their forever homes.<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/><ref name=\"Dogs\">{{cite web|first=Philip|last=Trapp|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-smyers-old-dog-rescue/|title=Dan + Shay's Dan Smyers Rescues Elderly Dog: 'She Was Dealt A Tough Hand'|website=Taste of Country|date=March 5, 2021|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206182810/https://tasteofcountry.com/dan-smyers-old-dog-rescue/|url-status=live}}</ref> They have five dogs together as of March 2021.<ref name=\"Dogs\"/>\n\n===Shay Mooney===\n[[File:Shay Mooney of Dan + Shay in 2017.jpg|thumb|upright=0.9|Shay Mooney]]\nJames Shay Mooney,<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/><ref name=\"5 Things\"/> born {{birth date and age|1991|12|27|mf=y}}<ref name=\"cafenashville\"/> was raised in [[Natural Dam, Arkansas]],<ref>{{cite web|first=Brett|last=Rains|url=https://www.4029tv.com/article/cma-nominee-remembers-growing-up-in-the-river-valley/13452633|title=CMA nominee growing up in the River Valley|website=4029tv|date=November 9, 2017|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220206182822/https://www.4029tv.com/article/cma-nominee-remembers-growing-up-in-the-river-valley/13452633|url-status=live}}</ref> and was home-schooled until the fifth-grade,<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/> but later attended [[Union Christian Academy]] and [[Van Buren High School (Van Buren, Arkansas)|Van Buren High School]].<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/> At the age of 14, he started writing songs, and at 16, he started learning how to play guitar.<ref name=\"Grand Ole Opry\"/> Following high school, he attended [[University of Valley Forge|Valley Forge Christian College]] for one year before completely pursuing his music career.<ref>{{cite web|first=Pat|last=St.Claire|url=http://cnnradio.cnn.com/2013/03/17/cnn-radio-music-notes-shay-mooney-a-redneck-in-an-urban-world|title=Shay Mooney \u2013 'a redneck in an urban world'|work=Cnnradio.cnn.com|date=March 17, 2013|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190605003508/http://cnnradio.cnn.com/2013/03/17/cnn-radio-music-notes-shay-mooney-a-redneck-in-an-urban-world/|archive-date=June 5, 2019}}</ref> Mooney had a record deal with rapper [[T-Pain]] on Pain's [[Nappy Boy Entertainment]] label.<ref name=\"taste\"/><ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/> However, the deal ended once he formed Dan + Shay.<ref name=\"Lenehan Vaughn\"/>\n\nInstruments: Vocals, piano, guitar\n\nOn January 24, 2017, his fianc\u00e9e Hannah Billingsley gave birth to their first child, a son.<ref name=\"asher\">{{cite web|first=Jen|last=Juneau|url=https://people.com/parents/shay-mooney-hannah-billingsley-welcome-son-asher-james/|title=Shay Mooney and Hannah Billingsley Welcome Son Asher James|work=people.com|date=January 24, 2017|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231351/https://people.com/celebrity-parenting/|url-status=live}}</ref> Mooney and Billingsley were married on October 20, 2017, in Arkansas.<ref name=\"Hannah Mooney\">{{cite web|author1=Sarah Michaud|author2=Brianne Tracy|url=http://people.com/country/shay-mooney-marries-hannah-billingsley/|title=Dan + Shay's Shay Mooney Marries Hannah Billingsley \u2014 All the Wedding Details!|work=people.com|date=October 21, 2017|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=November 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211104195631/https://people.com/country/shay-mooney-marries-hannah-billingsley/|url-status=live}}</ref> On February 21, 2020, the couple welcomed their second son.<ref name=\"ames\">{{cite web|author1=Ally Mauch|author2=Sarah Michaud|url=https://people.com/parents/shay-mooney-welcomes-son-ames-alexander-first-photo/|title=Meet Ames Alexander! Dan + Shay's Shay Mooney and Wife Hannah Welcome Second Son|work=people.com|date=February 22, 2020|access-date=February 6, 2022|archive-date=May 23, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220523045750/https://people.com/parents/shay-mooney-welcomes-son-ames-alexander-first-photo/|url-status=live}}</ref> On January 20, 2023, Billingsley gave birth to the couple's third son.<ref name=\"abram\">{{cite web|author=Angela Andaloro|url=https://people.com/parents/shay-mooney-wife-hannah-welcome-third-baby-boy-son-abram/|title=Shay Mooney and Wife Hannah Welcome Third Baby Boy, Son Abram: 'Grateful Doesn't Begin to Cover It'|work=people.com|date=January 20, 2023|access-date=March 27, 2024|archive-date=September 1, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240901231858/https://people.com/parents/shay-mooney-wife-hannah-welcome-third-baby-boy-son-abram/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{main|Dan + Shay discography}}\n* ''[[Where It All Began (Dan + Shay album)|Where It All Began]]'' (2014)\n* ''[[Obsessed (Dan + Shay album)|Obsessed]]'' (2016)\n* ''[[Dan + Shay (album)|Dan + Shay]]'' <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Chad_Brownlee","to":"Chad Brownlee"}],"pages":{"25142200":{"pageid":25142200,"ns":0,"title":"Chad Brownlee","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|Canadian musician and ice hockey player}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2020}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Chad Brownlee\n| image           = Chad_Brownlee.jpg\n| caption         = Brownlee in 2015\n| image_size      =\n| birth_name      =\n| alias           =\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1984|7|12}}\n| origin          = [[Kelowna]], British Columbia, Canada\n| instrument      = Guitar\n| genre           = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]|[[country rock]]}}\n| occupation      = Singer, songwriter, actor\n| years_active    = 2003\u2013present\n| label           = [[Universal Music Canada]] \u2022 [[MDM Recordings Inc.|MDM Recordings]]\n| associated_acts =\n| website         = {{official website|http://www.chadbrownlee.com}}\n}}\n\n'''Chad Brownlee''' (born July 12, 1984) is a Canadian [[country music]] artist, songwriter, actor, and former [[ice hockey]] [[defenceman]]. He has one #1 [[Canada Country]] hit with \"[[Forever's Gotta Start Somewhere]]\".\n\n==Sports career==\n{{Infobox ice hockey player\n| name = Ice Hockey\n| image = \n| image_size = 230px\n| position = [[Defenceman (ice hockey)|Defenceman]]\n| shoots = Right\n| played_for = [[Idaho Steelheads]]\n| height_ft = 6\n| height_in = 2\n| weight_lb = 200\n| birth_date = \n| birth_place = \n| ntl_team = \n| draft = 190th overall\n| draft_team = [[Vancouver Canucks]] \n| draft_year = 2003\n| career_start = 2007\n| career_end = 2008\n}}\n\nBrownlee was a draft pick for the [[Vancouver Canucks]] in 2003, going in the sixth round No.&nbsp;190th overall.<ref name=\"hockey\">{{cite web |last=Kennedy |first=Ryan |title=The Straight Edge: When pro hockey is no longer the dream |url=http://www.thehockeynews.com/articles/25876-The-Straight-Edge-When-pro-hockey-is-no-longer-the-dream.html |work=[[The Hockey News]] |access-date=November 19, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090504085041/http://www.thehockeynews.com/articles/25876-The-Straight-Edge-When-pro-hockey-is-no-longer-the-dream.html |archive-date=May 4, 2009 |url-status=dead }}</ref> After four years of playing for the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]]'s [[Minnesota State Mavericks]] (located in Mankato, Minn.), Brownlee made his professional debut with the [[ECHL]]'s [[Idaho Steelheads]] playing a lone season with the club in the [[2007-08 ECHL season|2007\u201308]] season before ending his playing career.<ref name=\"hockey\" />\n\n==Music career==\nFollowing a series of injuries, he turned his attention to music the following year.<ref name=\"hockey\" /> His first single, \"The Best That I Can (Superhero)\", was released in November 2009. Brownlee's [[Chad Brownlee (album)|self-titled]] debut album, produced by [[Mitch Merrett]], was released in August 2010 via [[MDM Recordings Inc.|MDM Recordings]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cmt.ca/Artist/ChadBrownlee |title=Chad Brownlee Biography |access-date=November 20, 2009 |archive-date=November 21, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101121041855/http://www.cmt.ca/Artist/ChadBrownlee |url-status=dead }}</ref> He followed it up with ''[[Love Me or Leave Me (Chad Brownlee album)|Love Me or Leave Me]]'' in 2012. Brownlee was nominated for a [[Juno Award]] for [[Juno Award for Country Recording of the Year|Country Album of the Year]] on February 19, 2013. The awards took place on April 21 in [[Regina, Saskatchewan]].<ref>{{cite news|title=JUNO nominees include The Sheepdogs, Justin Bieber|url=http://ckom.com/story/announcing-juno-award-nominees/97119|access-date=February 19, 2013|newspaper=[[CKOM]]|date=February 19, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130928052415/http://ckom.com/story/announcing-juno-award-nominees/97119|archive-date=September 28, 2013}}</ref> Brownlee's third album, ''[[The Fighters (Chad Brownlee album)|The Fighters]]'', was released on June 3, 2014.<ref name=\"fighters\">{{cite web |title=Chad Brownlee to release The Fighters June 3 |url=http://www.universalmusic.ca/press-releases/chad-brownlee-to-release-the-fighters-june-3/ |work=[[Universal Music]] |access-date=April 28, 2014}}</ref>\n\nBrownlee landed his first No. 1 hit with \"[[Forever's Gotta Start Somewhere]]\" in April 2019.<ref name=\"Canada Country\"/> It was included on the EP ''[[Back in the Game (Chad Brownlee album)|Back in the Game]]'', which was released on June 21, 2019, via [[Universal Music Canada]].<ref name =\"AllMusicBG\">{{cite web|title=''Back in the Game'' \u2013 Chad Brownlee|url= https://www.allmusic.com/album/back-in-the-game-mw0003292951|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=April 26, 2020}}</ref> Brownlee extended that to become his fourth album on January 10, 2020.<ref name=\"UMusicBG\">{{cite web|title=CHAD BROWNLEE RELEASES DELUXE ALBUM, BACK IN THE GAME, OUT NOW|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/chad-brownlee-releases-deluxe-album-back-in-the-game-out-now/|work=UMusic.ca|publisher=[[Universal Music Canada]]|date=January 10, 2020|access-date=January 17, 2020|archive-date=February 8, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200208094859/http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/chad-brownlee-releases-deluxe-album-back-in-the-game-out-now/|url-status=dead}}</ref> A July 2020 [[Nielsen Music]] study found Brownlee to be the eighth-highest played Canadian artist on domestic radio in the first half of 2020, ahead of [[Brett Kissel]] and [[JP Saxe]], and behind [[Dallas Smith (singer)|Dallas Smith]] and [[Drake (musician)|Drake]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/9417354/nielsen-music-mrc-data-midyear-charts-canada-2020|first=Karen|last=Bliss|title= The Weeknd Tops Nielsen Music/MRC Data Midyear Charts Across Canada|date=13 July 2020|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=6 August 2020}}</ref>\n\nIn 2023, Brownlee ended a prolonged hiatus and released the single \"The Country Kind\".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2023/09/22/chad-brownlee-unveils-new-single-the-country-kind-interview/|title=CHAD BROWNLEE UNVEILS NEW SINGLE, \"THE COUNTRY KIND\" (INTERVIEW)|date=September 22, 2023|first=Jenna|last=Melanson|access-date=October 18, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Acting career==\nBrownlee's first role as an actor came in 2010 film ''[[Tooth Fairy (2010 film)|Tooth Fairy]]'' as an unnamed hockey player with no lines.<ref name=\"PCA\">{{cite web|title=Exclusive Interview: Pop-Culturalist Chats with Range Roads' Chad Brownlee|url= http://pop-culturalist.com/exclusive-interview-pop-culturalist-chats-with-range-roads-chad-brownlee/|work=Pop-Culturalist|date=March 31, 2021|access-date=April 27, 2021}}</ref> He appeared in the 2021 film ''[[Range Roads]]'' as Bruce, the ex-boyfriend of the main character Frankie.<ref name=\"PCA\"/>\n\n==Discography==\n===Albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\"\n|-\n!
