Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Kane_Brown","to":"Kane Brown"}],"pages":{"48411099":{"pageid":48411099,"ns":0,"title":"Kane Brown","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer (born 1993)}}\n\n{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2018}}\n{{for|the singer's debut album|Kane Brown (album){{!}}''Kane Brown'' (album)}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Kane Brown\n| image           = File:Kane Brown.jpg\n| caption         = Kane Brown at [[Fenway Park]] 2024\n| alt             = A head shot of country music singer Kane Brown\n| birth_name      = Kane Allen Brown\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1993|10|21}}\n| birth_place     = [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]], U.S.\n| origin          = [[Whites Creek, Tennessee]], U.S.\n| genre           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Country music|Country]]<ref name=AllMusic-Bio/>\n* [[country pop]]<ref name=AllMusic-Bio/>\n* [[contemporary R&B|R&B]]<ref name=AllMusic-Bio/>\n}}\n| occupation      = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}}\n| years_active    = 2014\u2013present\n| label           = {{hlist|[[Zone 4 (record label)|Zone 4]]|[[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]]}}\n{{infobox person\n| spouse = {{marriage|Katelyn Jae|2018}}\n| child = yes\n| children = 3\n| website          = {{URL|kanebrownmusic.com}}\n}}\n}}\n\n'''Kane Allen Brown'''<ref name=BMI-RepertoireProfile>{{cite web|url=http://repertoire.bmi.com/Catalog.aspx?detail=writerid&page=1&fromrow=1&torow=25&keyid=550360793&subid=2|title=Songwriter/Composer: Kane Brown; Current Affiliation: BMI CAE/IPI #: 794712210|work=[[Broadcast Music, Inc.|BMI]]}}</ref><ref name=Tennesean-KaneBrown-2016>{{cite news|first1=Cindy|last1=Watts|title=Raising Kane Brown: Biracial \"singer\"forges own path in country music|url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2016/12/01/raising-kane-brown-biracial-singer-forges-own-path-country-music/93490558/|work=[[The Tennessean]]|date=December 1, 2016}}</ref> (born October 21, 1993)<ref name=AllMusic-Bio>{{cite web|last1=Collar|first1=Matt|title=Kane Brown biography|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/kane-brown-mn0003444653/biography|website=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=November 10, 2018}}</ref> is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter.<ref name=Roughstock-2015>{{cite news|first1=Matt|last1=Bjorke|title=The Rise of Kane Brown, Independent Country Sensation|url=https://roughstock.com/news/2015/10/39036-the-rise-of-kane-brown-independent-country-sensation|work=Roughstock|date=October 19, 2015}}</ref> First garnering a mass following on [[social media]], he released his debut [[extended play]] (EP) ''[[Closer (Kane Brown EP)|Closer]]'' in June 2015, and followed it up with the single, \"[[Used to Love You Sober]]\" in October of that year. After Brown signed with [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] in early 2016, the song was included on his second EP and [[major label]] debut, ''[[Chapter 1 (EP)|Chapter 1]]'' in March 2016. He released his [[Kane Brown (album)|eponymous debut studio album]] later that year in December. The album spawned the single \"[[What Ifs]]\" (featuring [[Lauren Alaina]]), and in October 2017, Brown became the first artist to have simultaneous number ones on all five main ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country charts.<ref name=Billboard-5CountryCharts-2017>{{cite magazine|first1=Jim|last1=Asker|title=Kane Brown Becomes First Artist To Simultaneously Lead Five Country Charts|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8005648/kane-brown-what-if-country-charts-record|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date= October 17, 2017}}</ref> Brown released his second album, ''[[Experiment (album)|Experiment]]'', in November 2018, which became his first number one album on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].<ref name=caulfield />\n\n==Early life==\nBrown was raised in rural northwest [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] and in the [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]], area.<ref name=AllMusic-Bio/><ref name=RollingStone-DontGoCityOnMe-2016>{{cite magazine|first1=Jon|last1=Freeman|title=Kane Brown on Personal New Album, Why He Won't Sing First Hit: Ram Report|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/videos/kane-brown-on-new-album-why-he-wont-sing-first-hit-w453456|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=December 2, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.froggy101.com/blogs/exclusive-interview-kane-brown |title=Exclusive Interview: Kane Brown |first=Lauren |last=Hoffman |date=March 6, 2017 |work=Froggy101 |access-date=July 31, 2017 |archive-date=August 1, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170801033155/http://www.froggy101.com/blogs/exclusive-interview-kane-brown |url-status=dead }}</ref> He is multiracial, with a white mother, Tabatha Brown,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://rarecountry.com/news/kane-brown-brings-his-mom-to-tears-in-heartwarming-video/ |title=Kane Brown brings his mom to tears in heartwarming video |first=Melinda |last=Lorge|date= October 4, 2017 |work=Rare Country}}</ref> and an African-American father who is also part [[Cherokee descent|Cherokee]].<ref name=Tennesean-KaneBrown-2016 /><ref name=NYTimes-IrvingPlaza-2016>{{cite news|first1=Jon|last1=Caramanica|title=Kane Brown Reaches to Reconcile Two Sides in His Sound|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/04/arts/music/kane-brown-reaches-to-reconcile-two-sides-in-his-sound.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 4, 2016}}</ref><ref name=WashPost-Profile-2016>{{cite news|first1=Emily|last1=Yahr|title= Kane Brown could be the future of country music. So why is the industry skeptical?|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/kane-brown-could-be-the-future-of-country-music-so-why-is-the-industry-skeptical/2016/12/07/8e1eb296-bc51-11e6-91ee-1adddfe36cbe_story.html|newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]|date=December 8, 2016}}</ref> In 2018, he told ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine he did not know he was biracial until he was 7 or 8 years old: \"I thought I was full white... I found out that I was biracial, and I still wasn't thinking anything of it, but then I started getting called the [[Nigger|N-word]] ... I learned what it meant, and that's when it started affecting me. I got in fights over it when I was little.\"<ref name=People-Childhood-2018>{{cite news|first1=Dana Rose|last1=Falcone|title=Kane Brown Opens Up About Being Called the N-Word as a Kid: 'I Thought I Was Full White'|url=https://people.com/country/kane-brown-childhood-racism-experiment-interview/|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=November 21, 2018}}</ref> His father has been incarcerated since 1996, and he was raised by his single mother.<ref name=Billboard-CoverProfile-2018>{{cite magazine|first1=Marissa R.|last1=Moss|title=How Kane Brown Became the Future of Country|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8482427/kane-brown-billboard-cover-story|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date= November 1, 2018}}</ref>\n\nSometimes homeless, Brown's family moved around northwest Georgia when he was younger from [[Rossville, Georgia|Rossville]] to [[Fort Oglethorpe, Georgia|Fort Oglethorpe]] to [[LaFayette, Georgia|LaFayette]] before finally settling in [[Red Bank, Tennessee]].<ref name=\"cmchat\">{{cite web |url=http://www.cmchatlive.com/kane-brown/ |title=Meet Kane Brown|date= November 7, 2014 |first=Jen |last=Swirsky |work= Country Music Chat}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bandpage.com/KaneBrown/bio |title=Kane Brown: Biography |work=BandPage |archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20160321195305/https://www.bandpage.com/KaneBrown/bio |archive-date=March 21, 2016 }}</ref> As a result, he attended many schools, among them [[Lakeview Fort Oglethorpe High School]] in [[Fort Oglethorpe, Georgia|Fort Oglethorpe]], where he sang in the choir with [[Lauren Alaina]], the runner-up on [[American Idol (season 10)|Season 10]] of ''[[American Idol]]''.<ref name=\"timesfreee\">{{cite news |url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/life/entertainment/story/2015/oct/19/meet-chattanoogas-kane-brown/330954/ |title= Meet Chattanooga's Kane Brown |date=October 19, 2015 |first= Barry |last=Courter|work=Times Free Press }}</ref> He also attended [[Red Bank High School|Red Bank]], Ridgeland, and [[Soddy Daisy High School]].<ref name=\"timesfreee\" /> After graduation, he lived with his grandmother, who had also helped raise him.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://rarecountry.com/news/kane-browns-visit-with-his-nana-will-melt-your-heart/ |title=Kane Brown's visit with his Nana will melt your heart |author=Deborah Evans Price|date= August 17, 2017 |work=Rare Country}}</ref>\n\nBrown grew up listening to country music but became interested in [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] music in middle school. However, after almost winning a school talent show in 11th grade with a rendition of [[Chris Young (singer)|Chris Young]]'s \"[[Gettin' You Home (The Black Dress Song)|Gettin' You Home]]\", he began to perform country music.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://theshotgunseat.com/get-closer-kane-brown/ |title=Get Closer to Kane Brown |first=Hope |last=Scott |date= July 2, 2015 |work= The Shotgun Seat}}</ref> He auditioned for both ''American Idol'' and ''[[The X Factor (American TV series)|The X Factor USA]]'' after the success of his school friend Lauren Alaina on ''American Idol''.<ref name=Billboard-YouTubeUpstart-2016>{{cite magazine|first1=Jewly|last1=Hight|title=YouTube Upstart Kane Brown Is Breaking Country's Rules: 'The World's Not Used to It'|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/magazine-feature/7282626/youtube-upstart-kane-brown-breaking-countrys-rules|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=March 25, 2016}}</ref> He was chosen for ''The X Factor USA'' after an audition in 2013 but left the show when its producers wanted to include him in a boy band.<ref name=\"timesfreee\" /> After that, he decided to post his cover versions of popular songs online.<ref name=Billboard-YouTubeUpstart-2016 /><ref>{{youTube|id=lVvaNCrKQsM|title=Yes, I Made It! Kane Brown \u2013 THE X FACTOR USA 2013}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\nIn 2014, Kane Brown began posting videos of his covers of songs by [[Brantley Gilbert]], [[Billy Currington]], [[Alan Jackson]], and other singers on social media. He acquired a following for his homemade videos on [[Facebook]]. His cover of [[Lee Brice]]'s \"[[I Don't Dance (Lee Brice song)|I Don't Dance]]\" was one early video that gained wide attention.<ref name=\"cmchat\"/> Released on September 30, 2015, his cover of [[George Strait]]'s \"[[Check Yes or No]]\" went viral and received more than seven million views.<ref name=hdd>{{cite web |url=http://hitsdailydouble.com/music_city&id=298006 |title=Brown is the New Black |date=October 8, 2015 |work=Hits Daily Double }}</ref> His number of followers on Facebook quickly reached more than a million, leading to a teaser clip for his own single \"[[Used to Love You Sober]]\" hitting one million views in less than three hours upon its release on October 8, 2015,<ref name=hdd /> and then reaching more than 11 million views in two weeks.<ref name=\"cauldfield 2015\">{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6738417/billboard-200-chart-moves-kane-brown |title=Billboard 200 Chart Moves: Indie Country Singer Kane Brown Breaks Into Top 40|first= Keith |last=Caulfield |date= October 23, 2015 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref>\n\nBrown was initially signed to [[Zone 4 (record label)|Zone 4]]<ref name=NYTimes-IrvingPlaza-2016 /> with [[Jay Frank (music executive)|Jay Frank]] as his first manager.<ref name=\"cauldfield 2015\"/> Martha Earls became his manager in 2016.<ref name=WashPost-Profile-2016 />\n\n===2014: ''Closer''===\nIn 2014, Brown raised funds via [[crowdfunding]] site [[Kickstarter]] to produce a six-song EP,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/kanebrown/kane-browns-debut-ep |title=Kane Brown's debut EP |work=Kickstarter }}</ref> which he recorded in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], at the home studio of Noah Henson, guitarist for [[Brantley Gilbert]]. The EP, titled ''[[Closer (Kane Brown EP)|Closer]]'', was released on June 2, 2015, and debuted on the Top Country Albums chart at number 22, selling 3,200 copies in its debut week.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/06/35685-country-album-chart-report-june-11-2015 |title=Country Album Chart Report For June 11, 2015|first= Matt |last=Bjorke |date= June 11, 2015 |work=Roughstock }} Sales figure given [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/172kLuk5hsRAaHdkBYmwgmDq8cQPE4FyDRaZslZpUxNQ/edit?pli=1#gid=0 here]</ref> A single from the EP, \"Don't Go City on Me\", was first released on October 22, 2014, and reached number 43 on the Country Digital Songs chart.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://roughstock.com/news/2014/10/30337-country-musics-top-30-digital-singles-october-29-2014 |title=Country Music's Top 30 Digital Singles: October 29, 2014|first= Matt|last= Bjorke |date= October 29, 2014 |work=Roughstock }}</ref>\n\n===2015: \"Used to Love You Sober\" and follow-up singles===\nBrown released a new single \"[[Used to Love You Sober]]\" on his birthday (October 21) in 2015, and the song was spotlighted on [[Zane Lowe]]'s [[Apple Music 1|Beats 1]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://headlineplanet.com/home/2015/10/22/kane-browns-used-to-love-you-sober-erupts-on-itunes-sales-chart/ |title=Emerging country star Kane Brown makes a sudden \u2013 and significant \u2013 splash on the iTunes single sales chart|first=Brian |last=Cantor |work=Headline Planet |date=October 22, 2015 }}</ref> It reached number two on the Country Digital Songs chart based on just two days of sales, with 38,000 copies sold.<ref name=\"roughstock october 2015\">{{cite news |url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/10/39150-top-30-digital-singles-october-27-2015 |title=Top 30 Digital Singles: October 27, 2015|first= Matt |last=Bjorke |date= October 27, 2015 |work=Roughstock }}</ref> The release of the single also pushed his [[Extended play|EP]] ''Closer up'' the chart to number 22 on the Top Album Sales chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/6745225/drake-returns-to-no-1-on-billboard-artist-100-demi-lovato-pentatonix-surge |title=Drake Returns to No. 1 on Billboard Artist 100; Demi Lovato & Pentatonix Surge|first= Gary |last=Trust |date= October 28, 2015 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref> A second song, \"[[Last Minute Late Night]]\", was released on November 4, 2015, and debuted on the Country Digital Songs chart at number nine, with 26,000 copies sold.<ref name=\"roughstock november 2015\">{{cite news |url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/11/39323-top-30-digital-singles-november-9-2015 |title=Top 30 Digital Singles: November 9, 2015|first= Matt |last=Bjorke |date= November 9, 2015 |work=Roughstock }}</ref> Another single, \"[[I Love That I Hate You]]\", followed three weeks later on November 30, 2015, and sold 17,000 copies in the first week.<ref name=\"roughstock december2015\">{{cite news |url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/12/39445-top-30-digital-country-singles-december-7-2015 |title=Top 30 Digital Country Singles: December 7, 2015|first= Matt |last=Bjorke |date= December 7, 2015|work=Roughstock }}</ref>\n\n===2016\u20132018: ''Chapter 1'' and ''Kane Brown''===\nBrown opened for [[Florida Georgia Line]] on their summer 2016 ''[[Dig Your Roots Tour]]''<ref>{{cite web |url= http://tasteofcountry.com/florida-georgia-kane-brown-mentor-dig-your-roots-tour-interview/ |title=Florida Georgia Line Eager to Mentor Kane Brown on Dig Your Roots Tour |first= Billy |last=Dukes|date=February 22, 2016 |work=Taste of Country }}</ref> and collaborated with Chandler Stephens on a song they wrote together, \"Can't Stop Love\", which released on February 12, 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://new-country-songs.com/chandler-stephens-and-kane-brown/cant-stop-love |title=Chandler Stephens & Kane Brown \u2013 Can't Stop Love |work=New Country Songs |access-date=March 2, 2016 |archive-date=November 18, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161118092908/http://new-country-songs.com/chandler-stephens-and-kane-brown/cant-stop-love |url-status=dead }}</ref>\n\nHe signed with [[Sony Music Nashville]] on January 27, 2016, and records under the [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] label.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-record-deal-sony-nashville/ |title=Kane Brown Signs With Sony Nashville|first= Billy |last=Dukes|date= January 28, 2016 |work=Taste of Country }}</ref> His first [[Extended play|EP]] under the label, titled ''[[Chapter 1 (EP)|Chapter 1]]'', released on March 18, 2016.<ref name=\"the boot\">{{cite web |url=http://theboot.com/kane-brown-chapter-1-ep/ |title=Kane Brown Announces Debut EP, 'Chapter 1'|first= Christina|last= Vinson |date=March 10, 2016 |work=The Boot}}</ref> It includes the singles \"[[Used to Love You Sober]]\" and \"[[Last Minute Late Night]]\" and debuted at number nine on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' ''200'']] and at number three on the Top Country Albums chart, selling 30,000 units (23,000 in traditional albums) in its first week.<ref name=\"billboard march 2016\">{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7311520/gwen-stefani-scores-her-first-no-1-album-on-billboard-200-chart |title=Gwen Stefani Scores Her First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 Chart |date=March 27, 2016 |first= Keith|last= Caulfield |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref>\n\nOn June 17, 2016, \"[[Ain't No Stopping Us Now (Kane Brown song)|Ain't No Stopping Us Now]]\" was released as a promotional single ahead of his debut full-length album.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://new-country-songs.com/kane-brown/aint-no-stopping-us-now |title=Kane Brown \u2013 Ain't No Stopping Us Now |work=New Country Songs |access-date=June 22, 2016 |archive-date=July 2, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160702212437/http://new-country-songs.com/kane-brown/aint-no-stopping-us-now |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/aint-no-stopping-us-now-single/id1122743851 |title=Ain't No Stopping Us Now \u2013 Single|publisher=iTunes Store }}</ref> \"[[Thunder in the Rain]]\" was released as the debut radio single from the album on August 3, 2016, and Brown headlined his own Ain't No Stopping Us Now Tour produced by [[Monster Energy]] and Outbreak Presents starting on November 3, 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-aint-no-stopping-us-now-tour-dates-2016/|title= Kane Brown Books Headlining Ain't No Stopping Us Now Tour |first= Annie |last=Reuter |date=July 18, 2016|work=Taste of Country }}</ref> The [[Kane Brown (album)|self-titled album]] featuring those songs was released on December 2, 2016,<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7581640/kane-brown-album-childhood-debut |title=Kane Brown on His Self-Titled Debut: 'It's Pretty Much My Childhood on That Record' |date=December 2, 2016 |first= Gary |last=Graff |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref> and debuted at number 10 on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].<ref name=\"Album debut Billboard\">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7617662/the-hamilton-mixtape-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-albums-chart|title='The Hamilton Mixtape' Debuts at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Albums Chart|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|date=December 11, 2016|access-date=December 12, 2016}}</ref> \"[[What Ifs]]\", recorded with his friend [[Lauren Alaina]], was released as the second single from the album and has been [[Music recording certification|certified 8\u00d7 Platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]].{{Certification Cite Ref |region=United States |title=What Ifs |artist=Kane Brown |type=single}} It became a number one hit on the [[Country Airplay|''Billboard'' Country Airplay]] charts for the week of October 28, 2017, the first for Brown and the second for Alaina. It also spent five weeks at number one on the [[Hot Country Songs|''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs]] chart.\n\nAn expanded deluxe edition of Brown's debut album was released October 6, 2017, featuring four new tracks, including a duet with [[Chris Young (singer)|Chris Young]] and \"[[Heaven (Kane Brown song)|Heaven]]\",<ref>{{cite news|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=Kane Brown Duets With Chris Young on Deluxe Edition of Debut Album|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-debut-album-deluxe-edition/|access-date=September 12, 2017|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=August 22, 2017}}</ref> released as the album's third single on November 13, 2017. Upon the release of the deluxe edition, the album went to number five on the ''Billboard'' 200 and returned to number one on the Top Country Albums chart. With the single \"What Ifs\", which reached number one on multiple charts, and the new song \"Heaven\" released with the deluxe edition, Brown became the first artist to have simultaneous number ones on all five main country charts: Top Country Albums, Hot Country Songs, Country Airplay, Country Digital Song Sales, and Country Streaming Songs.<ref name=Billboard-5CountryCharts-2017 />\n\n===2018\u20132019: ''Experiment'' and collaborations===\nOn June 7, 2018, [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] released \"[[Lose It (Kane Brown song)|Lose It]]\" as the lead single for his second RCA album.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://theboot.com/kane-brown-lose-it-teaser/|title=Kane Brown Drops Brand-New Song, 'Lose It' [LISTEN] |work=The Boot |date=June 7, 2018 }}</ref> A second track from the album, \"Weekend\", was released on August 8, 2018. On September 4, 2018, Brown announced the album's title, ''Experiment'', via Twitter along with its cover art and news of the upcoming track \"[[Homesick (Kane Brown song)|Homesick]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/kanebrown/status/1037098471919157251|title=Kane Brown on Twitter: \"Album pre order 11 pm CT 9/6, Homesick track available 11 pm CT 9/6 \ud83d\udd25\ud83d\udd25 retweet\"|via=Twitter|access-date=September 5, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2018-09-06 |title=Kane Brown's Sophomore Album Will Be an 'Experiment' |url=https://www.audacy.com/blogs/lauren-hoffman/kane-browns-sophomore-album-will-be-experiment |access-date=2022-10-11 |website=www.audacy.com |language=en}}</ref> ''[[Experiment (album)|Experiment]]'' was released on November 9, 2018 and became Brown's first No. 1 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] albums chart.<ref name=caulfield>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8485588/kane-brown-experiment-billboard-200-chart-no-1|title=Kane Brown Earns First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 Chart With 'Experiment'|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|date=November 18, 2018 }}</ref>\n\nOver the course of 2018\u201319, Brown released several collaborations with artists such as [[Becky G]], [[Camila Cabello]], and [[Digital Farm Animals]], including a remix of \"[[Saturday Nights (Khalid song)|Saturday Nights]]\" with R&B singer [[Khalid (singer)|Khalid]] which was released as a single. He also appeared on [[Brooks & Dunn]]'s album ''[[Reboot (Brooks & Dunn album)|Reboot]]'' in a new rendition of their past hit \"[[Believe (Brooks & Dunn song)|Believe]]\".<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/brooks-dunn-reboot-tracklist/ | title=See the star-studded track list for Brooks & Dunn's 'Reboot' | work=Sounds Like Nashville | date=February 25, 2019 | access-date=June 30, 2019 | author=Lauren Laffer}}</ref> In August 2019, Brown collaborated with [[Marshmello]] for \"[[One Thing Right]]\",<ref name=\"rollingstone\">{{cite magazine|url= https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/marshmello-kane-brown-song-one-thing-right-850985/|title= Marshmello, Kane Brown Collaborate on Pulsing New Song 'One Thing Right'|first= Jon|last= Freeman|date= June 21, 2019|magazine= [[Rolling Stone]]}}</ref> his first release to Mainstream Pop Radio.\n\nIn October 2019, Brown's drummer, Kenny Dixon, died in a [[Traffic collision|car accident]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.today.com/popculture/kane-brown-honors-drummer-kenny-dixon-cmt-artists-year-t164795|title=Kane Brown breaks down as he honors late drummer at CMT awards ceremony|date=October 17, 2019|first= Scott|last= Stump|work=TODAY}}</ref>\n\n===2020\u2013present: ''Mixtape, Vol. 1'' and ''Different Man''===\nIn April 2020, Brown released the track \"[[Cool Again]]\",<ref>{{cite magazine|url= https://www.billboard.com/amp/articles/columns/country/9364758/kane-brown-cool-again-single|title=Kane Brown Just Wants to Be 'Cool Again' Like Last Summer on New Single |first= Melinda|last= Newman|date= April 23, 2020|magazine= [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/ef-country/kane-brown-releases-new-single-cool-again/|title= Kane Brown releases new single Cool Again |first= Pip|last= Elwood-Hughes|access-date=May 7, 2020|work=Entertainment Focus|date= April 27, 2020 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.countrynow.com/listen-to-kane-browns-new-single-cool-again/|title= Listen To Kane Brown's New Single, 'Cool Again'|first=Lauren Jo|last=Black|date=April 23, 2020|work=Country Now}}</ref> the debut single off his upcoming third [[Extended play|EP]].<ref>{{cite web|url= https://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-cool-again-interview/|title= Kane Brown Says New Song 'Cool Again' Has Taken on New Meaning|first=Billy|last=Dukes|date=April 23, 2020|work=Taste of Country}}</ref>\n\nIn June 2020, Brown released the song \"[[Worldwide Beautiful]]\", which aims to highlight peace and equality and benefits the [[Boys & Girls Clubs of America|Boys & Girls Club of America]].<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-06-04|title=Country Star Kane Brown Drops Hopeful New Song, 'Worldwide Beautiful' (Listen)|url=https://variety.com/2020/music/news/kane-brown-new-song-worldwide-beautiful-listen-1234625328/|access-date=2020-06-04|website=Variety|language=en}}</ref> In July 2020, Brown released his second single to pop radio, \"[[Be Like That (Kane Brown, Swae Lee and Khalid song)|Be Like That]]\" with [[Khalid (singer)|Khalid]] and [[Swae Lee]], another single off his [[Extended play|EP]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.countrynow.com/kane-brown-teases-superstar-collaboration-be-like-that/|title=Kane Brown Teases Superstar Collaboration, 'Be Like That'|website=Country Now|first=Lauren Jo|last=Black|date=July 7, 2020}}</ref>\n\nOn August 14, 2020, Brown released his third [[Extended play|EP]], ''[[Mixtape, Vol. 1 (EP)|Mixtape, Vol. 1]]'',<ref name=\"mixtape\">{{cite web |url= https://bobbybones.iheart.com/featured/bobby-bones/content/2020-08-09-kane-brown-reveals-ep-title-track-listing-dropping-on-friday/|title= Kane Brown Reveals EP Title & Track Listing Dropping On Friday|first=Morgan |last=Huelsman|work=[[The Bobby Bones Show]]|date=August 10, 2020}}</ref> which includes \"[[Cool Again]]\", \"[[Worldwide Beautiful]]\", and \"[[Be Like That (Kane Brown, Swae Lee and Khalid song)|Be Like That]]\", as well as four other tracks.\n\nIn September 2020, Brown announced a drive-in concert, held at more than 200 theaters across the U.S. on September 26, 2020.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2020/09/08/kane-brown-drive-concert-show-more-than-100-outdoor-venues/5747582002/|publisher=[[USA Today]]|date=8 September 2020|title=Country fans can watch Kane Brown's drive-in concert at more than 200 outdoor venues|first1=Gary|last1=Dinges}}</ref> That same week Brown appeared on stage at the [[iHeartRadio Music Festival]] in a PORTL \"hologram\" machine to sing \"[[Be Like That (Kane Brown, Swae Lee and Khalid song)|Be Like That]]\" live from [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] with [[Swae Lee]] and [[Khalid (singer)|Khalid]] who were in the studio in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/festivals/9452484/iheartradio-music-festival-2020-6-cant-miss-moments-night-two|publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=20 September 2020|title=6 Can't Miss Moments from iHeartRadio Music Festival Night 2|first1=Carl|last1=Lamarre}}</ref>\n\nIn October 2020, \"[[Worship You]]\" was sent to country radio as his second official single to that format off the [[Extended play|EP]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-worship-you/|title= Kane Brown Sends Steamy Love Song 'Worship You' to Country Radio [Listen]|website=Taste of Country|first=Billy|last=Dukes|date=October 12, 2020}}</ref>\n\nOn November 26, 2020, Brown performed in a pre-recorded halftime show in the ''Thanksgiving Thursday Night Football'' game between the [[Washington Commanders]] and the [[Dallas Cowboys]] at [[AT&T Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Dallas Cowboys, Kane Brown Dedicate Thanksgiving Halftime to Help Rescue Christmas|url=https://www.nbcdfw.com/news/sports/blue-star/dallas-cowboys-kane-brown-dedicate-thanksgiving-halftime-to-help-rescue-christmas/2490608/|access-date=2020-11-26|website=NBC 5 Dallas-Fort Worth|date=November 26, 2020 |language=en-US}}</ref>\n[[File:Kane Brown at 2022 Special Olympics USA Games.png|thumb|275x275px|Brown in 2021]]\nOn February 11, 2021, Brown launched his own label, 1021 Entertainment, in association with [[Sony Music Nashville|Sony Nashville]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2021/2/10/kane-brown-launches-1021-entertainment-label-with-sony-music.html |title=Kane Brown launches 1021 Entertainment label with Sony Music Nashville |first=Cillea |last=Houghton |date=February 11, 2021 |work=ABC News Radio |access-date=February 11, 2021 |archive-date=February 10, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210210202252/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2021/2/10/kane-brown-launches-1021-entertainment-label-with-sony-music.html |url-status=dead }}</ref>\n\nAlso in 2021, Brown became the first black person to win Video of the Year at the [[Academy of Country Music Awards|ACM Awards]], which he won for \"[[Worldwide Beautiful]]\".<ref name=\"auto\">{{Cite web|url=https://wincountry.com/2021/04/16/ahead-of-the-acms-jimmie-allen-shares-his-vision-for-the-future-of-racial-equality-in-country-music/|title=Ahead of the ACMs, Jimmie Allen shares his vision for the future of racial equality in country music}}{{Dead link|date=September 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He was included in 2021's [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]], ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''{{'}}s annual list of the 100 most influential people in the world.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Courter |first1=Barry |title=Chattanooga native Kane Brown being named to 'Time 100' list not surprising to those who know him |url=https://www.timesfreepress.com/news/life/entertainment/story/2021/sep/21/kane-brown-time/554588/ |website=[[Chattanooga Times Free Press]] |access-date=November 14, 2021 |language=en |date=September 21, 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn March 3, 2022, Brown released the song \"[[Leave You Alone (Kane Brown song)|Leave You Alone]]\", which he initially previewed on social media in late 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wncy.com/2022/03/03/leave-you-alone-kane-brown-teases-a-sultry-new-slow-jam/|title=\"Leave You Alone\": Kane Brown teases a sultry new slow jam|publisher=[[WNCY-FM]]|date=March 3, 2022|access-date=March 4, 2022}}{{Dead link|date=September 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>\n\nBrown announced his third studio album, ''[[Different Man]]'', on July 18, 2022. The album was released on September 9, 2022.<ref name=\"Different Man\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/kane-brown-new-album-cover-times-square-billboard-1235115497/|title=Kane Brown Announces New Album & Reveals the Cover on Times Square Billboard|magazine=Billboard|last=Nicholson|first=Jessica|date=July 18, 2022|access-date=July 19, 2022}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nBrown is married to Katelyn Brown (n\u00e9e Jae), who is also a singer. He proposed to her on [[Easter|Easter Sunday]] in 2017 and announced their [[engagement]] during a concert in [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], a short time later in April 2017.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.wsbtv.com/news/trending-now/georgia-born-country-star-kane-brown-marries-katelyn-jae/852538852|title=Georgia-born country star Kane Brown marries Katelyn Jae|last=EndPlay|date=2018-10-13|website=WSBTV|language=en-US|access-date=2019-06-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.etonline.com/news/216060_kane_brown_is_engaged_to_katelyn_jae|title= Country Star Kane Brown Is Engaged to Katelyn  |first= Jennifer |last=Drysdale|date= April 25, 2017|work=ETOnline }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/chattanooganow/music/story/2017/aug/31/kane-brown-brings-show-town/446185/ |title=Kane Brown coming home to headline first CountryFest |date=August 31, 2017|first= Barry |last=Courter |work=Times Free Press}}</ref> They were married at Mint Springs Farm in [[Nolensville, Tennessee]], on October 12, 2018,<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.eonline.com/uk/news/976902/kane-brown-and-katelyn-jae-are-married |title= Kane Brown and Katelyn Jae Are Married |first= Corinne |last=Heller |date= October 13, 2018 |publisher= E! }}</ref> with about 200 relatives and friends in attendance.<ref name=\":0\" /> On April 15, 2019, Brown announced they were expecting their first child.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-katelyn-jae-baby-2019/ |title=Kane Brown and Wife Katelyn Jae Expecting Their First Child |first=Jacklyn|last= Krol|date=April 15, 2019 |work=Taste of Country}}</ref> Less than a month later, on May 1, 2019, he revealed the baby was a girl during a walk down the red carpet at the [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kane-brown-wife-expecting-baby-girl/|title=BREAKING: It's a ... ! Kane Brown and Wife Reveal the Sex of Their Baby|last=Dukes|first=Billy|website=Taste of Country|date=May 2, 2019 |language=en|access-date=2019-06-02}}</ref> On October 29, 2019, Jae gave birth to their first child, a daughter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1813922/kane-brown-thanking-heaven-for-little-girl-kingsley-rose/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191031002233/http://www.cmt.com/news/1813922/kane-brown-thanking-heaven-for-little-girl-kingsley-rose/|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 31, 2019|title=Kane Brown: Thanking Heaven for Little Girl Kingsley Rose|last=Bonaguro|first=Alison|date=October 30, 2019|access-date=October 30, 2019|work=CMT.com}}</ref> On December 31, 2021, Brown announced that Jae had given birth to their second daughter a day prior.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/parents/kane-brown-wife-katelyn-welcome-second-child-daughter-kodi-jane/ |title=Surprise! Kane Brown and Wife Katelyn Welcome Baby No. 2 \u2014 Daughter Kodi Jane: See Her Photo|first1= Benjamin|last1= VanHoose |first2= Sarah|last2= Michaud|date=December 31, 2021 |work=People }}</ref> On June 18, 2024, the couple welcomed their third child and first son.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.etonline.com/kane-brown-and-wife-katelyn-welcome-baby-no-3-see-his-unique-name-226767|title=Kane Brown and Wife Katelyn Welcome Baby No. 3 -- See His Unique Name|last=Robinette|first=Ashlyn|date=June 19, 2024|access-date=June 20, 2024|magazine=[[Entertainment Tonight]]}}</ref>\n\n==Tours==\n*[[Dig Your Roots Tour]] (2016) [Opening for Florida Georgia Line] \n*Ain't No Stopping Us Now Tour (2016-2017) \n*Hometown Proud Tour (2017) \n*They Don't Know Tour Worldwide Beautiful Tour (2020\u20132021)\n*Blessed & Free Tour (2021\u20132022)\n*Drunk Or Dreamin' Tour (2022-2023)\n*In The Air Tour (2024)\n\n==Discography==\n{{Main|Kane Brown https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/inside-chris-lane-lauren-bushnells-120046890.html|title= Inside Chris Lane and Lauren Bushnell's Wedding: Tears, a Surprise Kiss and One Crazy Bouquet Toss|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=October 30, 2019}}</ref>\n| children           = 2\n| module             = {{infobox musical artist\n| embed      = yes\n| genre      = [[Country pop]]<ref name=\"allmusic\">{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/chris-lane-mn0003455720/biography|title=Chris Lane biography|work=Allmusic|access-date=23 June 2018}}</ref>\n| instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}}\n| label      = {{hlist|Red Street|[[Big Loud Records|Big Loud]]}}\n| website    = {{URL|iamchrislane.com}}\n}}\n}}\n'''Christopher Eric Lane''' (born November 9, 1984) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He has released one album as frontman of the Chris Lane Band, a second album, ''[[Girl Problems]]'', and a third album, ''[[Laps Around the Sun (Chris Lane album)|Laps Around the Sun]]''. via [[Big Loud Records]]. Lane has charted seven singles on [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]], three of which went to No. 1 (\"[[Fix (Chris Lane song)|Fix]]\", \"[[I Don't Know About You]]\", and \"[[Big, Big Plans]]\").\n\n==Early life and career beginnings==\nLane grew up in [[Kernersville, North Carolina]], and has a twin brother named Cory.<ref name=\"musicrow\">{{cite news|last1=Nicholson|first1=Jessica|title=MusicRowPics: Chris Lane|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2014/07/musicrowpics-chris-lane/|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=[[MusicRow]]|date=July 14, 2014}}</ref> While attending [[Robert B. Glenn High School|Glenn High School]], he and his brother played football and baseball, and both went on to play baseball in college at [[University of North Carolina at Charlotte]]. Lane learned to play the guitar when sports injuries affected his chances of a professional baseball career.  In his hometown he worked for his father's landscaping business and started a cover band that played in [[High Point University]] cafeteria. In 2007, Lane and his brother auditioned for the [[American Idol (season 7)|seventh season]] of ''[[American Idol]]''  but did not make it to Hollywood.<ref name=\"Auditioned For American Idol\">{{cite web|title=New Artist Chris Lane... He Auditioned For American Idol, It Wasn't Pretty!|url=http://www.969thekat.com/onair/paul-schadt-and-meg-46294/new-artist-chris-lane-he-auditioned-14270120/|website=969 the Kat|publisher=iHeartMedia, Inc.|access-date=January 19, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160319204348/http://www.969thekat.com/onair/paul-schadt-and-meg-46294/new-artist-chris-lane-he-auditioned-14270120/|archive-date=March 19, 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> It wasn't until 2008 when Chris\u2019s high school friend Brent Eliason introduced  him to Seth England of Big Loud Mountain and told his 'Uncle Seth' he had to listen to his mixtape. This was the moment which launched Chris's career as an up-and-coming country music artist.<ref name=\"musicrow\" /><ref name=\"suntimes\">{{cite web|last1=Despres|first1=Tricia|title=Chris Lane Has Plenty to Look Forward To In 2016|url=http://entertainment.suntimes.com/entertainment/post/267503/|website=Chicago Sun-Times|publisher=Sun-Times Media, LLC|date=December 2, 2015|access-date=January 19, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160124024812/http://entertainment.suntimes.com/entertainment/post/267503/|archive-date=January 24, 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name=Lane>{{cite web|last1=Weaver|first1=Chris|title=Chris Lane's music video featuring hometown of Kernersville premieres on CMT|url=http://myfox8.com/2014/08/27/chris-lanes-music-video-featuring-hometown-of-kernersville-premieres-on-cmt/|website=Fox 8 WGHP|publisher=Tribune Broadcasting|date=August 27, 2014|access-date=January 19, 2016}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\nBefore pursuing a solo career, Lane fronted the Chris Lane Band.<ref name=\"toc\">{{cite news|title=Chris Lane, 'Broken Windshield View' [Listen]|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/chris-lane-broken-windshield-view/|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=June 30, 2014}}</ref> Their album ''Let's Ride'' charted on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Top Country Albums]] chart in 2012.<ref name=\"albums\" /> He moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] in 2013.<ref name=\"suntimes\" /> Lane has opened for [[The Band Perry]], [[Eli Young Band]], [[Lee Brice]], [[Chris Young (singer)|Chris Young]] and [[Brantley Gilbert]], among others.<ref name=\"journal\">{{cite news|last1=Papadatos|first1=Markos|title=Review: Chris Lane rocks on new country single 'Broken Windshield View'|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/review-chris-lane-rocks-on-new-country-single-broken-windshield-view/article/386240|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=Digital Journal|date=June 10, 2014}}</ref> In 2014, he opened for [[Florida Georgia Line]] on their This Is How We Roll Tour.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Watts|first1=Cindy|title=Chris Lane rolls on after Florida Georgia Line tour|url=http://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2014/07/04/chris-lane-broken-windshield-view/12196087/|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=[[The Tennessean]]|date=July 4, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Holtzclaw|first1=Mike|title=Chris Lane follows the 'Broken Windshield View' to Hampton Roads|url=http://www.dailypress.com/entertainment/blog/dp-popcorn-chris-lane-follows-the-broken-windshield-view-to-virginia-20140815,0,2032097.story|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=[[Daily Press (Virginia)|Daily Press]]|date=August 15, 2014}}</ref>\n\n[[File:98.5 KYGO's Christmas Jam (38537164824).jpg|thumb|upright=0.8|Chris Lane live at 98.5 KYGO's Christmas Jam, 2017]]\nLane's debut single, \"[[Broken Windshield View]]\", was released to country radio on June 10, 2014, by Big Loud Mountain.<ref name=\"journal\" /> The song was written by [[Rodney Clawson]], [[Shane Minor]], and [[David Lee Murphy]] and produced by [[Joey Moi]].<ref name=\"musicrow\" /><ref name=\"spartanburg\">{{cite news|last1=Harris|first1=Vincent|title=Chris Lane rising on country charts|url=http://www.goupstate.com/article/20140821/ENT/408211005?tc=ar|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=[[Spartanburg Herald-Journal]]|date=August 21, 2014}}</ref> It was featured on [[Sirius XM Holdings|Sirius XM]]'s [[The Highway (Sirius XM)|The Highway]] and [[iTunes]]' New and Noteworthy.<ref name=\"journal\" /> It sold 11,000 downloads in its first week of release<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=Country Chart News: The Top 30 Digital Singles For June 19, 2014|url=http://roughstock.com/news/country-chart-news-the-top-30-digital-singles-for-june-19-2014/|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=Roughstock|date=June 19, 2014|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905073018/http://roughstock.com/news/country-chart-news-the-top-30-digital-singles-for-june-19-2014/|archive-date=September 5, 2014}}</ref> and reached number 45 on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart.<ref name=\"billboard\" /> As of August 2014, it has sold 43,000 downloads.<ref name=\"journal2\">{{cite news|last1=Papadatos|first1=Markos|title=Review: Chris Lane delivers on new video for 'Broken Windshield View'|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/review-chris-lane-delivers-on-new-video-for-broken-windshield-view/article/399757|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=Digital Journal|date=August 27, 2014}}</ref><ref name=\"roughstock\">{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=Chris Lane's \"Broken Windshield View\" Video Debuts|url=http://roughstock.com/news/chris-lanes-broken-windshield-view-video-debuts/|access-date=September 4, 2014|work=Roughstock|date=August 27, 2014|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905073016/http://roughstock.com/news/chris-lanes-broken-windshield-view-video-debuts/|archive-date=September 5, 2014}}</ref> It was also included on an [[extended play]].<ref name=\"musicrow\" /><ref name=\"spartanburg\" />\n\nLane released his debut album ''[[Girl Problems]]'' in August 2016. It accounted for the singles \"[[Fix (Chris Lane song)|Fix]]\" and \"[[For Her]]\".<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> His second album, ''[[Laps Around the Sun (Chris Lane album)|Laps Around the Sun]]'', produced the duet \"[[Take Back Home Girl]]\" (featuring [[Tori Kelly]]) and \"[[I Don't Know About You]]\".<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> In 2019, \"[[Big, Big Plans]]\" was released and became his third number one on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay chart, but it was never included on an album, and after \"Fill Them Boots\" failed to reach the top 40 of the chart in 2021, he parted ways with Big Loud.\n\nIn 2021, he featured on the single \"[[Tailgate to Heaven]]\" by Canadian country artist [[Shawn Austin]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|title=Shawn Austin Teams Up With Country Superstar Chris Lane On New Single 'Tailgate To Heaven'|url=https://etcanada.com/news/808661/shawn-austin-teams-up-with-country-superstar-chris-lane-on-new-single-tailgate-to-heaven/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210811160712/https://etcanada.com/news/808661/shawn-austin-teams-up-with-country-superstar-chris-lane-on-new-single-tailgate-to-heaven/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 11, 2021|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=August 11, 2021}}</ref>\n\nLane signed a joint venture with his own imprint Voyager Records and the newly-developed Red Street Records in 2023 and \"Find Another Bar\" will be released on August 21, 2023, as his first single for the label.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.redstreetrecords.com/news/red-street-records-joins-forces-withnbspmulti-platinum-country-star-chris-lane-and-voyager-records|title=Red Street Records Joines Forces with Multi-Platinum Country Star Chris Lane and Voyager Records|author=|date=June 12, 2023|publisher=Red Street Records|accessdate=August 7, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nIn 2018, Lane began dating Lauren Bushnell, the winner of the [[The Bachelor (season 20)|20th season]] of ''[[The Bachelor (American TV series)|The Bachelor]]''. They got engaged on June 16, 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://people.com/country/chris-lane-lauren-bushnell-engaged-proposal-details/ |title=Chris Lane Engaged to Lauren Bushnell: All the Proposal Details |date=18 June 2019 |work=People}}</ref> The two married in Nashville on October 25, 2019.<ref>{{cite web |last= |first= |date=October 30, 2019 |title=Inside Chris Lane and Lauren Bushnell's Wedding: Tears, a Surprise Kiss and One Crazy Bouquet Toss |url=https://people.com/country/chris-lane-lauren-bushnell-wedding-memories/ |access-date= |magazine=People}}</ref> On December 6, 2020, Lane and Bushnell announced they were expecting their first child.<ref>{{cite web |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=December 6, 2020 |title=Chris Lane and Lauren Bushnell Expecting Their First Child: 'I Had a Funny Feeling I Was Pregnant' |url=https://people.com/parents/chris-lane-lauren-bushnell-expecting-first-child/ |access-date= |work=People}}</ref> On January 1, 2021, it was revealed that the baby would be a son.<ref>{{cite web |last= |first= |date=January 1, 2021 |title=Chris and Lauren Lane Reveal They're Having a Baby Boy |url=https://www.etonline.com/chris-and-lauren-lane-reveal-theyre-having-a-baby-boy-158466 |access-date= |work=Entertainment Tonight}}</ref> On June 8, 2021, their son was born.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |last2= |first2= |last3= |first3= |date=June 10, 2021 |title=Chris Lane and Lauren Bushnell Lane Welcome Baby Son Dutton Walker: 'Immediate, Unconditional Love' |url=https://people.com/parents/chris-lane-lauren-bushnell-lane-welcome-first-baby-son-dutton-walker-exclusive/ |access-date= |website=People |language=en}}</ref> On June 6, 2022, Lane and Bushnell announced that they were expecting their second child in late October.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |last2= |first2= |date=June 6, 2022 |title=Chris Lane and Lauren Bushnell Lane Expecting Second Baby: 'Two Under 2!' |url=https://people.com/parents/chris-lane-lauren-bushnell-lane-pregnant-expecting-second-baby/ |access-date= |website=People |language=en}}</ref> On October 16, 2022, their second son was born.<ref>{{Cite web |date=October 18, 2022 |title=Lauren Bushnell Lane Delivers Baby Boy No. 2 with Chris Lane |url=https://people.com/parents/chris-lane-lauren-bushnell-lane-welcome-second-baby-boy/ |access-date= |website=People |language=en}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{Infobox artist discography\n| Studio 12, 2022}}</ref>\n|}\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist}}\n\n== External links ==\n*{{official website|http://www.iamchrislane.com/}}\n{{Chris Lane}}\n{{Authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Lane, Carolina]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Stephanie_Quayle","to":"Stephanie Quayle"}],"pages":{"55134719":{"pageid":55134719,"ns":0,"title":"Stephanie Quayle","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer-songwriter and musician (born 1979)}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name       = Stephanie Quayle\n| image      = 2020 NAMM Show (50783460218) (cropped).jpg\n| image_size =\n| landscape  = yes\n| birth_name = Stephanie Quayle\n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1979|10|15}}\n| origin     = [[Bozeman, Montana]], U.S.\n| genre      = {{hlist|[[Traditional Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}}\n| occupation = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter|musician}}\n| instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar|piano}}\n| label      = Rebel Engine Entertainment\n| website    = {{URL|StephanieQuayle.com}}\n}}\n'''Stephanie Quayle''' (born October 15, 1979) is an American singer-songwriter and musician.\n\n==Early life==\nStephanie Quayle grew up in [[Bozeman, Montana]]. She began playing piano at the age of 4, bought a guitar at 15, and the following year began singing in a band and found her calling on stage.<ref name=\"sal\">{{Citation|title=Singer Stephanie Quayle determined to give back to community that 'grew' her|date=Sep 25, 2015|url=http://www.bozemandailychronicle.com/go/music/country-roots-singer-stephanie-quayle-determined-to-give-back-to/article_c5aa45e6-d698-5831-9ccf-d44e256408fd.html|author=Rachel Hergett|publisher=Bozeman Daily Chronicle}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\n===2016\u20132018: ''Love the Way You See Me''===\nIn June 2016, Quayle released \"Drinking with Dolly\" via Rebel Engine Entertainment.<ref name=\"countryradioseminar.com\">{{cite web|url=http://countryradioseminar.com/events/rebel-engine-charging-and-giveaway-depot-1|title=Rebel Engine Charging & Giveaway Depot - countryradioseminar.com|website=countryradioseminar.com}}</ref> It was written by [[Victoria Banks]] and [[Rachel Proctor]]. The music video topped the CMT Music 12 Pack<ref name=\"thecountrynote.com\">{{cite web|url=http://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/stephanie-quayle-makes-her-debut-on-fox-friends-friday-december-16/|title=Stephanie Quayle Makes Her Debut On Fox & Friends Friday, December 16 - The Country Note|date=15 December 2016|publisher=}}</ref> while the single peaked in the Top 50 of the ''Billboard'' Indicator Chart. Quayle made her national television debut performing on ''Fox & Friends'' in December 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://websterpr.com/news/stephanie-quayle-makes-her-debut-fox-friends-friday-december-16|title=STEPHANIE QUAYLE MAKES HER DEBUT ON FOX & FRIENDS FRIDAY DECEMBER 16|website=websterpr.com}}</ref>\n\nIn March 2017, her single \"Winnebago,\" was released to radio, with the music video airing on GAC, CMT, and The Country Network. [[Winnebago Industries|Winnebago]] teamed up as a partner on her tour, along with The RV Loft and KOA<ref name=\"countryradioseminar.com\"/> where Quayle traveled across the US from the Empire State Building to the Golden Gate, living out the lyrics of the song.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/7631675/stephanie-quayle|title=Stephanie Quayle|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |publisher=}}</ref>\n\n''Rolling Stone'' named Quayle \"Top 10 Artists To Watch\" in May 2017<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/lists/10-new-country-artists-you-need-to-know-may-2017-w481172/stephanie-quayle-w481177|title=10 New Country Artists You Need to Know: May 2017|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=9 May 2017 }}</ref> and she has shared the stage with artists including Chase Rice, Granger Smith, LoCash, Trace Adkins, and Gary Allan.<ref name=\"thecountrynote.com\"/>\n\nRebel Engine Entertainment released her album ''Love The Way You See Me'' on September 1, 2017, with an exclusive \"first\" listen with People Country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://people.com/country/stephanie-quayle-love-the-way-you-see-me-album-premiere/|title=Stephanie Quayle Surprises Her 'Flock' of Fans by Releasing New Album a Week Early: Listen Here|date=31 August 2017|publisher=}}</ref> The album's third single, \"Selfish,\" was released in late 2017, and became her first single to chart on the ''Billboard'' [[Country Airplay]] chart when it debuted at number 60 for the week dated April 14, 2018.\n\nQuayle was the only independent artist invited to perform for the five living former US presidents (Barack Obama, George W. Bush, Bill Clinton, George H.W. Bush, and Jimmy Carter) alongside artists like Lady Gaga and Alabama as part of the hurricane relief benefit concert, \"Deep from the Heart: The One America Appeal\" in Texas.<ref>{{cite web |title=FORMER PRESIDENTS OBAMA, BUSH 43, CLINTON, BUSH 41 AND CARTER TO HEADLINE OCT 21ST CONCERT BENEFITING HURRICANE RELIEF EFFORTS |url=https://www.oneamericaappeal.org/files/2017-10-21-Deep_from_the_Heart.pdf}}</ref>\n\nOn April 7, 2018, Quayle made her [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut.\n\nIn November 2018, Quayle was inducted into CMT's 2019 Next Women of Country class.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/cmt-2019-next-women-of-country/|title=CMT Announces Next Women of Country Class of 2019|last=Houghton|first=Cillea|website=Taste of Country|date=24 November 2018 |language=en|access-date=2019-01-16}}</ref>\n\n===2019\u2013present: ''If I Was a Cowboy'' ===\nQuayle's highly anticipated EP ''If I Was a Cowboy'' was released on October 4, 2019. Rebel Engine Entertainment released the stripped-down version of the ''If I Was a Cowboy'' EP and \"My Home's in Montana\" in a video series, ''The Montana Sessions'' Presented by Wrangler, on February 14, 2020. She made her national daytime television debut performing \"Whatcha Drinkin 'Bout\" on ''The Kelly Clarkson Show''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://xlcountry.com/stephanie-quayle-on-the-kelly-clarkson-show-tuesday/|title=Stephanie Quayle on 'The Kelly Clarkson Show|last=Hart|first=Ally|website=XL Country|date=4 August 2020 |language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref>\n\nQuayle was named in 2020 as the First Female Country Music Ambassador for Bass Pro Shops and Cabela's.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2019/11/industry-ink-music-for-kids-stephanie-quayle-rumble-on-the-row-wme/|title=Industry Ink: Music For Kids, Stephanie Quayle, Rumble On The Row, WME|last=Hollabaugh|first=Lorie|website=Music Row|date=19 November 2019 |language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> She has teamed up with national brands Harley-Davidson,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.allaccess.com/country/artist-info/q/id/14327/stephanie-quayle|title=Stephanie Quayle|website=All Access|language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> Kampgrounds Of America (KOA),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://koa.com/blog/stephanie-quayle/|title=SEE STEPHANIE QUAYLE AT A KOA NEAR YOU|website=KOA.COM|language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> Winnebago,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.allaccess.com/country/artist-info/q/id/10691/stephanie-quayle|title=Stephanie Quayle|website=All Access|language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> Wrangler,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2019/07/stephanie-quayle-teams-with-wrangler-for-national-day-of-the-american-cowboy-tour/|title=Stephanie Quayle Teams With Wrangler For National Day of the American Cowboy Tour|website=Music Row|date=19 July 2019 |language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> Murdoch's Ranch & Home Supply,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://blog.murdochs.com/tag/stephanie-quayle/|title=Stephanie Quayle |website=The Dirt|language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> and Running Iron Whiskey.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.runningironwhiskey.com/ambassadors|title=Ambassadors|website=Running Iron Whiskey|language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> She is an active supporter of charitable organizations including the American Heart Association's Go Red For Women movement,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www2.heart.org/site/SPageNavigator/donatenow_GRFW.html|title=American Heart Association|website=American Heart Association|language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> Care Camps,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://koacarecamps.org/dometic-and-care-camps-partner-to-support-oncology-camps/|title=Dometic And Care Camps Partner to Support Oncology Camps|website=Care Camps|date=February 2020 |language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> Gibson Gives,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.kulr8.com/regional/bozeman-gibson-factory-donates-24-guitars-to-gallatin-high-school/article_1b0325c2-a943-54fb-a13a-b02c7da88405.html|title=Bozeman Gibson Factory donates 24 guitars to Gallatin High School|website=KULR8.COM|date=9 September 2020 |language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref> and St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/stephanie-quayle-cherishes-the-mental-healing-of-st-jude/|title=Stephanie Quayle Cherishes the Mental Healing of St. Jude |last=Dukes|first=Billy|website=Taste of Country|date=7 February 2019 |language=en|access-date=2020-09-16}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Hunter_Brothers","to":"Hunter Brothers"}],"pages":{"50439665":{"pageid":50439665,"ns":0,"title":"Hunter Brothers","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|Canadian country music group}}\n{{Use Canadian English|date=December 2017}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Hunter Brothers\n| image           = Hunter Brothers Promo Picture.jpg\n| caption         =\n| image_size      =\n| alias           =\n| origin          = [[Shaunavon, Saskatchewan]], Canada\n| genre           = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}}\n| years_active    = 2016\u2013present\n| label           = [[Open Road Recordings|Open Road]]\n| website         = {{URL|http://www.hunterbrothers.com/}}\n| current_members = Luke Hunter<br />J.J. Hunter<br />Ty Hunter<br />Brock Hunter<br />Dusty Hunter\n| past_members    = \n}}\n'''Hunter Brothers''' is a Canadian [[country music]] group from [[Shaunavon, Saskatchewan]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Fresh Find: Hunter Brothers|url=http://topcountry.ca/fresh-find-hunter-brothers/|access-date=May 5, 2016|work=Top Country|date=February 5, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Dahlman|first1=Ryan|title=Brothers hunting for mainstream success, but won't forget their roots|url=http://www.prairiepost.com/entertainment/music/item/9534-brothers-hunting-for-mainstream-success-but-won-t-forget-their-roots.html|access-date=May 5, 2016|work=[[Prairie Post]]|date=February 17, 2016|archive-date=June 1, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160601120228/https://www.prairiepost.com/entertainment/music/item/9534-brothers-hunting-for-mainstream-success-but-won-t-forget-their-roots.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> composed of brothers Luke, J.J., Ty, Brock and Dusty Hunter.<ref>{{cite news|title=From combine to recording studio: Sask.'s Hunter Brothers forge music career|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/sask-hunter-brothers-forge-music-career-1.3521682|access-date=May 5, 2016|work=[[CBC News]]|date=April 5, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Park|first1=Norm|title=Hunter Brothers seeking traction on country and western circuit|url=http://www.estevanmercury.ca/news/arts-entertainment/hunter-brothers-seeking-traction-on-country-and-western-circuit-1.2182127|access-date=May 5, 2016|work=Estevan Mercury|date=February 24, 2016}}</ref> They signed with [[Open Road Recordings]] and released their debut single, \"El Dorado\", in February 2016.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Jarrell|first1=Beth|title=Hunter Brothers ready to hit airwaves|url=http://www.gulllakeadvance.com/?p=2552|access-date=May 5, 2016|work=Gull Lake Advance|date=February 4, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160512002918/http://www.gulllakeadvance.com/?p=2552|archive-date=May 12, 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Schreiner |first1=Penny |title=New Single From The Hunter Brothers |url=http://www.swiftcurrentonline.com/local/18-ckswcjsn-blog/33754-new-single-from-the-hunter-brothers |access-date=May 5, 2016 |work=Swift Current |date=February 9, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160531142256/http://www.swiftcurrentonline.com/local/18-ckswcjsn-blog/33754-new-single-from-the-hunter-brothers |archive-date=May 31, 2016 }}</ref> It debuted on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart in March 2016.<ref name=\"Canada Country\" /> The band earned their first Top 10 single at Canadian country radio with their hit \"[[Born and Raised (Hunter Brothers song)|Born and Raised]]\".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://topcountry.ca/top-country-charts-jan-2-2018/|title=Top Country Charts: Hunter Brothers Earn Their First Top 10|date=2018-01-02|work=Top Country Music {{!}} Country Music News, Charts, Playlists, Videos|access-date=2018-01-10|language=en-US}}</ref> In 2019, their single \"[[Lost (Hunter Brothers song)|Lost]]\" became their first #1 hit.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://globalnews.ca/news/5146735/saskatchewan-hunter-brothers-lost/|title=Saskatchewan's Hunter Brothers celebrate first No. 1 hit|first=Erin|last=McNutt|work=[[Global News]]|date=April 9, 2019}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nThe Hunter Brothers are a Canadian country band consisting of 5 brothers from Shaunavon, Saskatchewan: Luke, J.J., Ty, Brock, and Dusty. Their parents are Lorne and Norma Hunter,<ref name=\"mercury\">{{Cite web|url=http://www.estevanmercury.ca/news/arts-entertainment/hunter-brothers-seeking-traction-on-country-and-western-circuit-1.2182127|title=Hunter Brothers seeking traction on country and western circuit|date=2016-02-24|website=www.estevanmercury.ca|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref> and their uncle [[Jim Hunter (skier)|Jim Hunter]] is a Canadian Olympic skier.<ref name=\"vegas-sun\">{{Cite web|url=https://m.lasvegassun.com/news/2008/oct/04/canadians-hockey-dreams-lead-las-vegas/|title=Canadian's hockey dreams lead to Las Vegas|date=2008-10-04|website=www.lasvegassun.com/|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref>\n\nThese brothers grew up farming in the Canadian prairies. They spent their summers singing in churches across the country. In the Winter, they were heavily involved in the hockey community. Some of the brothers even played for some major league teams.\n\nWhen the 5 brothers are at home working on the farm, they often pass the time in the field by re-writing well known songs with words that are relevant to farming culture, performing them over their CB radios. They often share these songs online through their various social media platforms.\n\n==Hockey Careers==\nFour of the five brothers played [[junior ice hockey]] and three played in the professional [[minor leagues]]. J.J., Dustin, and Luke each played forward, while Brock and Ty were [[defenceman|defencemen]]. Ty played rep hockey before suffering a broken femur.<ref name=\"mercury\" /> The remaining four brothers all sustained injuries of various kinds and returned home to continue farming with their parents on their family's 20,000 acre farm.<ref name=\"vegas-sun\" />\n\nJ.J. Hunter played three seasons in [[Western Hockey League]] with the [[Kelowna Rockets]] and [[Prince Albert Raiders]]; he attended six NHL training camps (1999 Detroit Red Wings, 2001-2006 Edmonton Oilers) and was under contract with the Edmonton Oilers for 5 seasons playing NHL pre-season games and five years in their farm system. Altogether, he played 6 years of pro-hockey including parts of six seasons in the [[American Hockey League]] with the [[Hamilton Bulldogs (AHL)|Hamilton Bulldogs]], [[Toronto Roadrunners]], [[Edmonton Road Runners]], [[Toronto Marlies]] and [[Manitoba Moose]]; and parts of four season in the [[ECHL]] with the [[Toledo Storm]] and [[Columbus Cottonmouths]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hockeydb.com/ihdb/stats/pdisplay.php?pid=45154|title=J.J. Hunter hockey statistics and profile|date=|website=www.hockeydb.com|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref>\n\nDustin Hunter played junior hockey with the [[Melville Millionaires]] in the [[Saskatchewan Junior Hockey League]], then one professional season split between the [[Oklahoma City Blazers (1992\u20132009)|Oklahoma City Blazers]] and [[San Angelo Saints]] in the [[Central Hockey League]] before his career was abruptly ended due to a severe eye injury.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hockeydb.com/ihdb/stats/pdisplay.php?pid=73308|title=Dustin Hunter hockey statistics and profile|date=|website=www.hockeydb.com|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref>\n \nLuke Hunter played five seasons in the WHL with the [[Swift Current Broncos]], and one season each with the [[Wichita Thunder]] in the CHL, and the [[University of Calgary]] [[Calgary Dinos men's ice hockey|Dinos men's ice hockey team]] in the [[U Sports|CIS]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hockeydb.com/ihdb/stats/pdisplay.php?pid=62597|title=Luke Hunter hockey statistics and profile|date=|website=www.hockeydb.com|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref> His career also came to a halt due to an eye injury.\n \nBrock Hunter played junior hockey in the AJHL with the Drumheller Dragons, and the Fort McMurray Oil Barons before finishing up his career with the [[Kindersley Klippers]] in the SJHL.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hockeydb.com/ihdb/stats/pdisplay.php?pid=101032|title=Brock Hunter hockey statistics and profile|date=|website=www.hockeydb.com|access-date=2017-10-31}}</ref>\n\nAll the brothers joined forces together when they returned home to play for the same hometown hockey team, the Shaunavon Badgers in the WMHL.\n\n== Music career ==\n===Early years===\nMusic has always brought these 5 brothers together. When they were younger, they spent their time mirroring music videos from other artists, and learning to become performers. What emerged was an organic pop-country sound. The Hunter Brothers quickly became known for their harmonies<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.estevanmercury.ca/news/arts-entertainment/hunter-brothers-seeking-traction-on-country-and-western-circuit-1.2182127|title=Hunter Brothers seeking traction on country and western circuit|last=Park|first=Norm|website=Estevan Mercury|access-date=2020-04-02}}</ref> and stage presence.\n\n===2016\u20132018: ''Getaway''===\nIn 2016, the brothers started recording a collection of songs with their label [[Open Road Recordings]]. On February 5, 2016 they released their debut single \u201cEl Dorado\u201d to country radio<ref name=\":1\">{{Cite web|url=http://www.openroadrecordings.com/albums/hunter-brothers-eldorado/|title=Hunter Brothers \u2013 El Dorado \u2013 Open Road Recordings|language=en|access-date=2020-04-02|archive-date=2020-08-14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200814101818/https://openroadrecordings.com/albums/hunter-brothers-eldorado/|url-status=dead}}</ref> which helped put this new band on the map within the Canadian country music industry. \"El Dorado\" was co-produced by Brad Rempel of Canadian country band [[High Valley]]<ref name=\":1\" /> along with Seth Mosley and Mike \"X\" O'Connor\n\n\u201cEl Dorado\u201d debuted on the [[Billboard Canada]] Country charts in March 2016, and reach number 24 on the chart.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/hunter-brothers/chart-history/ccw/|title=Hunter Brothers|magazine=Billboard|access-date=2020-04-02}}</ref>\n\nIn the Spring of 2017, the Hunter Brothers released their debut album ''Getaway''. This album included two singles that earned them their first two songs that entered the top 10 on the Billboard charts: \u201cBorn and Raised\u201d, and \u201c[[Those Were the Nights]]\u201d.\n\nTheir single \"[[Born and Raised (song)|Born and Raised]]\" from their ''Getaway'' album was selected as the official anthem for the 2018 IIHF [[World Junior Hockey Championship|World Junior Hockey]] Tournament.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hockeycanada.ca/en-ca/news/2019-wjc-hunter-brothers-born-and-raised-in-hockey|title=Born and raised|website=www.hockeycanada.ca|language=en-ca|access-date=2020-04-02}}</ref> \u201cBorn and Raised\u201d also won Saskatchewan Music Award for Single of the Year.\n\nAfter the release of \u201cEl Dorado\u201d, the Hunter Brothers were nominated for four Saskatchewan Country Music Association Awards, and won for both Group of the Year, and Emerging Artist categories.<ref name=\":2\" />\n\n===2019\u2013present: ''State of Mind'' and ''Been a Minute''===\nIn January 2019, they released their sophomore album ''[[State of Mind (Hunter Brothers album)|State of Mind]]''. The record showcases the brothers\u2019 talent and growth. The first single from the record \u201c[[Lost (Hunter Brothers song)|Lost]]\u201d has been certified Gold<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rgkentertainment.com/pressreleases/2019/12/05/hb-lost-gold|title=HUNTER BROTHERS' SMASH HIT, \"LOST\", CERTIFIED GOLD IN CANADA|website=RGK Entertainment Group|language=en-US|access-date=2020-04-02}}</ref> in Canada and became their first #1 single at Canadian Country Radio. \u201c[[Lost (Hunter Brothers song)|Lost]]\u201d was also awarded Single of the Year at the 2019 Saskatchewan Music Awards.<ref name=\":3\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.saskmusic.org/editors-news/view,806/6950/the-2019-saskatchewan-music-award-winners|title=The 2019 Saskatchewan Music Award Winners {{!}} News {{!}} News & Articles|website=www.saskmusic.org|access-date=2020-04-02}}</ref> The album also included the singles, \u201cNorthern Lights\u201d and \u201cSilver Lining\u201d.\n\nIn 2019, their album ''State of Mind'' was the number one selling country album in Canada for four consecutive weeks and has had over 10 million streams worldwide.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.openroadrecordings.com/news/hunter-brothers-new-album-state-of-mind/|title=Hunter Brothers New Album, State of Mind \u2013 Open Road Recordings|language=en|access-date=2020-04-02}}{{Dead link|date=August 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Earlier in 2019, the Hunter Brothers joined country superstars [[Paul Brandt]], [[Jess Moskaluke]] and [[High Valley]] for The Journey Tour on 26 dates across Canada. They debuted at CMA Fest in Nashville, and also landed three [[CCMA Awards|CCMA Award]] nominations. The band was nominated for 2 [[Juno Award|JUNO Awards]] in 2020 for Country Album of the Year for their sophomore album ''[[State of Mind (Hunter Brothers album)|State of Mind]]'' and Breakthrough Group of the Year.\n\nOn June 30, 2021, they released their third studio album ''Been a Minute'', which included the singles \"[[Hard Dirt]]\" and \"[[Been a Minute]]\".<ref name=\"BaM\">{{cite web|title=Hunter Brothers Drop New Album, Been A Minute June 30th|url=https://topcountry.ca/hunter-brothers-drop-new-album/|work=Top Country|access-date=July 2, 2021|date=June 30, 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn May 12, 2023, the Hunter Brothers released the extended play ''Burning Down the Barn'', which they are supporting with the aptly-named \"Burning Down the Barn Tour\" across Canada in the fall of 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.country93.ca/events/373569/|title=Hunter Brothers \"Burning Down The Barn\" Tour|work=Country93|access-date=November 27, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Tours==\n*''Burning Down the Barn Tour'' (2023)\n\n==Discography==\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"David_James_(singer)","to":"David James (singer)"}],"pages":{"49487561":{"pageid":49487561,"ns":0,"title":"David James (singer)","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|Canadian country pop singer-songwriter}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2019}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = David James\n| image           =\n| caption         =\n| image_size      =\n| birth_date      =\n| birth_name      =\n| birth_place     = [[Winnipeg]], Manitoba, Canada<ref>{{cite news|last1=Melanson|first1=Jenna|title=Interview \u2013 David James|url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2015/10/15/interview-david-james/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Canadian Beats|date=October 15, 2015}}</ref>\n| origin          =\n| instrument      =\n| genre           = [[Country pop]]<ref>{{cite news|title=David James - Spotify|url=https://open.spotify.com/artist/6JKG9xGqoyj7oMHF0ta147?si=C2heO-xTSKuz4Rxylx6mJw|accessdate=March 23, 2020|work=[[Spotify]]}}</ref>\n| occupation      = Singer-songwriter\n| years_active    = 2013\u2013present\n| label           = [[MDM Recordings Inc.|MDM]]\n| associated_acts =\n| website         = {{URL|davidjamesmusic.ca/}}\n}}\n'''David James''' is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter. James was nominated for the 2014 [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Discovery Award and 2017 Rising Star Award.<ref>{{cite news|title=Media Release: Top Six Finalists Announced For The 2014 CCMA Discovery Program|url=http://www.ccma.org/cgi/page.cgi/_article.html/News/Media_Release_Top_Six_Finalists_Announced_for_the_2014_CCMA_Discovery_Program-2014-06-11|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[Canadian Country Music Association]]|date=April 30, 2014|archive-date=March 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160302194551/http://www.ccma.org/cgi/page.cgi/_article.html/News/Media_Release_Top_Six_Finalists_Announced_for_the_2014_CCMA_Discovery_Program-2014-06-11|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\nIn August 2014, he signed to [[MDM Recordings Inc.]]<ref>{{cite news|last1=Harr|first1=Dan|title=MDM Recordings Inc. Signs CCMA Nominee David James|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/mdm-recordings-inc-signs-ccma-nominee-david-james/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Music News Nashville|date=August 14, 2014|archive-date=March 3, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303020057/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/mdm-recordings-inc-signs-ccma-nominee-david-james/|url-status=dead}}</ref> His first single for the label, \"What We Weren't Looking For\", was released in February 2015.<ref name=\"cmr\">{{cite news|title=David James Releases New Single \"What We Weren't Looking For\"|url=http://cmrnashville.com/news-details.php?id=20957|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=CMR Nashville|date=February 18, 2015|archive-date=March 1, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160301193335/http://cmrnashville.com/news-details.php?id=20957|url-status=dead}}</ref> A music video for the song debuted on [[CMT (Canadian TV channel)|CMT]] in March.<ref name=\"cmr\" /> The song peaked at number 27 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart in June.<ref name=\"Canada Country\" /> James' second single for MDM, \"Some Hearts\", was released in September.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Melanson|first1=Jenna|title=New single released by David James|url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2015/09/29/new-single-released-by-david-james/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Canadian Beats|date=September 29, 2015}}</ref> His third single for the label, \"Lonely Girl\", was released on March 8, 2016.<ref name=\"beats\">{{cite news|last1=Dagg|first1=Nanci|title=Interview \u2013 David James|url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2016/02/14/interview-david-james-2/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Canadian Beats|date=February 14, 2016}}</ref> All three songs are included on an [[extended play]], ''Songs About a Girl'', released on March 11.<ref name=\"beats\" /> In 2020, James released the extended play ''[[If I Were You (EP)|If I Were You]]'', which included the singles \"Cars, Girls, And The Radio\",<ref>{{cite web|title=David James releases new single, \"Cars, Girls, & The Radio\"|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2018/11/06/david-james-releases-new-single-cars-girls-the-radio/|work=Canadian Beats Media|first=Amanda|last=Hather|date=November 6, 2018}}</ref> \"All the Time\",<ref>{{cite web|title=EXCLUSIVE PREMIERE: David James \"All The Time\"|url=https://www.completecountry.ca/article.php?article_id=5362|work=Complete Country|date=October 15, 2019}}</ref> and the title track whose co-writers include [[Tyler Hubbard]] of [[Florida Georgia Line]] and [[Hardy (singer)|Hardy]].<ref>{{cite news|title= CANADIAN COUNTRY ARTIST DAVID JAMES DELIVERS NEW EP \"IF I WERE YOU\", AVAILABLE TODAY|url= https://davidjamesmusic.ca/canadian-country-artist-david-james-delivers-new-ep-if-i-were-you-available-today/ |accessdate=March 31, 2020|work=David James Official Website|date=March 13, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=David James releases new EP, If I Were You |url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2020/03/25/david-james-releases-new-ep-if-i-were-you/ |work=Canadian Beats Media|first=Max|last=Reid|date=March 25, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Top Country Pick: David James 'If I Were You'|url=https://topcountry.ca/top-country-pick-david-james-if-i-were-you/|work=Top Country|date=March 13, 2020}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n===Extended plays===\n{| class=\"wikitable
