to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"MacKenzie_Porter","to":"MacKenzie Porter"}],"pages":{"40317432":{"pageid":40317432,"ns":0,"title":"MacKenzie Porter","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|Canadian actress, singer (born 1990)}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = MacKenzie Porter\n| image           =\n| caption         =\n| image_size      =\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1990|01|29}}\n| birth_name      = MacKenzie Lea Porter\n| birth_place     = [[Medicine Hat]], Alberta, Canada\n| origin          =\n| instrument      = {{flatlist|\n* Vocals\n* piano\n* violin\n}}\n| genre           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Country music|Country]]\n* [[country pop]]\n}}\n| occupation      = {{flatlist|\n* Singer-songwriter\n* actress\n}}\n| years_active    = 2007\u2013present\n| label           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Big Loud]]\n* Road Angel\n}}\n| website         = {{URL|www.mackenzieporter.com/}}\n}}\n\n'''MacKenzie Lea Porter''' (born January 29, 1990<ref>{{cite tweet|user=MacKenziePMusic|author=MacKenzie Porter|number=817896236346961920|date=January 7, 2017|title=Love all the birthday wishes but it's actually not my birthday!! jan 29th}}</ref>) is a Canadian [[country music|country]] singer, songwriter, and actress. She has released two albums (''MacKenzie Porter'' and ''[[Nobody's Born with a Broken Heart]]'') and achieved four [[Canada Country]] number ones with \"[[About You (MacKenzie Porter song)|About You]]\", \"[[These Days (MacKenzie Porter song)|These Days]]\", \"[[Seeing Other People (song)|Seeing Other People]]\", and \"[[Pickup (song)|Pickup]]\". She is featured on [[Dustin Lynch]]'s number one [[Country Airplay]] hit \"[[Thinking 'Bout You (Dustin Lynch song)|Thinking 'Bout You]]\". As an actor she is best known for her leading role as a future-sent medic in the television series ''[[Travelers (TV series)|Travelers]]''.\n\n==Early life==\nMacKenzie Porter was raised on a cattle and bison ranch near [[Medicine Hat|Medicine Hat, Alberta]].<ref name=\"ottawa\">{{cite news|last=Pape|first=Hendrik|title=MacKenzie Porter almost ready to take off|url=https://www.soundcheckentertainment.ca/mackenzie-porter-almost-ready-to-take-off/|newspaper=Sound Check Entertainment|date=August 10, 2011}}</ref> She began studying piano, violin, and voice at age four.<ref name=\"ottawa\" /> While growing up she toured in a family band with her brother, 2004 ''[[Canadian Idol]]'' winner [[Kalan Porter]].<ref name=\"ottawa\" /> Their grandfather [[Robert Harold Porter|Bob Porter]] was [[Member of Parliament (Canada)|Member of Parliament]] for [[Medicine Hat (federal electoral district)|Medicine Hat]] from 1988 to 1993.\n\n==Film and TV career==\nPorter has appeared in numerous films and television productions, including ''[[Dinosapien]]'' (2007), ''[[Hell on Wheels (TV series)|Hell on Wheels]]'', and ''[[Travelers (TV series)|Travelers]]'' (2016). She earned a Best Actress in Alberta award for her role in the 2008 television film ''The Other Woman''.<ref name=\"ctv\">{{cite news|last=Block|first=Sheri|title='The Horses of McBride' a perfect fit for Alberta actress MacKenzie Porter|url=http://www.ctv.ca/2012HolidayProgrammingGuide/article/e2809cThe-Horses-of-McBridee2809d-a-perfect-fit-for-Alberta-actress-MacKenzie-Porter|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121215214552/http://www.ctv.ca/2012HolidayProgrammingGuide/article/e2809cThe-Horses-of-McBridee2809d-a-perfect-fit-for-Alberta-actress-MacKenzie-Porter|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 15, 2012|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=[[CTV Television Network|CTV]]|date=December 14, 2012}}</ref> She was also named as one of the Top 11 Hottest Vancouver Actors to Watch for in 2011 by ''BC Living'' magazine.<ref>{{cite news|last=Leary|first=Joe|title=Top 11 Hottest Vancouver Actors to Watch for 2011 Recap|url=http://www.bcliving.ca/entertainment/top-11-hottest-vancouver-actors-to-watch-for-2011-recap|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=BC Living|date=February 16, 2012}}</ref>\n\n==Music career==\n===Early career: Self-titled album===\nAfter moving to [[Vancouver]] to pursue acting, Porter teamed up with musician and actor Andrew Jenkins to form the band The Black Boots.<ref name=\"metro\">{{cite news|last=Jafri|first=Amen|title=Singer finds her own path|url=http://metronews.ca/news/ottawa/22223/singer-finds-her-own-path/|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=[[Metro International|Metro News]]|date=August 11, 2011|archive-date=August 22, 2013|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130822002336/http://metronews.ca/news/ottawa/22223/singer-finds-her-own-path/|url-status=dead}}</ref> In 2010, she launched a solo career.<ref name=\"metro\" /> Porter was the winner of the 2011 Nashville North Star competition.<ref>{{cite news|last=Turner|first=Katie|title=A star is rising in Nashville North|url=http://metronews.ca/news/calgary/25793/a-star-is-rising-in-nashville-north/|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=[[Metro International|Metro News]]|date=July 12, 2011|archive-date=August 22, 2013|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130822002258/http://metronews.ca/news/calgary/25793/a-star-is-rising-in-nashville-north/|url-status=dead}}</ref> She has opened for [[Kenny Chesney]], [[Doc Walker]], and [[Trooper (band)|Trooper]] among others,<ref name=\"ctv\" /> and has performed for Prime Minister [[Stephen Harper]] and [[Gene Simmons]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Dahlman|first=Ryan|title=Sky is the limit for talented southeast Albertan|url=http://www.prairiepost.com/entertainment/music/item/2737-sky-is-the-limit-for-talented-southeast-albertan.html|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=[[Prairie Post]]|date=July 25, 2012|archive-date=March 4, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304061918/http://www.prairiepost.com/entertainment/music/item/2737-sky-is-the-limit-for-talented-southeast-albertan.html|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nIn October 2012, Porter released her debut single, \"I Wish I'd Known\".<ref>{{cite news|title=Artists flood music market with new singles|url=http://www.canada.com/story.html?id=26c04615-cd70-401b-b4af-a7ddb6e6118a|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=[[Postmedia News]]|date=October 2, 2012|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924122853/http://www.canada.com/story.html?id=26c04615-cd70-401b-b4af-a7ddb6e6118a|archive-date=September 24, 2015}}</ref> Her second single, \"[[Never Gonna Let You]]\", was co-written and produced by [[Carolyn Dawn Johnson]].<ref name=\"prairie\">{{cite news|last=Sanchez|first=Rose|title=MacKenzie Porter gets a nod from CCMA's with Rising Star nomination|url=http://www.prairiepost.com/entertainment/music/item/4649-mackenzie-porter-gets-a-nod-from-ccma-s-with-rising-star-nomination.html|archive-date=September 24, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924080904/https://prairiepost.com/entertainment/music/item/4649-mackenzie-porter-gets-a-nod-from-ccma-s-with-rising-star-nomination.html|newspaper=[[Prairie Post]]|date=July 31, 2013|access-date=February 10, 2022}}</ref> Porter was chosen as one of six acts for the inaugural [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Discovery Program in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|last=Brown|first=Chris|title=Hat's MacKenzie Porter selected for inaugural CCMA Discovery Program|url=http://medicinehatnews.com/2013/06/entertainment/local-entertainment/hats-mackenzie-porter-selected-for-inaugural-ccma-discovery-program/|access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=[[Medicine Hat News]]|date=June 8, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130615101937/http://medicinehatnews.com/2013/06/entertainment/local-entertainment/hats-mackenzie-porter-selected-for-inaugural-ccma-discovery-program/|archive-date=June 15, 2013}}</ref> She was also nominated for the Rising Star Award at the 2013 Canadian Country Music Association Awards.<ref name=\"prairie\" /> Her debut album was released on July 15, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|last=Pederson|first=Casadie|title=Fresh Find \u2013 MacKenzie Porter|url=http://topcountry.ca/fresh-find-mackenzie-porter/ |access-date=August 21, 2013|newspaper=Top Country|date=March 15, 2013}}</ref> She is featured on the song \"Circles\" on [[Chris Lane]]'s album ''[[Girl Problems]]'' in 2016.<ref>{{cite web|last=Black|first=Lauren|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/music/chris-lane-releases-girl-problems-track-list-cover-art/ |title=Chris Lane Reveals 'Girl Problems' Track List, Cover Art |publisher=Sounds Like Nashville |date=2016-07-13 |access-date=2016-08-03}}</ref>\n\n===2018\u20132022: ''Drinkin' Songs'', Big Loud Records, five number ones===\nIn 2018, Porter signed with [[Nashville]]-based [[Big Loud]] and became their first Canadian artist.<ref>{{cite news|title=MacKenzie Porter Returns with Announcement of New Music|url=https://bigloudrecords.com/mackenzie-porter-returns-with-announcement-of-new-music/|date=November 30, 2018|work=[[Big Loud Records]]|access-date=March 20, 2021}}</ref> She released the single \"[[About You (MacKenzie Porter song)|About You]]\", co-written by [[Hardy (singer)|Hardy]]. The song would hit number one on [[Canada Country]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Bickell|first=Dutch|title=Mackenzie Porter celebrates her first number one song \"About You\"|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2019/05/23/mackenzie-porter-celebrates-her-first-number-one-song-about-you/|date=May 23, 2019|work=Canadian Beats Media|access-date=January 7, 2021}}</ref> Porter is featured on the [[Dallas Smith]] song \"Friends Don't Let Friends Drink Alone\" with [[Dean Brody]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.completecountry.ca/article.php?article_id=4562|title=Dallas Smith Releases 'The Fall'|date=22 March 2019|website=Complete Country|access-date=20 March 2021|archive-date=6 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200806192928/https://www.completecountry.ca/article.php?article_id=4562|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nIn March 2019, Porter released the single \"[[These Days (MacKenzie Porter song)|These Days]]\", which charted on Canadian country, pop, and adult hits charts as well as on the US [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]] charts.<ref name=\"FYI\">{{cite news|first=Kerry|last=Doole|title=Music News Digest, June 15, 2020|url=https://www.fyimusicnews.ca/articles/2020/06/15/music-news-digest-june-15-2020|access-date=July 10, 2020|work=FYI Music News|date=June 15, 2020}}</ref> It also reached number one on [[Canada Country]], making Porter the first Canadian woman to land back-to-back Number Ones since [[Shania Twain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/mackenzie-porter-makes-her-u-s-country-radio-debut-with-these-days/|title=Mackenzie Porter Makes Her U.S. Country Radio Debut with \"These Days\"|work=The Country Note|date=April 27, 2020|access-date=July 10, 2020}}</ref> She then opened for [[Dallas Smith]] and [[Dean Brody]] on their co-headlining cross-Canada ''Friends Don't Let Friends Tour Alone Tour''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dean Brody's New Single, New Album and New Tour|first=Randy|last=Owen|url=https://www.country1011.com/2019/08/21/dean-brodys-new-single-new-album-and-new-tour/|work=101.1 Country|publisher=[[Rogers Media]]|date=August 21, 2019}}</ref> In February 2020, Porter released \"[[Seeing Other People (song)|Seeing Other People]]\" which would become her third consecutive number one, making her the first woman (Canadian or American) to land three consecutive Number Ones on Canadian country radio since Twain.<ref>{{cite web|first=Jason|last=Scott|url=https://americansongwriter.com/dustin-lynch-mackenzie-porter-thinking-bout-you-song-interview/|title=Dustin Lynch Revamps \"Thinking 'Bout You\" With MacKenzie Porter|work=American Songwriter|date=March 19, 2021}}</ref>\n\nPorter's EP ''[[Drinkin' Songs: The Collection]]'' was released in November 2020.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://vancouversun.com/entertainment/5-things-to-know-about-drinkin-songs-the-collection-by-mackenzie-porter|title= 5 things to know about Drinkin' Songs: The Collection by MacKenzie Porter|work=[[Vancouver Sun]]|first=Stuart|last=Derdeyn|date=November 18, 2020}}</ref> The EP was her debut American release and included her three chart-toppers in addition to her top five hit \"[[Drinkin' Songs]]\".<ref>{{cite web|title= REVIEW: Mackenzie Porter \u2013 Drinkin' Songs \u2013 The Collection|url=https://www.offtherecorduk.com/review-mackenzie-porter-drinkin-songs-the-collection/ |work=Off the Record UK|date=November 6, 2020}}</ref> It received a nomination for Country Album of the Year at the [[2021 Juno Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://medicinehatnews.com/news/local-news/2021/03/12/mackenzie-porter-nominated-for-best-country-album-at-junos/|title=Mackenzie Porter nominated for best country album at Junos|work=Medicine Hat News|first=Collin|last=Gallant|date=March 12, 2021}}</ref> In March 2021, she featured on the [[Dustin Lynch]] single \"[[Thinking 'Bout You (Dustin Lynch song)|Thinking 'Bout You]]\",<ref name=\"TBY\">{{cite news|title= Dustin Lynch Teams With MacKenzie Porter for a Conversational New Version of 'Thinking 'Bout You' [Listen]|first=Carena|last=Liptak|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/dustin-lynch-mackenzie-porter-thinking-bout-you/|work=Taste of Country|date=March 20, 2021}}</ref> and then joined Canadian pop artist [[Virginia to Vegas]] on the single \"[[This Sucks.]]\" in September 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fyimusicnews.ca/articles/2021/09/19/virginia-vegas-mackenzie-porter-earn-strong-radio-support|title=Virginia To Vegas & MacKenzie Porter Earn Strong Radio Support|work=FYI Music News|date=September 19, 2021}}</ref> She released the song \"[[Pickup (song)|Pickup]]\" later that year; it became a single in early 2022.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.discovermoosejaw.com/country-100/fresh-music-friday-song-of-the-day-mackenzie-porter-pickup|title=Fresh Music Friday Song Of The Day: MacKenzie Porter- \"Pickup\"|first=Courtney|last=Fielder|work=Country 100|date=February 4, 2022}}</ref> \"[[Thinking 'Bout You (Dustin Lynch song)|Thinking 'Bout You]]\" spent six weeks atop the [[Country Airplay]] chart, marking Porter's first number one in the U.S., and spent a record-breaking 28 weeks in the top ten.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/country-radio-chart-slowdown-dustin-lynch-tops-country-airplay-1235062380/|title=Country Radio's Chart Slowdown: 'We Must Still Take Chances \u2026 or We Will Become Irrelevant'|author=Jim Asker|date=April 22, 2022|publisher=Billboard|access-date=April 24, 2022}}</ref> Meanwhile, \"[[Pickup (song)|Pickup]]\" would go on to reach number one on Canada Country,<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/canada-country/2022-06-18|title=Canada Country chart for June 18, 2022|magazine=Billboard |access-date=June 14, 2022}}</ref> and achieve gold-certification.<ref name=\"MC certs\"/> Later that year, she joined fellow Canadian country artist [[Dallas Smith]] on the single \"[[One Too]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://countrynow.com/exclusive-premiere-dallas-smith-releases-music-video-for-one-too-with-mackenzie-porter/|title=Exclusive Premiere: Dallas Smith Releases Music Video For 'One Too' With MacKenzie Porter|first=Melinda|last=Lorge|date=June 22, 2022|work=Country Now|access-date=August 15, 2022}}</ref>\n\n===2023\u2013present: ''Nobody's Born with a Broken Heart''===\nIn March 2023, Porter participated in an all-star recording of [[Serena Ryder]]'s single \"[[What I Wouldn't Do]]\", which was released as a charity single to benefit [[Kids Help Phone]]'s Feel Out Loud campaign for youth mental health.<ref>Brent Furdyk, [https://web.archive.org/web/20230302170512/https://etcanada.com/news/972900/feel-out-loud-alessia-cara-serena-ryder-more-canadian-artists-collaborate-on-new-single-promoting-youth-mental-health-initiative/ \"Feel Out Loud: Alessia Cara, Serena Ryder & More Canadian Artists Collaborate On New Single Promoting Youth Mental Health Initiative\"]. ''[[Entertainment Tonight Canada]]'', March 2, 2023.</ref> In May 2023, she released \"[[Chasing Tornadoes]]\", the second single off her upcoming full-length album.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://entertainment-focus.com/2023/05/06/mackenzie-porter-releases-the-lainey-wilson-penned-chasing-tornadoes-from-her-upcoming-debut-album/|title=MacKenzie Porter releases the Lainey Wilson-penned 'Chasing Tornadoes' from her upcoming debut album|date=May 6, 2023|first=James|last=Daykin|work=Entertainment Focus|access-date=May 7, 2023}}</ref> In the fall of 2023, Porter embarked on her first tour named \"The Canadian Headlining Tour\".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2023/09/24/mackenzie-porter-shares-upcoming-tour-dates/|title=MACKENZIE PORTER SHARES UPCOMING TOUR DATES|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|work=Canadian Beats Media|date=September 24, 2023|access-date=January 26, 2024}}</ref> While on tour, she released the single \"[[Bet You Break My Heart]]\".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.circleallaccess.com/circles-release-of-the-week-mackenzie-porters-bet-you-break-my-heart/|title=Circle\u2019s Release of the Week: MacKenzie Porter\u2019s \"Bet You Break My Heart\"|work=Circle All Access|first=Megan|last=Grisham|date=November 17, 2023|access-date=January 26, 2024}}</ref> Porter also joined Canadian pop singer [[Elijah Woods x Jamie Fine#Elijah Woods|Elijah Woods]] on a new version of his song \"Last Girl\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2023/11/07/elijah-woods-unveils-new-version-of-last-girl-ft-mackenzie-porter/|title=ELIJAH WOODS UNVEILS NEW VERSION OF \"LAST GIRL\" FT. MACKENZIE PORTER|first=Jenna|last=Melanson|work=Canadian Beats Media|date=November 7, 2023|access-date=January 26, 2024}}</ref>\n\nIn January 2024, Porter announced the release of her second full-length studio album, ''[[Nobody's Born with a Broken Heart]]'' on Big Loud Records.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=13514|title=Porter finds \"Nobody's Born With A Broken Heart,\"|work=Country Standard Time|date=January 26, 2024}}</ref> The nineteen-track album was released on April 26, 2024, and includes the singles \"[[Pickup (song)|Pickup]]\", \"[[Chasing Tornadoes]]\", and \"Bet You Break My Heart\", as well as four songs that were released concurrently with the album's announcement, including \"Easy to Miss\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int-www.breakfasttelevision.ca/videos/canadian-country-singer-mackenzie-porter-performs-her-new-song-easy-to-miss/|title=Canadian Country Singer MacKenzie Porter performs her new song \"Easy to Miss\"|date=January 26, 2024|work=[[Breakfast Television]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://countrytown.com/news/mackenzie-porter-announces-debut-album-nobody-s-born-with-a-broken-heart/9IRK5uno6-o/27-01-24|title=MacKenzie Porter Announces Debut Album 'Nobody\u2019s Born With A Broken Heart'|first=Mary|last=Varvaris|work=Countrytown|date=January 27, 2024|access-date=January 31, 2024}}</ref> Porter received six nominations at the [[2024 Canadian Country Music Awards]], and won Female Artist of the Year.<ref name=\"CCMAXXIV\"/> She also co-hosted the award show alongside [[Thomas Rhett]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ca.billboard.com/music/country/american-country-star-thomas-rhett-will-host-2024-ccma-awards-with-mackenzie-porter|title=American Country Star Thomas Rhett Will Host 2024 CCMA Awards with MacKenzie Porter|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] Canada|date=April 9, 2024|access-date=September 11, 2024}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nIn 2014 Porter and actor/singer-songwriter Jake Etheridge began dating. Etheridge appeared in the 2019 music video for Porter's 2018 song \"[[About You (MacKenzie Porter song)|About You]]\".<ref>{{cite news|last=Furdyk|first=Brent|title= MacKenzie Porter Unveils 'Edgy' New Video For Hit Single 'About You'|url= https://etcanada.com/news/428291/mackenzie-porter-unveils-edgy-new-video-for-hit-single-about-you/|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20190828081116/https://etcanada.com/news/428291/mackenzie-porter-unveils-edgy-new-video-for-hit-single-about-you/|url-status= dead|archive-date= August 28, 2019|access-date=June 13, 2020|newspaper=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|publisher=[[Corus Entertainment]]|date=March 9, 2019}}</ref> She and Etheridge were engaged in mid-/late May or early June 2019,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/By764NDgSKL/ |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/s/instagram/By764NDgSKL |archive-date=2021-12-24 |url-access=registration|title=\ud83d\udda4MACKENZIE PORTER\ud83d\udda4 on Instagram: \"YES YES YES YES YES!!! \ud83d\udc8d Lets get f****** MARRIED baby! We've been keeping this little secret for a few weeks now soaking it in with our\u2026\"|website=Instagram|access-date=2019-06-23}}{{cbignore}}</ref> and they married in July 2020.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://calgaryherald.com/entertainment/music/on-the-rise-albertas-mackenzie-porter-gets-married-releases-nashville-debut-drinkin-songs|title=On the rise: Alberta's MacKenzie Porter gets married, releases Nashville debut, Drinkin' Songs|work=[[Calgary Herald]]|date=November 11, 2020 |access-date=November 14, 2020}}</ref>\n\nIn November 2023, Porter announced she was pregnant with her and Etheridge's first child.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://countrytown.com/news/mackenzie-porter-shares-baby-news-and-pics/2SpnzczPzvE/03-11-23|title=Mackenzie Porter Shares Baby News (And Pics!)|date=November 3, 2023|first=Mary|last=Varvaris|work=Countrytown}}</ref> On March 14th, 2024 Mackenzie and her husband welcomed their first child, a daughter.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://people.com/mackenzie-porter-welcomes-first-baby-with-husband-jake-etheridge-exclusive-8612406/03-21-24|title=Mackenzie Porter Welcomes First Baby With Husband Jake Etheridge: 'Forever the Reason We Breathe.\" (Exclusive)}}</ref>\n\n==Tours==\n*''The Canadian Headline Tour'' (2023)\n\n==Filmography==\n{| class=\"wikitable sortable\"\n|-\n! 2024\n* Label: [[Big Loud]]\n|}\n\n===Extended plays===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! scope=\"col\"| Title\n! scope=\"col\"| Details\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| ''[[Drinkin' Songs: The Collection]]''\n| \n* Release date: November 6, 2020\n* Label: Big Loud\n|}\n\n===Singles===\n====As lead artist====\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! scope=\"col\" rowspan=\"2\"| Year\n! scope=\"col\" rowspan=\"2\" style=\"width:16em;\"| Title\n! scope=\"col\" colspan=\"7\"| Peak chart positions\n! scope=\"col\" rowspan=\"2\"| [[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]\n! scope=\"col\" rowspan=\"2\"| Album\n|- style=\"font-size:smaller;\"\n! scope=\"col\" style=\"width:4em;\"| [[Canadian Hot 100|CAN]]<br /><ref name=\"CAN\">Chart positions through February 2020: {{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/mackenzie-porter/chart-history/can/ |title=MacKenzie Porter Chart History This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"pages":{"58898406":{"pageid":58898406,"ns":0,"title":"Sykamore","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|Canadian country music singer-songwriter}}\n{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2021}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Sykamore\n| birth_name      = Jordan Ostrom\n| birth_place     = [[Carseland, Alberta]], Canada\n| instrument      = Vocals, guitar, piano, [[ukelele]]\n| genre           = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[Country pop|Country pop]]|[[Folk-pop|folk-pop]]}}\n| occupation      = {{hlist|Musician|singer-songwriter}}\n| years_active    = 2013\u2013present\n| label           = {{hlist|Music Knox Records|[[BMG Rights Management|BMG]]|Road Angel|[[Warner Music Canada]]}}\n| associated_acts = [[Rhett Akins]], [[Thomas Rhett]], Ryan Kinder\n| website         = {{official website|http://www.sykamoremusic.com/}}\n}}\n'''Jordan Ostrom''', known professionally as '''Sykamore''', is a [[Country music|country]] singer-songwriter from [[Carseland, Alberta]], Canada.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hollabaugh |first1=Lorie |title=Canadian Artist SYKAMORE Signs With Home Team Publishing |url=https://musicrow.com/2017/11/canadian-artist-sykamore-signs-with-home-team-publishing/ |website=MusicRow Magazine |date=14 November 2017 |publisher=MusicRow |access-date=28 October 2018}}</ref> She released her first EP, ''Self + Medicine,'' in January 2018.  In 2015 she was nominated for the [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Discovery Award.<ref name=\"Review \u2013 SYKAMORE\">{{cite web |last1=Bickell |first1=Dutch |title=Review \u2013 SYKAMORE |url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2018/01/23/review-sykamore/ |website=CanadianBeats |date=23 January 2018 |publisher=Canadian Beats Media |access-date=28 October 2018}}</ref> Her debut album ''[[Pinto (album)|Pinto]]'' was released in 2022.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://themusicexpress.ca/sykamores-pinto-fires-on-all-cylinders-nb/|title= Sykamore's 'Pinto' Fires On all Cylinders By Roman Mitz|date=August 28, 2022|access-date=September 2, 2022|work=The Music Express|first=Roman|last=Mitz}}</ref>\n\n==Biography==\nRaised on her family's ranch outside [[Calgary]], Ostrom grew up listening to country artists such as [[George Strait]], [[The Dixie Chicks]], and [[Alan Jackson]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Meet Alberta-born country singer Sykamore (Q&A) |url=https://www.queensofcountry.net/home/meet-alberta-born-country-singer-sykamore-qa |website=Queens of Country |access-date=28 October 2018}}</ref>\n\nAt the onset of her musical career, she made the decision to perform under a stage name.  She stated \"My real name is not a secret but I decided to take on another name mostly because I feel that my real name is not that memorable...I started thinking about titles that would reflect my music and I was thinking about how I would describe it and it was all very rootsy and tenacious and organic and it all lent itself to this sort of tree flavour and I thought, well maybe there's a tree name that would help us with titling this thing. And, honestly, sycamore was one of the first that I looked at and thought it was cool.\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Barber |first1=Jim |title=Calgary's Sykamore Releases Self + Medicine EP |url=http://www.musiclifemagazine.net/calgarys-sykamore-releases-self-medicine-ep/ |website=MusicLifeMagazine.net |date=8 January 2018 |access-date=28 October 2018}}</ref>\n\nSykamore received first prize in the [[ATB Financial]] All-Albertan Songwriting contest, with her original song, \"Heaven in the Pines.\"<ref name=\":0\">{{cite web |title=SYKAMORE BIO |url=http://projectwildcountry.com/2016-artists/sykamore/ |website=Project Wild |access-date=28 October 2018}}</ref> Her song ''I Can Make You Happy'' was featured on Season 8 of the Canadian television series ''[[Heartland (Canadian TV series)|Heartland]]''. In 2015 she was nominated for the [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Discovery Award.<ref name=\"Review \u2013 SYKAMORE\"/>\n\nIn 2017, Sykamore signed with Home Team Publishing in [[Nashville]] after being discovered on Twitter by [[Rhett Akins]], one of the company's co-founders along with his son [[Thomas Rhett]].  Reflecting on how he discovered Sykamore, Akins was quoted as saying, \"I read her name, I was curious...I saw her face, I was intrigued...I heard her voice, I was done.\"<ref name=\":0\" /> On 19 June 2019 it was announced that Sykamore had signed a record deal with Music Knox Records, a joint venture between producer [[Michael Knox (record producer)|Michael Knox]] and [[Broken Bow Records]]/[[BMG Rights Management|BMG]].  Sykamore was the first artist to sign with the label partnership.  In an article in [[Music Row Magazine]], Knox was quoted as saying, \"We couldn\u2019t be prouder to have her as our first signing. When I first heard Sykamore, her voice grabbed my attention immediately. Being a song guy, when I found out that she was a writer on everything I was hearing, it was a no brainer for me.\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Nicholson |first1=Jessica |title=Music Knox Records Makes Initial Artist Signing With Sykamore |url=https://musicrow.com/2019/06/music-knox-records-makes-initial-artist-signing-with-sykamore/ |website=Music Row Magazine |date=19 June 2019 |access-date=20 June 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn 3 April 2020 Sykamore released ''California King'' on Music Knox Records/Wheelhouse Records/BMG.  Writing in [[American Songwriter]], journalist Joe Vitagliano described the EP as \"a five song breeze which is as relatable and funny as it is intimate and personal.\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Vitagliano |first1=Joe |title=Sykamore: Canadian Songwriter, Meets Nashville Royalty, and Creates a 'California King' |url=https://americansongwriter.com/sykamore-rhett-atkins-california-king-album/ |website=American Songwriter |date=4 April 2020 |access-date=5 April 2020}}</ref> [[Parade Magazine]] published an article about the first track on the collection, \"Record High,\" where Laura B. Whitmore wrote, \"Free-spirited and dance-inducing, \u201cRecord High,\" the new single by Nashville artist Sykamore, is a tune to lift your mood and prepare you to take on the world. With a twangy twist of country and pop,  \"Record High\" is a soaring, morning shower sing-along anthem to take on the day.\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Whitmore |first1=Laura B. |title=Need an Uplifting Song to Sing in the Shower? Sykamore's 'Record High' Could Be It! |url=https://parade.com/1018826/laurawhitmore/sykamore-record-high/ |website=Parade Magazine |date=3 April 2020 |publisher=AMG/Parade |access-date=5 April 2020}}</ref> In various interviews promoting the release, including one with the [[Calgary Herald]], Sykamore hinted a full length album, that will include the songs from the EP, was on the horizon.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Volmers |first1=Eric |title=Alberta expat Sykamore makes waves in Nashville with major-label debut, California King |url=https://calgaryherald.com/entertainment/music/alberta-expat-sykamore-makes-waves-in-nashville-with-major-label-debut-california-king/ |website=Calgary Herald |publisher=Postmedia |access-date=5 April 2020}}</ref>\n\nOn 2 May 2020, Sykamore contributed an article to [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] about the effect the [[COVID-19 pandemic]] had on her career and personal life.  \"I decided to release new music during this weird time \u2014 though it was a scary decision to make. Trying to promote a five-song EP during the biggest economic upset in 100 years is uncharted territory. In some respects, the term 'the show must go on' has taken on a whole new meaning. We are living in a 'new normal' \u2014 one that involves a lot of 'making the best of it.'\"  She continued, \"I\u2019ve uncovered a surprising truth: the world is smaller. This virus has forced us as a planet to completely unite...I used to see life in five-year plans. Nowadays, it\u2019s in days \u2014 even hours. I go for walks, I promote my \u2018California King\u2019 EP on Instagram live, and I make turkey chili. I find things I CAN do in a sea of things I have no control over.\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Ostrom |first1=Jordan |title=Corona Chronicles: Arianna Huffington Raises Money for First Responders, Stars Use TV and Movies as Escapism and Other Personal Stories |url=https://variety.com/2020/biz/news/coronavirus-hollywood-ariana-huffington-penny-dreadful-1234595989/ |website=Variety |date=2 May 2020 |access-date=4 May 2020}}</ref>\n\nSykamore wrote and sang with Ryan Kinder on \"Doing Fine\" from his planned collaborations album called ''Ontology''.  The track was released digitally on 16 October 2020.  Critic [[Robert K. Oermann|Robert Oermann]] wrote in [[Music Row Magazine]], \"This is a fiery male-female duet performance that builds in intensity as it unspools. One person can\u2019t move on if the other person doesn\u2019t hurt as badly. I have always liked this guy\u2019s singing, and he\u2019s just as potent with a harmony partner. Sykamore was discovered and brought to Nashville by Rhett Akins. She\u2019s a winner, and this is definitely worth your spins.\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Oermann |first1=Robert K. |title=DISClaimer Singles Reviews: Lee Brice, Miranda Lambert, Jaden Hamilton, And More |url=https://musicrow.com/2020/10/disclaimer-singles-reviews-lee-brice-miranda-lambert-jaden-hamilton-and-more/ |website=MusicRow.com |date=22 October 2020 |publisher=Music Row Magazine |access-date=4 December 2020}}</ref> A music video for the song premiered on [[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] 1 December 2020.<ref>{{cite web |last1=CMT.com Staff |title=Ryan Kinder and Sykamore Are \"Doing Fine,\" Unless\u2026 |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1827953/ryan-kinder-feat-sykamore-doing-fine/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128011527/http://www.cmt.com/news/1827953/ryan-kinder-feat-sykamore-doing-fine/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=28 January 2021 |website=CMT.com |publisher=CMT |access-date=4 December 2020}}</ref>\n\nOn 4 December 2020, Sykamore released her version of the holiday song \"[[What Are You Doing New Year's Eve]].\"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Remz |first1=Jeffrey B. |title=Sykamore wonders \"What Are You Doing New Year's Eve?\" |url=https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=11495 |website=Country Standard Time |access-date=4 December 2020}}</ref>\n\nIn August 2022, Sykamore independently released her debut album ''[[Pinto (album)|Pinto]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2022/08/16/sykamore-releases-her-debut-album-pinto/?amp=1|title=Sykamore releases her debut album, Pinto|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|work=Canadian Beats Media|date=August 16, 2022|access-date=August 21, 2022}}</ref> The album was nominated for Album of the Year at the 2023 Country Music Alberta Awards.<ref name=\"FPM\"/>\n\n==Discography==\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center\"\n|-\n! Result !! {{abbr|Ref.|Reference}}\n|-\n| 2023\n| Country Music Alberta\n| Album of the Year\n| ''Pinto''\n| {{nom}}\n| <ref name=\"FPM\">{{Cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/cmab-awards-nominees-winners/|title=Nominees Announced for the 2023 CMAB Awards: Celebrating the Best in Alberta Country Music!|website=Front Porch Music|first=Logan|last=Miller|date=February 7, 2023|access-date=February 9, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/cmab-awards-nominees-winners/|title=The 2023 CMAB Awards: Winners And Show Highlights|work=Front Porch Music|date=April 3, 2022|first=Logan|last=Miller|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230407182946/https://frontporchmusic.ca/cmab-awards-nominees-winners/|archive-date=April 7, 2023}}</ref>\n|-\n|}\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist}}\n\n==External links==\n*{{official website|http://www.sykamoremusic.com}}\n*{{Facebook|sykamoremusic}}\n*{{Instagram|sykamore}}\n*{{Twitter|sykamoremusic}}\n\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]\n[[Category:People from Wheatland County, Alberta]]\n[[Category:Singers from Alberta]]\n[[Category:Canadian women country singers]]\n[[Category:Canadian country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Canadian women singer-songwriters]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Gabby_Barrett","to":"Gabby Barrett"}],"pages":{"57473532":{"pageid":57473532,"ns":0,"title":"Gabby Barrett","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American country singer (born 2000)}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2021}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name         = Gabby Barrett\n| image        = 2018 National Christmas Tree Lighting (45377711214) cropped.jpg\n| birth_name   = Gabby Bernadette Barrett\n| birth_date   = {{Birth date and age|2000|3|5}}\n| birth_place  = [[Munhall, Pennsylvania]], U.S.\n| genre        = {{flatlist|\n* [[Country music|Country]]\n* [[country pop]]\n}}\n| instruments  = Vocals, guitar\n| occupation   = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}}\n| years_active = 2018\u2013present\n| label        = [[Warner Music Nashville]]\n| spouse       = {{marriage|Cade Foehner|2019|}}\n| website      = {{URL|gabbybarrett.com}}\n}}\n\n'''Gabby Bernadette Barrett''' (born March 5, 2000)<ref name=\"PennLive\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.pennlive.com/entertainment/2018/05/who_is_gabby_barrett_a_closer.html|title=Who is Gabby Barrett? A closer look at Pa.'s 'American Idol' finalist|first=Stephanie|last=Sadowski|date=May 20, 2018|website=pennlive.com}}</ref> is an American [[country music]] singer.<ref name=\"UTAE TV\">{{cite web|url=http://wtae.com/article/pittsburgh-native-gabby-barrett-ready-for-american-idol-finale/20737438| title=Pittsburgh Native Gabby Barrett Ready For American Idol Finale |last=Cain |first=Jackie|date=May 17, 2018 |website=wtae.com |access-date=May 20, 2018}}</ref> She finished third on the [[American Idol season 16|sixteenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]''. Her debut single  \"[[I Hope (Gabby Barrett song)|I Hope]]\" was the first top 10 [[Hot Country Songs]] debut by an unaccompanied woman since October 2017.<ref name=\"Pittsburgh Post-Gazette\">{{cite web|url=https://post-gazette.com/ae/tv-radio/2018/04/11/American-Idol-Gabby-Barrett-Goodwill-outfit-auction/stories/201804110152| title=She's Giving The Clothes Off Her Back: American Idol's Gabby Barrett Donating \"Idol\" Outfit As Goodwill Fundraiser|last=Sciullo|first=Maria|date=April 11, 2018 |access-date=May 20, 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"billboard 9354555\">{{Cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/9354555/gabby-barrett-country-streaming-songs-chart-i-hope |title=Gabby Barrett Scores Historic No. 1 on Country Streaming Songs Chart With 'I Hope' |date=April 8, 2020 |website=billboard.com |access-date=April 9, 2020}}</ref> It became a top three hit on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and has been certified 7\u00d7 platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]]. Her debut album ''[[Goldmine (Gabby Barrett album)|Goldmine]]'' was released on June 19, 2020.<ref name=\"billboard 9362505\">{{cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/chart-beat/9362505/gabby-barrett-i-hope-tops-country-airplay |title=Gabby Barrett's 'I Hope' Tops Country Airplay, As Women Hit a 24-Year High On Hot Country Songs |date=April 21, 2020 |first= Jim |last=Asker |magazine=Billboard}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Cantor |first1=Brian |title=Gabby Barrett's \"I Hope\" Earns 2\u00d7 Platinum Certification In United States |url=https://headlineplanet.com/home/2020/06/30/gabby-barretts-i-hope-earns-2x-platinum-certification-in-united-states/ |website=Headline Planet |date=June 30, 2020 |access-date=July 8, 2020}}</ref> ''Country Now'' called Barrett \"country music's next female superstar\".<ref>{{Cite web|title=Gabby Barrett|url=https://www.opry.com/artists/gabby-barrett/|access-date=May 30, 2021|website=Grand Ole Opry}}</ref>\n\n==Early life==\nBarrett is one of eight children born to Blaise and Pam Barrett. She attended [[Serra Catholic High School]] in [[McKeesport, Pennsylvania]], but transferred to [[Pennsylvania Cyber Charter School]].\n\nShe started singing at nine and doing shows at eleven. In 2014, she won the Kean Quest Talent Search. At 14, her father encouraged her to sing in an all-black choir, which prompted her to join the Lamb of God Christian Ministries in [[Homestead, Pennsylvania]].<ref name=\"PennLive\" />\n\n==Career==\n===2017\u20132018: ''American Idol'', post-''Idol''===\n{{Main|American Idol (season 16){{!}}''American Idol'' (season 16)}}\nBarrett auditioned for the sixteenth season of ''American Idol'' in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. She progressed through to the Finale before being voted off.\n{| class=\"wikitable\" style=\"width:90%; margin:1em auto 1em auto;\"\n|-\n! colspan=\"6\"| ''American Idol'' season 16 performances and results\n|-\n!Episode\n!Theme\n!Song choice\n!Original artist\n!Order\n!Result\n|-\n|Audition\n|Auditioner's Choice\n|\"[[Good Girl (Carrie Underwood song)|Good Girl]]\"<br />\"[[His Eye Is on the Sparrow]]\"\n|[[Carrie Underwood]]<br />[[Ethel Waters]]\n|N/A\n|Advanced\n|-\n|Top 24 Solo/Duet\n|Contestant's Choice\n|\"[[My Church]]\"<br />\"[[Stay (Sugarland song)|Stay]]\" (with [[Sugarland]])\n|[[Maren Morris]]<br />[[Sugarland]]\n|11\n|Advanced\n|-\n|Top 14\n|Contestant's Choice<br />Victory Song\n|\"[[The Climb (song)|The Climb]]\"<br />\"[[Little Red Wagon (song)|Little Red Wagon]]\"\n|[[Miley Cyrus]]<br />[[Audra Mae]]\n|14<br />6\n|Safe\n|-\n|Top 10\n|Disney\n|\"[[Colors of the Wind]]\"\n|[[Vanessa Williams]]\n|6\n|Safe\n|-\n|Top 7\n|Prince<br />Year You Were Born\n|\"[[How Come U Don't Call Me Anymore?]]\"<br />\"[[I Hope You Dance]]\"\n|[[Prince (musician)|Prince]]<br />[[Lee Ann Womack]]\n|10<br />2\n|Safe\n|-\n|Top 5\n|Carrie Underwood<br />Mother's Day\n|\"[[Last Name (song)|Last Name]]\"<br />\"[[I Have Nothing]]\"\n|Carrie Underwood<br />[[Whitney Houston]]\n|2<br />6\n|Safe\n|-\n|Finale\n|Winner's Single<br />Reprise Song<br />Hometown Decision\n|\"Rivers Deep\"<br />\"Little Red Wagon\"<br />\"[[Don't Stop Believin']]\"\n|Gabby Barrett<br />Miranda Lambert<br />[[Journey (band)|Journey]]\n|2<br />5<br />8\n|3rd Place\n|}\n\nAfter Barrett appeared on ''American Idol'', she collaborated with songwriter and producer Allen Foster to write three songs on her extended play ''The Fireflies'': \"Fireflies\", \"Your Name On It\", and \"Missin' Love\".<ref name=\"auto\">{{cite web|url=https://idolchatteryd.com/staying-busy-after-idol-gabby-barrett-drops-romantic-new-single/|title=Staying Busy After Idol, Gabby Barrett Drops Romantic New Single|date=October 18, 2018|work=Idol Chatter}}</ref>\n\n===2019\u20132021: ''Goldmine''===\n[[File:Gabby....jpg|thumb|upright|Barrett singing during [[American Idol Live! 2018]]]]\nIn 2019, Barrett independently released \"[[I Hope (Gabby Barrett song)|I Hope]]\", which was co-written by [[Jon Nite]] and Zachary Kale and co-produced by Zachary Kale and [[Ross Copperman]].<ref name=roland>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8527742/gabby-barrett-i-hope-making-of |title=Makin' Tracks: 'Idol' Alum Gabby Barrett's 'I Hope' Is Not What the Title Implies|date=August 19, 2019 |first= Tom|last= Roland |magazine=Billboard }}</ref> She performed the song in an appearance on the [[American Idol season 17|seventeenth season]] of ''American Idol'' in May 2019.  The song attracted the attention of music labels, and Barrett announced on stage after the performance she had signed with [[Warner Music Nashville]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2019/06/warner-music-nashville-signs-gabby-barrett/|title=Warner Music Nashville Signs Gabby Barrett|date=June 26, 2019}}</ref> \"I Hope\" was then officially released as a single by the label on June 27, 2019.<ref name=roland /> The single topped ''Billboard''{{'}}s Country Streaming Songs chart as well as the Country Airplay chart in April 2020, followed by the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart.<ref name=\"billboard 9354555\" /><ref name=\"billboard 9362505\" />\nOn April 7, 2020, a version featuring [[Charlie Puth]] was released. In 2019, Barrett opened for [[Toby Keith]] in Ohio, as well as [[Keith Urban]].\n\nOn November 21, 2020, the single hit number three on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], making her the first female country artist to do so since [[Taylor Swift]]. Puth has also been credited for the song on the Hot 100, which makes it his fourth top-ten single.<ref>{{cite twitter|user=Americanidol|number=1298021230218338305|title=Congrats to Idol alum @GabbyBarrett_ -- the first female country artist since Taylor Swift to chart in the Top 10 of @billboard's #Hot100! \ud83e\udd29#IHope \u2728We Hope\u2728 you'll follow her lead and join #IdolAcrossAmerica's online open call tomorrow... \ud83d\udc99}}</ref> As of January 2021, the single has been number one for 25 weeks on the Hot Country Songs chart.<ref>{{cite magazine|title=Gabby Barrett's 'I Hope' Is Third-Longest-Leading No. 1 in Hot Country Songs History|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/chart-beat/9516285/i-hope-tops-hot-country-songs-25th-week-gabby-barrett/|first=Jim|last=Asker|date=January 26, 2021|access-date=May 5, 2021|url-access=subscription|magazine=Billboard}}</ref>\n\nHer debut album ''[[Goldmine (Gabby Barrett album)|Goldmine]]'' was released on June 19, 2020.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://gabbybarrett.com/goldmine/ |title=Gabby Barrett &#124; Goldmine Pre-order |access-date=May 1, 2020 |archive-date=June 13, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200613162918/http://gabbybarrett.com/goldmine/ |url-status=dead }}</ref> The album earned 15.98 million on-demand streams in its opening week, breaking the record for the largest streaming week ever for a debut country album by a woman.<ref name=\"billboard 9362505\" /> In 2021, Barrett opened up for [[Thomas Rhett]] on his Center Point Road Tour,<ref name=\"The Nash News 1\">{{cite web|last1=Bosch|first1=Christina |title=Thomas Rhett, Cole Swindell & Gabby Barrett Announce Tour|url=https://www.thenashnews.com/2021/04/16/thomas-rhett-cole-swindell-gabby-barrett-announce-tour/|website=The Nash News|publisher=The Nash News LLC|date=April 16, 2021|accessdate=May 24, 2021}}</ref> and for the [[Zac Brown Band]] at [[Summerfest]] as part of their [[The Comeback Tour]].<ref name=\"Zac Brown Band\">{{cite web|last1=Stefano|first1=Angela|title=Zac Brown Band Announce The Comeback Tour 2021|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/zac-brown-band-the-comeback-tour-2021/|website=Taste of Country|date=May 10, 2021|access-date=May 24, 2021}}</ref>\n\nAlong with performing at a [[Pittsburgh Pirates]]' game, she sang the national anthem for the [[Pittsburgh Steelers]] and at the [[Daytona 500]].<ref name=\"PA Cyber\">{{cite web|url=http://pacyber.org/news/article/?Rising-singer-Gabby-Barrett-wows-audiences-with-her-voice-134| title=Rising Singer Gabby Barrett Wows Audiences With Her Voice|date=July 11, 2017|access-date=May 20, 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"Pittsburgh Magazine\">{{cite web|url=http://pittsburghmagazine.com/Best-of-the-Burgh-Blogs/The-412/March-2018/Munhall-Native-Auditions-for-American-Idol |title=Munhall Native Auditions For American Idol. A Rising Pittsburgh Star Vies For Her Chance At Fame|last=Bails |first=Victoria |date=March 22, 2018|access-date=May 20, 2018}}</ref> The song on the show selected for her if she won was \"Rivers Deep.\" [[Carrie Underwood]] was quoted as saying that Barrett is further along than she was at her age.<ref name=\"1020 KDKA, The KDKA Radio Morning News With Larry Richert And John Shumway\">{{cite web|url=https://kdkaradio.radio.com/articles/munhall-mayor-ready-celebrate-if-american-idol-finalist-gabby-barrett-wins|title=Munhall Mayor Ready To Celebrate If American Idol Finalist Gabby Barrett Wins |date=May 18, 2018|access-date=May 20, 2018}}</ref>\n\nIn September 2021, Barrett was nominated for four [[55th Annual Country Music Association Awards]]: Female Vocalist of the Year, Single of the Year (\"The Good Ones\"), Song of the Year (\"The Good Ones\"), and New Artist of the Year.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Nicholson|first=Jessica|title=Luke Combs, Carly Pearce & More React to 2021 CMA Awards Nominations|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/awards/9626923/cma-awards-nominations-2021-luke-combs-carly-pearce-react/|date=September 9, 2021|access-date=September 9, 2021|magazine=Billboard}}</ref>\n\nA deluxe edition of ''Goldmine'' was released on November 19, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2021/10/gabby-barrett-shares-plans-for-goldmine-deluxe-coming-in-november1/|title=Gabby Barrett Shares Plans For 'Goldmine (Deluxe)' Coming In November|first=Lorie|last=Hollabaugh|website=MusicRow|date=October 28, 2021|accessdate=November 9, 2021}}</ref>\n\n===2023\u2013present: ''Chapter & Verse'' and acting debut===\nShe will be making her acting debut in an untitled [[Trey Edward Shults]] film, with [[The Weeknd]], [[Jenna Ortega]], and [[Barry Keoghan]] costarring.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Santens |first=Tim |date=2023-03-03 |title=Jenna Ortega, The Weeknd Begin Production on Untitled Trey Edward Shults Film |url=https://talesfromthecollection.com/2023/03/03/jenna-ortega-the-weeknd-begin-production-on-untitled-trey-edward-shults-film/ |access-date=2023-03-11 |website=Tales From The Collection |language=en-us}}</ref> On June 12, 2023, she released \"[[Glory Days (Gabby Barrett song)|Glory Days]]\", the lead single off her second studio album ''[[Chapter & Verse (Gabby Barrett album)|Chapter & Verse]]'', which was released on February 2, 2024.<ref name=\"Chapter & Verse\">{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/11/gabby-barrett-to-release-chapter-verse-in-february/|title=Gabby Barrett to Release ''Chapter & Verse'' in February|author=Liza Anderson|date=November 13, 2023|publisher=Music Row|accessdate=December 14, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nBarrett married fellow ''Idol'' contestant [[American Idol season 16|Cade Foehner]] on October 5, 2019.<ref>{{Cite web|date=October 5, 2019|title=American Idol's Gabby Barrett and Cade Foehner Are Married! All the Details From Their Wedding|url=https://people.com/country/gabby-barrett-marries-cade-foehner-wedding-photo/|website=PEOPLE.com|language=EN}}</ref>\n\nBarrett gave birth to their first child, a daughter, on January 18, 2021.<ref>{{Cite web|date=January 26, 2021|title=American Idol Alums Gabby Barrett and Cade Foehner Welcome Daughter Baylah May|url=https://people.com/parents/american-idol-alums-gabby-barrett-cade-foehner-welcome-daughter/|website=PEOPLE.com|language=EN}}</ref> Barrett gave birth to their second child, a son, on October 27, 2022.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Nicholson|first=Jessica|title=Gabby Barrett Gives Birth to Baby No. 2 With Cade Foehner: 'What a Precious Gift'|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/gabby-barrett-gives-birth-second-child-baby-photo-1235165174/|date=November 2, 2022|access-date=November 2, 2022|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> On August 30, 2023, Barrett announced that she was expecting their third child.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://country.iheart.com/alternate/amp/2023-08-30-gabby-barrett-reveals-shes-pregnant-with-baby-no-3|title=Gabby Barrett Reveals She's Pregnant with Baby No. 3|author=Kelly Fisher|publisher=iHeart Country|date=August 30, 2023|access-date=August 30, 2023}}</ref> Barrett gave birth to their third child, a daughter, on February 17, 2024.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/gabby-barrett-welcomes-baby-no-3-a-girl-with-husband-cade-foehner-8550784|title=Gabby Barrett Welcomes Baby No. 3, a Girl, with Husband Cade Foehner: 'Another Life to Love and Cherish'|author=Hannah Sacks and Nicholas Rice|magazine=People|date=February 18, 2024|access-date=February 18, 2024}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n===Albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center\"\n|-\n! This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Cassandra_Vasik","to":"Cassandra Vasik"}],"pages":{"1335233":{"pageid":1335233,"ns":0,"title":"Cassandra Vasik","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|Canadian singer-songwriter}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2020}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| image           =\n| name            = Cassandra Vasik\n| birth_name      = Sandra Vasicek\n| alias           = Cassandra Leigh\n| origin          = [[Blenheim, Ontario]], Canada\n| Instruments     =\n| genre           = [[Country pop]]\n| occupation      = Singer-songwriter\n| years_active    = 1990\u20132000\n| label           = [[Epic Records|Epic]], Perimeter\n| associated_acts = [[Tim Thorney]]\n}}\n'''Cassandra Vasik''' is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter from [[Blenheim, Ontario]]. Signed to [[Epic Records]], she released two albums and 11 singles for the label between 1991 and 1994.\n\nIn 1992, she won the Rising Star award at the [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Awards.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/456599491.html?dids=456599491:456599491&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Sep+21%2C+1992&author=Greg+Quill+TORONTO+STAR&pub=Toronto+Star&desc=Country+awards+show+a+rewarding+celebration&pqatl=google|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102123412/http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/456599491.html?dids=456599491:456599491&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Sep+21,+1992&author=Greg+Quill+TORONTO+STAR&pub=Toronto+Star&desc=Country+awards+show+a+rewarding+celebration&pqatl=google|url-status=dead|archive-date=November 2, 2012|title=Country awards show a rewarding celebration|date=September 1, 1992|work=[[Toronto Star]]|accessdate=June 8, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ccma.org/awards/awards_archives.cfm?SelectedAwardYear=1992|title=1992 CCMA Award Winners|publisher=[[Canadian Country Music Association]]|accessdate=June 8, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100612223816/http://ccma.org/awards/awards_archives.cfm?SelectedAwardYear=1992|archive-date=June 12, 2010}}</ref> She also won the 1992 and 1994 [[Juno Award]] for Best Country Female Vocalist.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/454400971.html?dids=454400971:454400971&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=May+16%2C+1992&author=Judith+Fitzgerald+Special+to+The+Star&pub=Toronto+Star&desc=Cassandra+Vasik%27s+got+the+miracle+thing&pqatl=google|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130131185229/http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/454400971.html?dids=454400971:454400971&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=May+16,+1992&author=Judith+Fitzgerald+Special+to+The+Star&pub=Toronto+Star&desc=Cassandra+Vasik's+got+the+miracle+thing&pqatl=google|url-status=dead|archive-date=January 31, 2013|title=Cassandra Vasik's got the miracle thing|date=May 16, 1992|work=[[Toronto Star]]|accessdate=June 8, 2010 | first=Judith | last=Fitzgerald}}</ref> In 2000, Vasik released a pop album, ''Different'', on Perimeter Records.\n\n==Discography==\n\n===Albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! rowspan=\"2\" style=\"width:10em;\"| Title\n! Year\n! style=\"width:22em;\" | Title\n|-\n| 1991\n! scope=\"row\"| \"The Black Book\"\n|- \n| rowspan=\"2\"| 1992\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Which Face Should I Put On Tonight\"\n|- \n! scope=\"row\"| \"Wildflowers\"\n|- \n| 1993\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Sadly Mistaken\"\n|}\n\n==References==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==External links==\n*[https://web.archive.org/web/20110201211821/http://cassandravasik.com/ Official website]\n\n{{Cassandra Vasik}}\n\n{{Authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Vasik, Cassandra}}\n[[Category:Canadian women country singers]]\n[[Category:Canadian country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Juno Award winners]]\n[[Category:Singers from Ontario]]\n[[Category:People from Chatham-Kent]]\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:Canadian Country Music Association Rising Star Award winners]]\n[[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]\n\n\n{{Canada-singer-songwriter-stub}}"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Dylan_Schneider","to":"Dylan Schneider"}],"pages":{"53882823":{"pageid":53882823,"ns":0,"title":"Dylan Schneider","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer-songwriter}}\n\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Dylan Schneider\n| image           =\n| caption         =\n| image_size      =\n| birth_name      =\n| birth_place     = [[Terre Haute, Indiana|Terre Haute]], [[Indiana]], United States\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1999|10|09}}\n| origin          =\n| instrument      =\n| genre           = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}}\n| occupation      = Singer-songwriter\n| years_active    = 2016\u2013present\n| label           = {{hlist|[[Interscope Records|Interscope]]|Round Here}} [[BBR Music Group]]<ref name=\"musicrow.com\">{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2021/07/dylan-schneider-signs-with-bbr-music-group/ | title=Dylan Schneider Signs with BBR Music Group | date=21 July 2021 }}</ref>\n| associated_acts =\n| website         = {{official website|http://dylanschneidermusic.com/}}\n}}\n\n'''Dylan Schneider''' (born October 9, 1999) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He self-released his debut [[extended play]], ''Wannabe'' in August 2016. Labelled \"Country Music's Next Rising Star\" by [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']], Schneider has landed two EPs in the top 20 of the magazine's [[Heatseekers Albums]] chart in under a year without a label to support them.<ref name=\"billboard\">{{cite magazine |last1=Dauphin |first1=Chuck |title=Dylan Schneider is Country Music's Next Rising Star|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7678112/dylan-schneider-interview-17-you-heard-wrong-video|accessdate=April 25, 2017|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=February 6, 2017}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\nSchneider was a fan of [[pop music|pop]] and [[hip hop music|hip hop]] music as a child, but later became attracted to the storytelling aspect of country music and began singing at the age of 14.<ref name=\"allmusic\">{{cite news|last1=Deming|first1=Mark|title=Dylan Schneider {{!}} Biography & History|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/dylan-schneider-mn0003562739/biography|accessdate=April 25, 2017|work=[[AllMusic]]|publisher=[[All Media Network]]}}</ref> After meeting [[Brett Eldredge]] at a concert in the singer's hometown ([[Paris, Illinois]]), Schneider was invited onstage by Eldredge to perform a song during the latter's performance in Terre Haute.<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> He then began writing and performing songs both around [[Indiana]] and in [[Nashville]], [[Tennessee]]. Between 2014 and 2016, Schneider posted a number of videos to [[YouTube]] of him performing [[cover version]]s of popular country songs, which earned him attention online.<ref name=\"billboard\"/> The first video was posted on May 18, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|author1=DylanSchneiderMusic|title=Bottoms Up by Brantley Gilbert Cover - Dylan Schneider|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_OElx8udHoU|website=[[YouTube]]|publisher=[[Google]]|accessdate=April 25, 2017|format=video|date=May 18, 2014}}</ref>\n\nSchneider released his debut EP, ''Wannabe'', on August 19, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Amazon.com: Wannabe - EP: Dylan Schneider: MP3 Downloads|url=https://www.amazon.com/Wannabe-EP-Dylan-Schneider/dp/B01KE21RZU|website=[[Amazon Music]]|accessdate=April 25, 2017}}</ref> His second EP, ''17'', was released the day after Schneider's seventeenth birthday and reached number 37 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] [[Top Country Albums]] chart.<ref name=\"allmusic\"/> In February 2017, Schneider released his first radio single, \"You Heard Wrong\".<ref name=\"billboard\"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Horton|first1=Carrie|title=Who Is Dylan Schneider? 5 Things You Need to Know|url=http://theboot.com/who-is-dylan-schneider/|accessdate=April 25, 2017|work=The Boot|publisher=[[Townsquare Media]]|date=February 13, 2017}}</ref> He released his third EP, ''Spotlight's on You'', on April 14, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|title=Amazon.com: Spotlight's on You - EP: Dylan Schneider: MP3 Downloads |url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06Y3LD31F|website=[[Amazon Music]]|accessdate=April 25, 2017}}</ref> The record sold enough copies propelling the EP into the top 10 of the [[Heatseekers Albums]] chart. Schneider released his fourth EP, ''Whole Town Talk'', in August 2019. The EP was released by [[Interscope Records]] through a partnership with Round Here Records; an independent label founded by [[Tyler Hubbard]] and [[Brian Kelley (musician)|Brian Kelley]] of the [[Florida Georgia Line]] who also co-wrote several of the new tracks. It was also announced Schneider would join Florida Georgia Line for select dates of their [[Can't Say I Ain't Country Tour|Can\u2019t Say I Ain\u2019t Country Tour]] alongside [[Dan + Shay]], [[Morgan Wallen]], and [[Canaan Smith]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dylan-schneider-whole-town-talk-ep-florida-georgia-line/|title=DYLAN SCHNEIDER DROPS 'WHOLE TOWN TALK' EP WITH SUPPORT FROM FLORIDA GEORGIA LINE'S ROUND HERE RECORDS|last=Laffer|first=Lauren|website=Sounds Like Nashville|date=23 August 2019 |language=en|access-date=2019-08-23}}</ref>\n\nOn July 21, 2021, Schneider signed with BBR Music Group.<ref name=\"musicrow.com\">{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2021/07/dylan-schneider-signs-with-bbr-music-group/ | title=Dylan Schneider Signs with BBR Music Group | date=21 July 2021 }}</ref>\n\nWith over 2 million [https://www.instagram.com/dylanschneidermusic/?hl=en social media followers], Schneider experienced a surge in popularity, gaining more than 500,000 followers within a few months. His music career has garnered over 388 million on-demand streams.\n\nAs a songwriter, Schneider achieved a Top 5 hit with [[Dustin Lynch]]\u2019s \u201c[[Momma's House|Momma\u2019s House]]\"; He also holds two RIAA-certified Gold records, underscoring his achievements in the industry.\n\nIn 2023, Schneider was recognized as the \"[https://musicrow.com/2023/12/musicrow-reveals-next-big-thing-artists-class-of-2024/ Next Big Thing]\" by [[MusicRow]], highlighting his emergence in the country music scene. Additionally, he was named a \"Breakthrough Artist to Watch\" by [[Amazon Music]] and an \"Artist to Watch\" by [[Pandora (service)|Pandora]].\n\nIn September of 2024, Schneider will embark on his headlining \"Bad Decisions\" Tour, featuring [https://www.marynntaylormusic.com MaRynn Taylor]. This tour follows his appearances on several tours, including [[Kane Brown]]\u2019s \"In the Air\" Tour, [[Luke Bryan]]\u2019s \"Mind of a Country Boy\" Tour, and [[Mitchell Tenpenny]]\u2019s \"Woke Up In A Dream\" Tour. The \"Bad Decisions\" Tour is set to kick off in Vancouver, BC, on September 30, 2024.\n\n==Discography==\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|+ List of extended plays, with selected details, chart positions, and sales\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Ain't Missin' You\"\n| 2023<!-- official radio release -->\n| \u2014\n| \n|}\n\n==References==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==External links==\n* [http://www.allmusic.com/artist/dylan-schneider-mn0003562739 Dylan Schneider] at [[AllMusic]]\n* [http://dylanschneidermusic.com/ Official website]\n\n{{authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Schneider, Dylan}}\n[[Category:American country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American male singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:1999 births]]\n[[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Country musicians from Indiana]]\n[[Category:21st-century American male singers]]\n[[Category:Singer-songwriters from Indiana]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Jess_Moskaluke","to":"Jess Moskaluke"}],"pages":{"41223762":{"pageid":41223762,"ns":0,"title":"Jess Moskaluke","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|Canadian country music singer}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Jess Moskaluke\n| image           = Jess Moskaluke 2017.jpg\n| caption         = Moskaluke in 2017\n| image_size      =\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1990|6|4}}\n| birth_name      =\n| birth_place     = [[Langenburg, Saskatchewan]], [[Canada]]<ref>{{cite news|last=Brown|first=Rob|title=Backstage Pass: Saskatchewan's Jess Moskaluke a rising star, so catch her if you can|url=http://metronews.ca/news/regina/407504/backstage-pass-saskatchewans-jess-moskaluke-a-rising-star-so-catch-her-if-you-can/|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[Metro International]]|date=October 17, 2012|archive-date=November 10, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131110045749/http://metronews.ca/news/regina/407504/backstage-pass-saskatchewans-jess-moskaluke-a-rising-star-so-catch-her-if-you-can/|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n| origin          =\n| instrument      =\n| genre           = [[Country music|Country]], [[country pop]]\n| occupation      = Singer-songwriter\n| years_active    = 2012\u2013present\n| label           = [[MDM Recordings Inc.|MDM Recordings]]\n| website         = {{URL|jessmoskaluke.com/|jessmoskaluke.com}}\n}}\n'''Jessica Moskaluke''' (born June 4, 1990) is a Canadian [[Country music|country]] singer and songwriter. She released her debut studio album, ''[[Light Up the Night (Jess Moskaluke album)|Light Up the Night]]'' in April 2014, which includes the platinum-certified single \"[[Cheap Wine and Cigarettes]]\". She has one number-one hit on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart with \"[[Country Girls (Jess Moskaluke song)|Country Girls]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://frontporchmusic.ca/music-news/jess-moskalukes-country-girls-number-1/|title=Jess Moskaluke's \"Country Girls\" Hits #1 at Radio in Canada|date=March 14, 2020|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=December 5, 2020}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\nIn June 2011, Moskaluke won the Next Big Thing contest, sponsored by [[CHBD-FM|Big Dog 92.7]] and SaskMusic.<ref>{{cite news|last=DeDekker|first=Jeff|title=The Next Big Thing is Jess Moskaluke|url=http://blogs.leaderpost.com/2011/07/02/the-next-big-thing-is-jess-moskaluke/|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[Leader-Post]]|date=July 2, 2011|archive-date=December 3, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203015128/http://blogs.leaderpost.com/2011/07/02/the-next-big-thing-is-jess-moskaluke/|url-status=dead}}</ref> In September 2011, she won the New Artist Showcase Award at the [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Awards.<ref>{{cite news|title=Province represented well at awards|url=http://www2.canada.com/saskatoonstarphoenix/news/arts/story.html?id=21a01b2b-b34d-4fa9-b135-bb142407e0d7|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[The StarPhoenix]]|date=September 14, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203043014/http://www2.canada.com/saskatoonstarphoenix/news/arts/story.html?id=21a01b2b-b34d-4fa9-b135-bb142407e0d7|archive-date=December 3, 2013|url-status=dead}}</ref> She was chosen to represent Canada at the Global Artist Party at the 2012 [[CMA Music Festival]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Skates|first=Sarah|title=Global Showcases Unofficially Kick Off CMA Music Festival|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2012/06/global-showcases-unofficially-kick-off-cma-music-festival/|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[MusicRow]]|date=June 7, 2012}}</ref>\n\nMoskaluke's debut single, \"Catch Me If You Can\", was released on June 4, 2012.<ref name=\"musicnews\">{{cite news|last=Ward|first=Jaimie|title=CCMA Winner Jess Moskaluke New EP Release|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/ccma-winner-jess-moskaluke-new-ep-release/|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=Music News Nashville|date=August 8, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190203084931/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/ccma-winner-jess-moskaluke-new-ep-release/|archive-date=February 3, 2019|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song's music video received regular airplay on [[CMT (Canada)|CMT]].<ref>{{cite news|last=DeDekker|first=Jeff|title=Jess Moskaluke bringing her music to the world|url=http://blogs.leaderpost.com/2012/09/27/jess-moskaluke-bringing-her-music-to-the-world/|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[Leader-Post]]|date=September 27, 2012|archive-date=October 22, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151022021054/http://blogs.leaderpost.com/2012/09/27/jess-moskaluke-bringing-her-music-to-the-world/|url-status=dead}}</ref> It was followed by an [[extended play|EP]], also titled ''Catch Me If You Can'', which was released on September 4, 2012, by [[MDM Recordings Inc.|MDM Recordings]] and distributed by [[EMI|EMI Music Canada]].<ref name=\"musicnews\" /> Jeff DeDekker of the ''[[Leader-Post]]'' gave the EP four stars out of five, writing that \"by using the full extent of her voice and also incorporating tenderness and fragility, Moskaluke is able to cover the complete spectrum of material.\"<ref>{{cite news|last=DeDekker |first=Jeff |title=CD REVIEW: Jess Moskaluke |url=http://blogs.leaderpost.com/2012/10/19/cd-review-jess-moskaluke/ |access-date=November 29, 2013 |newspaper=[[Leader-Post]] |date=October 19, 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203023607/http://blogs.leaderpost.com/2012/10/19/cd-review-jess-moskaluke/ |archive-date=December 3, 2013 }}</ref> Casadie Pederson of ''Top Country'' also gave the EP four stars out of five, calling Moskaluke \"one of the best young talents we've seen in a long time.\"<ref>{{cite news|last=Pederson|first=Casadie|title=Jess Moskaluke: 'Catch Me If You Can' Album Review|url=http://topcountry.ca/jess-moskaluke-catch-me-if-you-can-album-review/|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=Top Country|date=September 4, 2012}}</ref> The EP's second single, \"Hit N Run\", reached the top 40 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart in 2013.<ref name=\"charts\" /> Moskaluke was named Female Vocalist of the Year at the 2013 Saskatchewan Country Music Association Awards.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fuller|first=Cam|title=Parenteau, Yung win at SCMAs|url=http://www2.canada.com/saskatoonstarphoenix/news/arts/story.html?id=7cabc828-afa0-40b0-8336-9380576369e0|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[The StarPhoenix]]|date=April 29, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141210235448/http://www2.canada.com/saskatoonstarphoenix/news/arts/story.html?id=7cabc828-afa0-40b0-8336-9380576369e0|archive-date=December 10, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nMoskaluke released the first single from her debut studio album, \"Good Lovin'\", in October 2013.<ref>{{cite news|last=Gordon|first=Kennedy|title=Charting a course for country music success|url=http://www.thepeterboroughexaminer.com/2013/11/20/charting-a-course-for-country-music-success|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[Peterborough Examiner]]|date=November 30, 2013|archive-date=December 27, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171227133951/http://www.thepeterboroughexaminer.com/2013/11/20/charting-a-course-for-country-music-success|url-status=dead}}</ref> It became her first single to reach the top 20 on the ''Billboard'' Canada Country chart.<ref name=\"charts\" /> The album, ''[[Light Up the Night (Jess Moskaluke album)|Light Up the Night]]'', was released on April 15, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|last=Robinson|first=Britainy|title=BRIT'S PICKS: Top things to see and do this weekend|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/brit-s-picks-top-things-to-see-and-do-this-weekend-1.2427052|access-date=November 29, 2013|newspaper=[[CBC News]]|date=November 14, 2013}}</ref> \"[[Cheap Wine and Cigarettes]]\" and \"Used\" were both released as singles from the album in 2014.\n\nIn February 2021, she released her second studio album ''[[The Demos (Jess Moskaluke album)|The Demos]]'',<ref>{{cite web |title=Jess Moskaluke releases new album 'The Demos' |url=https://globalnews.ca/news/7651232/jess-moskaluke-releases-new-album-the-demos/|first=Kelly|last=Skjerven|website=[[Global News]]|date=February 19, 2021}}</ref> which included her first number-one hit \"[[Country Girls (Jess Moskaluke song)|Country Girls]]\",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://frontporchmusic.ca/music-news/jess-moskalukes-country-girls-number-1/|title=Jess Moskaluke's \"Country Girls\" Hits #1 at Radio in Canada|date=March 14, 2020|work=Front Porch Music|accessdate=December 5, 2020}}</ref> as well as the singles \"[[Halfway Home (song)|Halfway Home]]\",<ref>{{cite web |title=Jess Moskaluke releases new single \"Halfway Home\"|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2020/04/14/jess-moskaluke-releases-new-single-halfway-home/|first=Allen|last=Steinberg|website=Canadian Beats Media|date=April 14, 2020}}</ref> \"[[Mapdot]]\",<ref>{{cite web |title=Mark February 19 on your calendar. That's the day that Jess Moskaluke's new album The Demos will be released|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2021/01/28/mark-february-19-on-your-calendar-thats-the-day-that-jess-moskalukes-new-album-the-demos-will-be-released/|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|website=Canadian Beats Media|date=January 28, 2021}}</ref> \"[[Leave Each Other Alone]]\",<ref>{{cite web|title=Jess Moskaluke, Travis Collins Release Duet \"Leave Each Other Alone\"|url=https://topcountry.ca/jess-moskaluke-travis-collins-release-leave-each-other-alone-new-single-to-country-radio/|work=Top Country|date=May 7, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/jess-moskaluke-pairs-with-travis-collins-on-leave-each-other-alone-1.15146189|title=Jess Moskaluke Pairs With Travis Collins On 'Leave Each Other Alone'|first=John R|last=Kennedy|work=[[IHeartRadio#Canada|iHeartRadio.ca]]|publisher=[[Bell Media]]|accessdate=May 11, 2021}}</ref> and \"Nothin' I Don't Love About You\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.jessmoskaluke.com/site.php/nothin-i-dont-love-about-you-at-radio-now/|title=\"NOTHIN' I DON'T LOVE ABOUT YOU\" AT RADIO NOW!|date=July 27, 2021|work=JessMoskaluke.com}}</ref>\n\n==Tours==\n*''Mapdot'' (2022)\n\n==Discography==\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\"\n|-\n! 29, 2022}}</ref>\n|-\n| 2022\n| [[Western Canadian Music Awards]]\n| Herself\n| Country Artist of the Year\n| {{pending}}\n| <ref name=wcma22>{{Cite control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Moskaluke, Jess}}\n[[Category:1990 births]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian women singers]]\n[[Category:Canadian
