singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Canadian women country singers]]\n[[Category:Juno Award for Country Album of the Year winners]]\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:Singers from Saskatchewan]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Russell_Dickerson","to":"Russell Dickerson"}],"pages":{"50534825":{"pageid":50534825,"ns":0,"title":"Russell Dickerson","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer-songwriter}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2019}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name             = Russell Dickerson\n| image            = Russell Dickerson 2023 Headshot.jpg\n| image_size       = \n| caption = Dickerson in 2023 \n| alt              = A head shot of singer Russell Dickerson\n| birth_name       = Russell Edward Dickerson\n| birth_date       = {{birth date and age|1987|05|07}}\n| birth_place      = [[Union City, Tennessee]]\n| origin           = \n| genre            = [[Country pop]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/russell-dickerson-mn0002948894/biography|title=Russell Dickerson \u2013 Biography & History|website=[[AllMusic]]}}</ref>\n| occupation       = Singer-songwriter\n| instrument       = Vocals\n| years_active     = 2011\u2013present\n| label            = Triple Tigers\n| website          = {{URL|www.russelldickerson.com/}}\n}}\n\n'''Russell Edward Dickerson''' (born May 7, 1987) is an American [[country pop]] singer-songwriter from [[Union City, Tennessee]].<ref name=\"allmusic\">{{cite web|last=Erlewine|first=Stephen Thomas|authorlink1=Stephen Thomas Erlewine|title=Russell Dickerson {{!}} Biography & History|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=mn0002948894/biography|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=May 13, 2016}}</ref> Dickerson has released two albums through [[Triple Tigers]]. Both have accounted for four singles charting on [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]]: \"[[Yours (Russell Dickerson song)|Yours]]\", \"[[Blue Tacoma]]\", \"[[Every Little Thing (Russell Dickerson song)|Every Little Thing]]\", and \"[[Love You Like I Used To]]\".\n\n==Biography==\nRussell Edward Dickerson was born May 7, 1987, in [[Union City, Tennessee]].<ref name=\"allmusic\"/>\n\nHe earned a bachelor's degree in music from [[Belmont University]] and signed with [[Creative Artists Agency]] in 2010.<ref name=\"allmusic\" /> In 2011, he released an [[extended play]], ''Die to Live Again'', and opened for [[David Nail]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Freeman|first1=Jon|title=Review: David Nail Sells Out Exit/In|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2011/07/review-david-nail-sells-out-exitin/|access-date=May 13, 2016|work=[[MusicRow]]|date=July 29, 2011}}</ref> He toured with [[Canaan Smith]] in 2015,<ref>{{cite news|last1=McClellan|first1=Laura|title=Canaan Smith Embarking on First Headlining Tour|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-headlining-tour-dates-2015/|access-date=May 13, 2016|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=September 18, 2015}}</ref> and [[Thomas Rhett]] in the summer of 2016. Dickerson also joined [[Billy Currington]] on the road in 2016.<ref name=\"wideopen\" />\n\nIn 2015, he released the single \"Yours\" written by Dickerson, Parker Welling, and Casey Brown.<ref name=\"wideopen\">{{cite news|last1=Liebig|first1=Lorie|title=Rising Artist Russell Dickerson on How Perseverance Shaped His Sound|url=http://www.wideopencountry.com/russell-dickerson-interview/|access-date=May 13, 2016|work=Wide Open Country|date=February 19, 2016}}</ref> It became the title track to his second extended play, released on January 18, 2016, by Dent Records.<ref>{{cite web|last=Erlewine|first=Stephen Thomas|authorlink1=Stephen Thomas Erlewine|title=''Yours EP'' review|url={{AllMusic|class=album|id=mw0002913502|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=May 13, 2016}}</ref> The EP debuted at number 14 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Top Country Albums chart,<ref name=\"Country Albums\" /> selling 2,700 copies in its first week of release.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=Country Album Sales Chart: January 25, 2016|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2016/01/39645-country-album-sales-chart-january-25-2016|access-date=May 13, 2016|work=Roughstock|date=January 23, 2016}}</ref> It launched at number 2 in the iTunes Country Store and number 8 in all genres.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.russelldickerson.com/about/|title=About|website=Russell Dickerson Official Site}}</ref> On October 10, 2016, he signed with Triple Tigers Records which assumed distribution of the single.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bizjournals.com/nashville/news/2016/10/11/thirty-tigers-triple-8-management-and-sony-music.html|title=Thirty Tigers, Triple 8 Management and Sony Music partner on new country label|last=Snyder|first=Eric|date=October 11, 2016|work=Nashville Business Journal|access-date=May 30, 2018}}</ref>\n\nIn its 39th week on [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard's'']] Country Airplay chart, Dickerson jumped from number 3 to 1 on the list on January 27, 2018.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8095688/russell-dickerson-yours-country-airplay-number-one-triple-tigers-records|title=Russell Dickerson & Triple Tigers Records Roar To First Country Airplay No. 1 With 'Yours'|magazine=Billboard|access-date=30 May 2018}}</ref>\n\nThe album, ''Yours'' was released on October 13, 2017, and premiered at No. 1 on [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard's'']]'' Heat Seeker chart. ''The album peaked at No. 5 on Top Country Albums dated November 4, 2017, with 12,000 equivalent album units in its first week'', ''and includes five songs co-written by Dickerson, containing an acoustic wedding version of the title track \"Yours.\"<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8095688/russell-dickerson-yours-country-airplay-number-one-triple-tigers-records|title=Russell Dickerson & Triple Tigers Records Roar To First Country Airplay No. 1 With 'Yours'|magazine=Billboard|access-date=31 May 2018}}</ref> Due to the popularity of his hit single, he landed on the iTunes Best of 2015 year-end list, TheKnot.com's \"Best Wedding Songs of 2016,\" and [[Spotify]]'s #SpotifySpotlight 2016; where he later became one of Spotify's RISE artists.<ref name=\"Russell Dickerson Official Site\">{{Cite news|url=http://www.russelldickerson.com/about/|title=About |work=Russell Dickerson Official Site|access-date=30 May 2018}}</ref> Dickerson made his [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on June 3, 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.allaccess.com/country/industry-snap/q/id/516683|title=Russell Dickerson, Grand Ole Opry, Yours, Pete Fisher, Russell Dickerson, SiriusXM, JR ...|work=All Access|access-date=30 May 2018}}</ref> An album also titled ''Yours'' produced two additional singles in \"[[Blue Tacoma]]\" and \"[[Every Little Thing (Russell Dickerson song)|Every Little Thing]]\", which topped the Country Airplay charts as well.<ref name=\"airplay\"/>\n\nDickerson's second album, ''[[Southern Symphony]]'', came out in late 2020 on Triple Tigers. Its lead single, \"[[Love You Like I Used To]]\", also went to number one on the country music charts.<ref name=\"airplay\"/> Dickerson and [[Tyler Hubbard]] were both featured on [[Thomas Rhett]]'s 2022 song \"[[Death Row (Thomas Rhett song)|Death Row]]\".<ref name=\"Wendowski\">{{cite news |last1=Wendowski |first1=Andrew |title=Thomas Rhett, Tyler Hubbard & Russell Dickerson's New Song \"Death Row\" Is Based On A True Story |url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/listen-thomas-rhett-tyler-hubbard-russell-dickersons-new-song-death-row-is-based-on-a-true-story/ |access-date=15 May 2022 |publisher=Music Mayhem Magazine |date=March 4, 2022}}</ref>\n\nOn June 27, 2023, Dickerson released his third EP ''Three Months Two Streets Down''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/06/russell-dickerson-releases-summer-ep-celebrates-with-party-at-pearl-diver|title=Russell Dickerson Releases Summer EP, Celebrates With Party At Pearl Diver|author=LB Cantrell|publisher=Music Row|date=June 29, 2023|access-date=July 5, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nDickerson married his wife, Kailey, on May 5, 2013. On September 10, 2020, the couple's first child was born.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/parents/russell-dickerson-shares-first-photos-son-remington-wife-kailey/|title = Meet Remington Edward! Russell Dickerson Introduces Newborn Son \u2014 See the Adorable First Photos}}</ref> On October 1, 2023, their second son was born.<!-- PLEASE DO NOT ADD THE NAMES OF THE CHILDREN AS THEY'RE NON-NOTABLE MINORS WHICH GOES AGAINST WIKIPEDIA'S POLICY --><ref>{{cite web|url=https://949thebull.iheart.com/content/2023-10-07-russell-dickerson-wife-kailey-welcome-baby-no-2-see-the-first-photos|title=Russell Dickerson & Wife Kailey Welcome Baby No. 2 \u2014 See The First Photos|author=Kelly Fisher|publisher=94.9 The Bull|date=October 7, 2023|access-date=October 7, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{Infobox artist discography\n| Studio       = 3\n| Compilation  = \n| Live         = \n| EP           = 3\n| Singles      = 9 <!--I Remember-->\n| Music videos = 5 <!--Love You Like I Used To-->\n| Option       = 4 <!--Love You Like I Used To-->\n| Option name  = No. 1 singles\n}}\n\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Dylan_Scott","to":"Dylan Scott"}],"pages":{"43410958":{"pageid":43410958,"ns":0,"title":"Dylan Scott","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American singer}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2019}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Dylan Scott\n| image           = Dylan Scott 2019 by Glenn Francis.jpg\n| caption         = Scott in 2019\n| birth_name      = Dylan Scott Robinson<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Dylan Scott Scores First Country Airplay No. 1 |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7872873/dylan-scott-my-girl-first-country-airplay-chart |date=July 18, 2017 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=November 14, 2018 |first=Jim|last=Asker}}</ref>\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1990|10|22}}\n| birth_place     = [[Bastrop, Louisiana]], U.S.\n| genre           = [[Country pop]]\n| occupation      = {{Flatlist|\n* Singer\n* songwriter\n}}\n| instrument      = {{Flatlist|\n* Vocals\n* guitar\n* piano\n}}\n| years_active    = 2013\u2013present\n| label           = [[Curb Records|Curb]]\n| associated_acts =\n| website         = {{URL|http://dylanscottcountry.com/}}\n}}\n\n'''Dylan Scott Robinson''' (born October 22, 1990)<ref name=\"cmt\">{{cite web|title=Dylan Scott Bio|url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/dylan-scott/biography/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402155504/http://www.cmt.com/artists/dylan-scott/biography/|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 2, 2015|website=[[Country Music Television]]|accessdate=July 28, 2014}}</ref> is an American country singer and songwriter, better known by his stage name '''Dylan Scott'''. He is signed to [[Curb Records]].<ref name=\"cmt\" />\n\n==Career==\nScott's debut single, \"[[Makin' This Boy Go Crazy]]\", was released in June 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=R&R :: Going For Adds :: Country|url=http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/PublishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=06/24/2013&Format=4|work=[[Radio & Records]]|accessdate=July 28, 2014|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015090709/http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/publishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=06%2F24%2F2013&Format=4|archivedate=October 15, 2013}}</ref> Billy Dukes of ''[[Taste of Country]]'' gave the song three and a half stars out of five, writing that \"the native Louisianan can really rumble when he reaches down to hit the low notes, but his performance won't leave female fans tingling like the greats.\"<ref>{{cite news|last=Dukes|first=Billy|title=Dylan Scott, 'Makin' This Boy Go Crazy' \u2013 Song Review|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/dylan-scott-makin-this-boy-go-crazy/|accessdate=July 28, 2014|newspaper=[[Taste of Country]]|date=June 24, 2013}}</ref> It charted for 10 weeks on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart, peaking at number 54 in April 2014.<ref name=\"airplay\" /> The song's [[music video]] premiered on [[Country Music Television|CMT]] in December 2013.<ref name=\"video\" />\n\nScott's second single, \"Mmm, Mmm, Mmm\", was released in July 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=R&R :: Going For Adds :: Country|url=http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/PublishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=07/07/2014&Format=4|work=[[Radio & Records]]|accessdate=July 28, 2014|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811143651/http://gfa.radioandrecords.com/PublishGFA/GFANextPage.asp?sDate=07%2F07%2F2014&Format=4|archivedate=August 11, 2014}}</ref> Markos Papadatos of ''Digital Journal'' gave the song a B+ rating, writing that \"the song has a [[Jake Owen]] meets [[Colt Ford]] vibe to it, especially since he displays his smooth baritone and rap vocals.\"<ref>{{cite news|last=Papadatos|first=Markos|title=Review: Dylan Scott back with new country single 'Mmm, Mmm, Mmm'|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/review-dylan-scott-back-with-new-country-single-mmm-mmm-mmm/article/388367|accessdate=July 28, 2014|newspaper=Digital Journal|date=July 2, 2014}}</ref>\n\nBoth songs are included on his [[extended play]], ''Makin' This Boy Go Crazy'' (also as the self-titled  ''Dylan Scott'' EP), which was released on February 11, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|last=Nicholson|first=Jessica|title=Sidewalk Records' Dylan Scott Releases Self-Titled EP|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2014/02/sidewalk-records-dylan-scott-releases-self-titled-ep/|accessdate=July 28, 2014|newspaper=[[MusicRow]]|date=February 12, 2014}}</ref> The EP was produced by [[Jim Ed Norman]].<ref name=\"cmt\" /> It peaked at number 50 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Top Country Albums]] chart.<ref name=\"country\" /> Another single, \"Lay It on Me\", came out in late 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/review-dylan-scott-charms-on-new-country-single-lay-it-on-me/article/408039|title=Review: Dylan Scott charms on new country single 'Lay It On Me' (Includes first-hand account)|date=October 10, 2014|website=Digitaljournal.com|accessdate=December 2, 2018}}</ref>\n\nDylan Scott had his first number one record in the summer of 2016 with \"My Girl\", a song written for his high school sweetheart-now wife, Blair Robinson.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web|url=https://dylanscottcountry.com/|title=Dylan Scott|website=Dylan Scott|language=en|access-date=2019-10-29}}</ref>  \"My Girl\" is also Scott's first Platinum record,<ref name=\":0\" /> indicating the single has sold  1,000,000 copies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/about-awards/|title=About the Awards|last=|first=|date=n.d.|website=RIAA|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160109215629/http://www.riaa.com:80/gold-platinum/about-awards/ |archive-date=January 9, 2016 |access-date=October 28, 2019}}</ref>\n\nScott released his debut studio album, self-titled ''[[Dylan Scott (album)|Dylan Scott]]'', in August 2016. It debuted at number five on the Top Country Albums chart, selling 9,000 copies for the week.<ref>{{cite magazine|url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7486819/dan-shay-country-airplay-justin-moore-albums |title=Dan + Shay 'Up' to No. 1 On Country Airplay; Justin Moore Bows Atop Top Country Albums |date=August 23, 2016 |first= Jim |last=Asker|magazine=Billboard }}</ref>\n\nScott followed up \"My Girl\" with a number 2 record, \"Hooked\", from his ''[[Dylan Scott (album)|Dylan Scott]]'' album, which was later certified Gold.<ref name=\":0\" />\n\nScott released the single \"[[Nothing to Do Town]]\", which was accompanied by a music video and released on December 17, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|title=R&R :: Going For Adds :: Country|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xjrpAFRN39A|work=[[Curb Records]]|accessdate=December 17, 2018}}</ref>\n\nIn 2019, Scott released an EP titled ''An Old Memory'', containing seven covers of [[Keith Whitley]] songs and features a guest appearance from Whitley's widow [[Lorrie Morgan]].<ref name=\"whitley\">{{cite magazine | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8517939/dylan-scott-keith-whitley-covers-ep-an-old-memory | title=Dylan Scott Salutes His Idol Keith Whitley on Upcoming EP: Exclusive | magazine=Billboard | date=June 28, 2019 | accessdate=May 12, 2020}}</ref>\n\nIn 2023, Scott performed the national anthem and had a pregame concert prior to the [[2023 USFL Championship Game]] in [[Canton, Ohio]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Dylan Scott to Perform Live Before USFL Championship Game|url=https://amp.foxsports.com/stories/usfl/dylan-scott-to-perform-live-before-usfl-championship-game|accessdate=July 1, 2023}}</ref>\n\n== Personal life ==\nScott was born in Louisiana and moved to Nashville at the age of 19.\n\nScott and his wife, Blair Robinson, live in Nashville with their three children, sons Beckett Scott (born December 12, 2017)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1789410/dylan-scott-becomes-a-father/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171213195409/http://www.cmt.com/news/1789410/dylan-scott-becomes-a-father/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 13, 2017|title=Dylan Scott Becomes a Father|last=Staff 12/13/2017|website=CMT News|access-date=2019-10-29}}</ref> and Barron (born September 26, 2023)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/dylan-scott-and-wife-blair-welcome-baby-3-7971750|title=Dylan Scott and Wife Blair Robinson Welcome Baby No. 3, a Boy Named Barron: 'Life Is Good!'|website=PEOPLE.com|language=en|access-date=2023-09-30}}</ref> and daughter Finley Gray (born August 28, 2019).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/parents/dylan-scott-welcomes-daughter-finley-gray-first-photo/|title=Meet Finley Gray! Dylan Scott Welcomes Second Child and Says Wife Blair 'Is a Rockstar'|website=PEOPLE.com|language=en|access-date=2019-10-29}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\" \n|-\n! Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Lauren_Alaina","to":"Lauren Alaina"}],"pages":{"31000171":{"pageid":31000171,"ns":0,"title":"Lauren Alaina","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American singer and songwriter}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=March 2021}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name         = Lauren Alaina\n| image        = 2023 Independence Day celebration on MCB Camp Lejeune (4) (cropped).jpg\n| caption      = Alaina in 2023\n| birth_name   = Lauren Alaina Kristine Suddeth\n| birth_date   = {{birth date and age|1994|11|8}}\n| birth_place  = [[Rossville, Georgia]], U.S.\n| genre        = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}}\n| occupation   = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}}\n| instrument   = Vocals\n| years_active = 2011\u2013present\n| label        = {{hlist|[[19 Recordings|19]]|[[Interscope Records|Interscope]]|[[Universal Music Group Nashville|Mercury Nashville]]|[[Big Loud]]}}\n|spouse = {{marriage|Cam Arnold|February 4, 2024}}\n| website      = {{URL|laurenalainaofficial.com}}\n}}\n\n'''Lauren Alaina Kristine Suddeth''' (born November 8, 1994) is an American singer and songwriter from [[Rossville, Georgia]]. She was the runner-up on the [[American Idol (season 10)|tenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]].'' Her debut studio album, ''[[Wildflower (Lauren Alaina album)|Wildflower]],'' was released on October 11, 2011. Her second album, ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]],'' was released January 27, 2017. Alaina later achieved her first number one on the [[Country Airplay]] chart with the album's [[Road Less Traveled (song)|title track]]. Her second number one came later that year when she simultaneously topped five ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]'' charts with her friend and former classmate [[Kane Brown]] on their duet \"[[What Ifs]]\". In addition to this song with Brown, Alaina became an in-demand duet vocalist throughout the next few years, appearing on number one collaborations with [[Hardy (singer)|Hardy]], [[Devin Dawson]], and [[Dustin Lynch]]. Her third studio album, ''[[Sitting Pretty on Top of the World]]'', was released on September 3, 2021.\n\nAlaina was a contestant on the [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 28)|twenty-eighth season]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' and placed fourth with her partner [[Gleb Savchenko]]. She is a two-time [[CMT Music Award]] winner, has received one [[Academy of Country Music Award]], and is a two-time [[Country Music Association Award]] nominee. Alaina achieved one of country music's crowning achievements when she became a [[List of Grand Ole Opry members|member]] of the [[Grand Ole Opry]] on February 12, 2022, inducted by her childhood hero [[Trisha Yearwood]]. She is currently the youngest member of the Opry.\n\n== Early life ==\nAlaina was born on November 8, 1994, to Kristy and J. J. Suddeth of [[Rossville, Georgia]]. Her father works as a process technician in [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesfreepress.com/news/2011/mar/14/american-idol-fans-rally-behind-suddeth-family|title=American Idol fans rally behind Suddeth family|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=March 14, 2011|access-date=March 14, 2011}}</ref>\n\nAlaina started to sing at the age of 3. Her first public performances followed with a kids choir and an annual vacation spot that offered karaoke. She sang in church, restaurants, family holiday gatherings and anywhere within a 30-mile radius of where she lived.<ref name=\"biography\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Musician-Band/LaurenAlaina/about/|title=Lauren Alaina|website=www.facebook.com}}</ref>{{failed verification|date=December 2016}}\n\nAt age 8, Alaina entered the talent competition of the Southern Stars Pageant and won. The next year she was selected to perform on the Kids talent stage at Chattanooga's Riverbend Festival. She performed on that stage annually until age 12, when she won the competition that allowed her to perform on the festival's big stage. She traveled to [[Orlando, Florida]], when she was ten to compete in the American Model and Talent Competition. She won the event, beating out 1,500 kids. Alaina sang with the Georgia Country Gospel Music Association's children's group. At age 12, Alaina made her first of many trips to Nashville. She performed at local bars on Broadway, such as Tootsie's.<ref name=\"biography\"/> In 2009, Alaina was the first winner of the WinniSTAR youth talent contest at [[Lake Winnepesaukah]] amusement park.<ref name=\"pre idol\">{{cite news|url=http://timesfreepress.com/news/2011/feb/21/lauren-alaina-suddeth-american-idol-success-venue|title=Polished 'Idol': Venue owners not surprised by Suddeth's success|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=February 21, 2011|access-date=March 10, 2011}}</ref> In addition to performing, Alaina wrote several songs including \"Leaving\" and \"Set Me Free\".\n\nAlaina was inspired to sing by her cousin, Holly Witherow, who was diagnosed with a brain tumor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/moviestvmusic/news/5-things-you-dont-know-about-american-idols-lauren-alaina-201193|title=5 Things You Don't Know About American Idol's Lauren Alaina|last=Corneau|first=Allison|publisher=USMagazine.com|date=March 9, 2011|access-date=March 10, 2011}}</ref> Prior to ''Idol'', Alaina worked at [[CiCi's Pizza]].<ref name=\"pre idol\"/> She attended Lakeview-Fort Oglethorpe High School in [[Fort Oglethorpe, Georgia]], where she was a cheerleader.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/2011/mar/04/suddeth-advances-idol|title=Suddeth advances in 'Idol'|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=March 4, 2011|access-date=March 10, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/idol-finalist-suddeth-country-girl-heart-155125344.html|title=Idol finalist Suddeth is a 'country girl' at heart|date=March 21, 2011|access-date=September 28, 2016|archive-date=October 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002015451/https://www.yahoo.com/news/idol-finalist-suddeth-country-girl-heart-155125344.html|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nBefore auditioning for ''Idol'', she was rejected on ''[[America's Got Talent]]'' twice.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Powers|first=Lindsay|date=2011-05-27|title='Idol's' Lauren Alaina Once Rejected by 'America's Got Talent' (Video)|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/idols-lauren-alaina-once-rejected-192759/|access-date=2021-09-07|website=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref>\n\n==''American Idol''==\n===Overview===\nAlaina auditioned for the [[American Idol (season 10)|tenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]'' in Nashville, Tennessee. From early on, Alaina was a judge favorite. After her audition, ''Idol'' judge [[Steven Tyler]] stated, \"We found the one.\" May 14, 2011, was proclaimed \"Lauren Alaina Day\" in her hometown of Rossville, Georgia. During the season finale, Alaina sang \"[[Before He Cheats]]\" with her idol, [[Carrie Underwood]]. On May 25, 2011, Alaina was declared the runner-up.\n\n===Performances and results===\n{|class=\"wikitable\" style=\"text-align: center;\"\n|-\n!Episode\n!Theme\n!Song judges using their one save on [[Casey Abrams]], the Top 11 remained intact for another week, when two contestants were eliminated.</small>\n* <small>{{note|2|Note 2}} When [[Ryan Seacrest]] announced the results for this particular night, Alaina was in the bottom 2, but was declared safe as [[Jacob Lusk]] was eliminated.</small>\n\n==Music career==\nFollowing ''Idol'', Alaina was signed to [[Interscope Records]], [[Universal Music Group Nashville|Mercury Nashville]] and [[19 Recordings]]. Alaina released her single \"[[Like My Mother Does]]\". The song entered the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart at number 49<ref name=\"billboard May 30, 2011\">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/470941/scotty-mccreery-makes-historic-start-lauren-alaina-bows-on|title=Scotty McCreery Makes Historic Start, Lauren Alaina Bows On Country Songs|last=Trust|first=Gary|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 30, 2011|access-date=May 30, 2011}}</ref> and the [[Hot 100]] chart at number 20<ref name=\"EW June 1, 2011\">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2011/06/02/scotty-mccreery-lauren-alaina-chart-debuts|title='American Idol' winners Scotty McCreery, Lauren Alaina make big Hot 100 debuts|last=Anderson|first=Kyle|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=June 2, 2011|access-date=June 2, 2011}}</ref> and sold 121,000 copies in its first week.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2011/06/scotty-mccreery-lauren-alaina-tracks-top-the-country-chart/1|title=Scotty McCreery, Lauren Alaina tracks top country sales|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|work=Idol Chatter|publisher=USA Today|date=June 1, 2011|access-date=June 1, 2011}}</ref> \"Like My Mother Does\" peaked at number 36 on the Hot Country Songs chart.<ref name=\"song chart\">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/306644/lauren+alaina/chart?f=357|title=Lauren Alaina Chart history \u2013 Hot Country Songs|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref>\n\nFollowing the conclusion of Season 10, Alaina appeared and performed on several talk shows such as ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-the-tonight-show-with-jay-leno-video.htm/|title=Lauren Alaina \u2014 The Tonight Show With Jay Leno \u2014 VIDEO|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=May 27, 2011}}</ref> ''[[Live with Regis and Kelly]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-live-with-regis-and-kelly-video.htm/|title=Lauren Alaina \u2014 Live With Regis and Kelly \u2014 VIDEO|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 1, 2011}}</ref> and ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|The Today Show]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PGO-1wZJyB8| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/PGO-1wZJyB8| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina - Like My Mother Does - Today Show 06/02/11| website=[[YouTube]]|date=June 2, 2011}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8VVDFNWDCtc| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/8VVDFNWDCtc| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Scotty McCreery and Lauren Alaina - I Told You So - Today Show 06/02/11| website=[[YouTube]]|date=June 2, 2011}}{{cbignore}}</ref> On June 8, 2011, Alaina and McCreery presented at the [[CMT Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/videos/misc/662431/2011-cmt-music-awards-american-idol-finalists-intro.jhtml?id=1665494|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110618013333/http://www.cmt.com/videos/misc/662431/2011-cmt-music-awards-american-idol-finalists-intro.jhtml?id=1665494|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 18, 2011|title=2011 CMT Music Awards -- American Idol Finalist Intro|publisher=[[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]]|date=June 9, 2011}}</ref> In addition, Alaina made her [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on June 10.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/scotty-mccreery-lauren-alaina-make-their-opry-debut.htm|title=Scotty McCreery & Lauren Alaina Make Their Opry Debut \u2014 AUDIO \u2014 VIDEO|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 10, 2011}}</ref> She performed with [[Martina McBride]] at [[LP Field]] during the [[CMA Music Festival]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-martina-mcbride-duet-anyway-video/|title=Lauren Alaina Joins Martina McBride for Surprise Duet of 'Anyway' During CMA Music Fest|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|work=Taste of Country|date=June 13, 2011}}</ref> The following summer, Alaina toured with the [[American Idols Live! Tour 2011]], which began in [[West Valley City, Utah]] on July 6, 2011 and ended in [[Manila]], [[Philippines]] on September 21, 2011.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/photos/live/471825/american-idol-season-10-tour-dates-announced|title='American Idol' Season 10 Tour Dates Announced|last=Herrera|first=Monica|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=April 28, 2011}}</ref>\n\n===2011\u20132012: ''Wildflower''===\n[[File:Lauren Alaina in parade.jpg|Alaina in 2011|thumb|left]]\nOn October 11, 2011, Alaina released her debut album ''[[Wildflower (Lauren Alaina album)|Wildflower]]'', which debuted at number five on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart, number two on the [[Top Country Albums|Billboard Top Country Albums]] chart, and sold 69,000 copies the first week.<ref name=\"Idol Chatter 10-19-2011\">{{cite web|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2011/10/lauren-alaina-scotty-mccreery-sales-debut/1|title=Lauren Alaina's 69,000 sales mean a top-five debut|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|work=Idol Chatter|publisher=USA Today|date=October 19, 2011|access-date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> The album was the best-selling digital album by a debut country female. The lead single \"[[Georgia Peaches]]\" reached number 28 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart.<ref name=\"song chart\"/>\n\nTo promote her album, Alaina made numerous television and radio appearances. She performed her single \"Georgia Peaches\" on ''[[Good Morning America]]'', ''Live with Regis and Kelly'' and ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]''. On October 22, 2011, Alaina performed at ''Opry Goes Pink'', a benefit concert at the Grand Ole Opry for ''Women for the Cure''.<ref name=\"album promo\">{{cite web|url=http://countrymusicrocks.net/2011/10/lauren-alaina-releases-wildflower-on-oct-11-with-national-media-blitz-reveals-upcoming-single.html/|title=Lauren Alaina Releases Wildflower On Oct 11 With National Media Blitz & Reveals Upcoming Single|date=October 5, 2011|publisher=Country Music Rocks|access-date=September 28, 2016|archive-date=October 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002010646/http://countrymusicrocks.net/2011/10/lauren-alaina-releases-wildflower-on-oct-11-with-national-media-blitz-reveals-upcoming-single.html/|url-status=dead}}</ref> On November 10, 2011, Alaina performed \"[[My Grown Up Christmas List]]\" on ''CMA Country Christmas''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-cma-country-christmas-my-grown-up-christmas/|title=Lauren Alaina Brightens CMA Country Christmas Special With 'My Grown Up Christmas'|last=Dunham|first=Nancy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=December 1, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=znZDBe9ltt0| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/znZDBe9ltt0| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina Christmas Special| website=[[YouTube]]|date=December 7, 2011}}{{cbignore}}</ref> In addition, Alaina performed for [[Barack Obama]] and [[Michelle Obama]] in the [[PBS]] special ''In Performance at the White House'' on November 21.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-coal-miners-daughter-always-on-my-mind-white-house/|title=Lauren Alaina Performs 'Coal Miner's Daughter' and 'Always on My Mind' at the White House|last=Dukes|first=Billy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=November 22, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zI5xjcx_8-g/| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111228183451/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zI5xjcx_8-g| archive-date=2011-12-28 | url-status=dead|title=Country Music: In Performance at the White House Sneak Peek: Lauren Alaina PBS|website = [[YouTube]]|date=November 22, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ESycrwzmxKk/| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/ESycrwzmxKk| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Dierks Bentley & Lauren Alaina perform \"Always on My Mind\" In Performance at the White House| website=[[YouTube]]|date=January 19, 2014}}{{cbignore}}</ref> She sang the National Anthem at the [[Thanksgiving]] Day game between the [[Detroit Lions]] and [[Green Bay Packers]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-national-anthem-thanksgiving/|title=Lauren Alaina to Sing National Anthem at Packers-Lions Thanksgiving Game|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|publisher=Taste of Country|date=November 11, 2011}}</ref> On New Year's Eve, Alaina performed her single \"Georgia Peaches\" on ''American Country New Year's Eve Live''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2011/12/13/american-idol-lauren-alaina-fox-country-new-years-eve/|title=Exclusive: American Idol's Lauren Alaina Set for Fox's Countrified New Year's Eve Special|last=Slezak|first=Michael|website=TV Line|date=December 13, 2011|access-date=December 17, 2016|archive-date=November 29, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201129142235/https://tvline.com/2011/12/13/american-idol-lauren-alaina-fox-country-new-years-eve/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-georgia-peaches-fox-new-years-live.htm|title=Lauren Alaina \u2014 Georgia Peaches \u2014 FOX New Years Live|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=January 1, 2012}}</ref>\n\nAlaina served as an opening act for [[Jason Aldean]]'s ''My Kinda Party Tour'' from January 20, 2012 to May 19, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-jason-aldean-2012-tour/|title=Lauren Joins Jason Aldean's 2012 Tour|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|publisher=Taste of Country|date=December 2, 2011}}</ref> In addition to the ''My Kinda Party Tour'', Alaina opened for [[Sugarland]]'s ''In the Hands of the Fans Tour'' for a number of selected dates, beginning on April 5, 2012 and concluding on September 1, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sugarlandmusic.com/news/64403/|title=Announcing the \"In Your Hands\" Tour 2012!|publisher=sugarlandmusic.com|date=February 29, 2012}}</ref> On March 8, 2012, Alaina performed \"Georgia Peaches\" on the [[American Idol (season 11)|eleventh season]] of ''American Idol''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2012/03/17399-lauren-alaina-to-perform-georgia-peaches-on-idol|title=Lauren Alaina to Perform \"Georgia Peaches\" On Idol|work=Roughstock|publisher=Cheri Media|date=March 1, 2012}}</ref> On March 26, 2012, Alaina performed her single \"Georgia Peaches\" on ''The Today Show''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cambio.com/2012/03/22/lauren-alaina-georgia-peaches-today-show/|title=Lauren Alaina to Perform 'Georgia Peaches' on 'Today'|last=Cheung|first=Nadine|publisher=Cambio|date=March 22, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-georgia-peaches-today-show/|title=Lauren Alaina Brings Her 'Georgia Peaches' to the 'Today' Show|last=Cooper|first=Brittany|publisher=Taste of Country|date=March 26, 2012}}</ref> On June 16, 2012, Alaina headlined the final show of Riverbend, a music festival in her hometown of Chattanooga, Tennessee.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesfreepress.com/news/2012/jun/16/lauren-alaina-hometown-singer-closes-riverbend|title=Lauren Alaina returns to her roots at Riverbend|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=June 16, 2012|access-date=June 16, 2012}}</ref>\n\nIn July 2012, \"[[Eighteen Inches]]\" became Alaina's third single off her album, ''Wildflower''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-announces-new-single-18-inches-at-cma-fest-video.htm|title=Lauren Alaina Announces New Single \"18 Inches\" at CMA Fest (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 8, 2012|access-date=June 16, 2012}}</ref> The single was sent to country radio on July 16.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/lauren-alaina-to-release-new-single-eighteen-inches-on-july-16|title=Lauren Alaina To Release New Single \"Eighteen Inches\" on July 16|last=Harr|first=Dan|publisher=Music News Nashville|date=June 29, 2012|access-date=September 28, 2016|archive-date=September 7, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180907110250/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/lauren-alaina-to-release-new-single-eighteen-inches-on-july-16|url-status=dead}}</ref> \"Eighteen Inches\" hit number 37 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs list.<ref name=\"song chart\"/> In support of the song, Alaina embarked on an 18-city tour. Proceeds from each show benefited various local charities, including the [[Special Olympics]]. The Inch-By-Inch tour kicked off on September 21, 2012, and wrapped up November 12, 2012.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/2012/sep/21/lauren-alaina-embarks-inch-inch-tour|title=Lauren Alaina embarks on Inch-By-Inch tour|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=September 21, 2012|access-date=September 21, 2012}}</ref>\n\nAt the 2012 [[American Country Awards]], Alaina was selected as the New Artist of the Year.<ref name=\"new artist\">{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alain-new-artist-of-the-year-2012-american-country-awards/|title=Lauren Alaina Snags New Artist of the Year at 2012 American Country Awards|last=Sciarretto|first=Amy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=December 10, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vRvdcM-frU|title=Lauren Alaina New artist of the year ACA 2012|date=December 14, 2012 |via=www.youtube.com}}</ref>\n\n===2013\u20132017: ''Lauren Alaina'' EP and ''Road Less Traveled''===\nIn January 2013, Alaina started recording her second album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-new-album/|title=Lauren Alaina Begins Work on New Album|last=Sciarretto|first=Amy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=January 21, 2013}}</ref> On May 7, 2013, Alaina released the single \"[[Barefoot and Buckwild]]\", which charted at thirty-four on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart.<ref name=\"song chart\"/> She performed the song on the [[American Idol (season 12)|twelfth season]] of ''American Idol'' on May 9, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/118154/lauren-alaina-to-perform-new-single-on-idol|title=Lauren Alaina To Perform New Single On Idol|publisher=allaccess.com|date=May 7, 2013|access-date=May 7, 2013}}</ref> In May 2013, Alaina also released a track titled \"Antarctica: One World, One Family\". The track serves as the theme song for the [[SeaWorld]] attraction [[Antarctica: Empire of the Penguin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-sea-world-song/|title=Lauren Alaina Records Theme Song for SeaWorld Attraction|last=Whitaker|first=Sterling|publisher=Taste Of Country|date=May 11, 2013|access-date=May 14, 2013}}</ref> On December 10, 2013, Alaina released her cover of \"My Grown Up Christmas List\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/idolchatter/2013/12/09/lauren-alaina-grown-up-christmas-list-premiere/3910765|title=Premiere: Lauren Alaina's 'Grown-Up Christmas List'|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|work=Idol Chatter|publisher=USA Today|date=December 9, 2013}}</ref> On September 18, 2015, Alaina released the single \"[[Next Boyfriend]]\". \"Next Boyfriend\" was added to radio stations on September 28.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-announces-ep-single-next-boyfriend-video.htm|title=Lauren Alaina Announces EP, Releases Single \"Next Boyfriend\" (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=September 18, 2015}}</ref> It reached number 39 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart.<ref name=\"song chart\"/> An ''[[Lauren Alaina (EP)|EP]]'' followed on October 2, 2015.<ref name=\"EP\">{{cite web|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-to-release-self-titled-ep-october-2|title=LAUREN ALAINA TO RELEASE SELF-TITLED EP OCTOBER 2|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=September 18, 2015}}</ref> A track on the EP, \"History\" was used for [[ESPN]] College Football coverage.<ref name=\"history\">{{cite web|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-writes-and-records-exclusive-track-for-espn|title=LAUREN ALAINA WRITES AND RECORDS EXCLUSIVE TRACK FOR ESPN|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=August 31, 2015}}</ref>\n\nThroughout 2016, Alaina opened for several shows on [[Alan Jackson]]'s Still Keepin' It Country Tour.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alanjackson.com/news.html?n_id=4836|title=2016 Tour Dates Announced: Alan Jackson Keeps On \"Keepin' It Country\"|publisher=alanjackson.com|date=February 2, 2016}}</ref> On November 18, 2016, Alaina released her cover of \"[[O Holy Night]]\".<ref name=\"Christmas1\">{{cite web|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-shines-on-o-holy-night-available-now/|title=Lauren Alaina Shines On \"O Holy Night\" \u2013 Available Now|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=November 18, 2016}}</ref>\n\nAlaina released the single \"[[Road Less Traveled (song)|Road Less Traveled]]\", which she co-wrote with [[Meghan Trainor]] and [[Jesse Frasure]], on July 11, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pressroom.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-encourages-others-with-her-brand-new-single-road-less-traveled/|title=Lauren Alaina Encourages Others With Her Brand New Single, 'Road Less Traveled.'|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=July 9, 2016}}</ref> Alaina performed the track on ''The Today Show'' on September 8, 2016<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/video/lauren-alaina-performs-new-single-road-less-traveled-760452675568|title=Lauren Alaina performs new single 'Road Less Traveled'|website=[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=September 8, 2016}}</ref> and on ''[[Harry (talk show)|Harry]]'' on February 7, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/american-idol-lauren-alaina-cries-on-harry-video.htm|title=American Idol's Lauren Alaina Tearfully Shares Self Esteem Struggles on Harry (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=February 7, 2017}}</ref> In April 2017, \"Road Less Traveled\" reached number one on the ''Billboard'' [[Country Airplay]] chart.\n\nOn January 27, 2017, Alaina released her second album ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/lauren-alaina-road-less-traveled-album/|title=Lauren Alaina Shares 'Road Less Traveled' Album Release Details|last=Stefano|first=Angela|publisher=The Boot|date=December 5, 2016}}</ref> Tracks for Alaina's album include \"Same Day Different Bottle\",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/lauren-alaina-same-day-different-bottle|title=Lauren Alaina Speaks Out About Father's Alcoholism in 'Same Day, Different Bottle'|website=The Boot|date=November 7, 2013}}</ref> \"Doin' Fine\",<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/local/story/2014/nov/20/lauren-alaina-named-one-countrys-most-beautiful-wo/275077|title=Lauren Alaina named one of 'Country's Most Beautiful Women'|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=November 20, 2014}}</ref> \"My Kinda People\",<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTampyodErs| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/yTampyodErs| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina - My Kind of People (Acoustic)| date=May 14, 2015|via=www.youtube.com}}{{cbignore}}</ref> \"Pretty\",<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rxMOqGHKnHM| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/rxMOqGHKnHM| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina singing \"Pretty\" 5-3-15|via=www.youtube.com}}{{cbignore}}</ref> \"Crashin' the Boys Club\" and \"Queen of Hearts\",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-performs-new-songs-at-cma-music-fest-video.htm|title=Lauren Alaina Performs New Songs at CMA Music Fest (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 15, 2015}}</ref> as well as four tracks from her self-titled EP.<ref name=\"EP\"/> Alaina describes ''Road Less Traveled'' as \"very different\" from her debut album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-new-music-vocal-cord-surgery/|title=Lauren Alaina on Her First Album After Vocal Cord Surgery: 'Very Different'|last=McClellan|first=Laura|publisher=Taste of Country|date=April 27, 2015|access-date=June 29, 2015}}</ref> In addition, self acceptance and love is a big theme on the album. \"We are all different and that's what makes us all beautiful. The album will reflect that further. It will have some fun songs and sad songs \u2013 a little bit of what my life has been like over the past few years\", Alaina says.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.abqjournal.com/856518|title='American Idol' runner-up Lauren Alaina is finishing her second album, working on a film|last=Gomez|first=Adrian|newspaper=Albuquerque Journal|date=September 30, 2016}}</ref> Alaina performed \"Doin' Fine\" on ''Good Morning America'' on January 31, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/photos/video-lauren-alaina-performs-doin-fine-live-gma-45164171|title=VIDEO: Lauren Alaina Performs 'Doin' Fine' Live on 'GMA'|website=[[Good Morning America]]|publisher=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|date=January 31, 2017}}</ref>\n\nIn February and March 2017, Alaina toured with Martina McBride on her Love Unleashed Tour.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/martina-mcbride-partners-with-cmt-to-extend-love-unleashed-tour-into-2017/|title=Martina McBride Partners With CMT to Extend Love Unleashed Tour Into 2017|last=Stefano|first=Angela|publisher=The Boot|date=November 29, 2016|access-date=November 29, 2016}}</ref> Throughout June and July 2017, Alaina appeared on [[Luke Bryan]]'s ''Huntin', Fishin' and Lovin' Every Day Tour'' for a number of selected dates.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/luke-bryan-plots-massive-summer-tour-w462878|title=Luke Bryan Plots Massive Summer Tour|last=Crawford|first=Robert|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=January 25, 2017}}</ref> In May 2017, Alaina contributed guest vocals to the song \"Are You Happy Now\" from [[Rascal Flatts]]' tenth studio album, ''[[Back to Us]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/217734_exclusive_hear_rascal_flatts_soaring_duet_with_lauren_alaina_are_you_happy_now/|title=EXCLUSIVE: Hear Rascal Flatts' Soaring Duet With Lauren Alaina, 'Are You Happy Now'|last=Schillaci|first=Sophie|publisher=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|date=May 8, 2017}}</ref>\n\nAlaina's third single from ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]]'', \"Doin' Fine\", was released May 22, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-sends-doin-fine-country-radio/|title=Lauren Alaina Sends 'Doin' Fine' To Country Radio|last=Laffer|first=Lauren|publisher=Sounds Like Nashville|date=May 8, 2017}}</ref> The song peaked at number 27 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay chart, making it her second-highest charting single. Alaina became the only female to top both country charts in 2017 after \"Road Less Traveled\" topped the Country Airplay chart and \"What Ifs\" topped the Hot Country chart. This also made her one of the only three women to top either country chart in 2017.\n\nAlaina performed \"Doin' Fine\" and \"What Ifs\" at the [[53rd Academy of Country Music Awards|2018 ACM Awards]] where she won the award for New Female Vocalist of the Year.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} At the 2018 [[CMT Music Awards]], Alaina and Brown won the award for \"Best Collaborative Video\" for \"What Ifs\" and were among the top five vote getters for \"Video of the Year\" for the same song.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}}\n\n=== 2018-present: ''Getting Good'', ''Getting Over Him'' EPs and ''Sitting Pretty on Top of the World'' ===\nAlaina released the single, \"Ladies in the '90s\", on October 5, 2018. The song was released to country radio on October 15.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-releases-new-single-ladies-in-the-90s-today/|title=LAUREN ALAINA RELEASES NEW SINGLE \"LADIES IN THE '90S\" TODAY|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=October 5, 2018}}</ref> The single reached number 40 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}}\n\nAlaina was nominated for New Artist of the Year at the [[51st Annual Country Music Association Awards]] in 2017 and [[52nd Annual Country Music Association Awards]] in 2018.\n\nThroughout 2018 and 2019, Alaina toured with artists such as Alan Jackson, [[Cole Swindell]], [[Jason Aldean]], and [[Blake Shelton]].{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} She headlined numerous major music festivals such as [[Stagecoach Festival]].{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}}\n\nAlaina released the single, \"[[Getting Good]]\", on September 27, 2019. The song was released to country radio on October 7.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-is-getting-good-with-new-single-available-now/|title=LAUREN ALAINA IS \"GETTING GOOD\" WITH NEW SINGLE - AVAILABLE NOW|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=September 27, 2019}}</ref> \"The Other Side\" was released as a promotional single on October 22 and was danced to in a ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' episode in memory of her stepfather.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-performs-a-touching-tribute-and-debuts-new-song-the-other-side-on-abcs-dancing-with-the-stars/|title=LAUREN ALAINA PERFORMS A TOUCHING TRIBUTE AND DEBUTS NEW SONG \"THE OTHER SIDE\" ON ABC'S DANCING WITH THE STARS|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=October 22, 2019}}</ref> On March 6, 2020, she released the ''Getting Good'' EP including those two tracks and Ladies in the '90s.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alainas-getting-good-out-now/|title=LAUREN ALAINA's GETTING GOOD OUT NOW|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=March 6, 2020}}</ref> On September 4, 2020, she released the EP ''Getting Over Him''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-getting-over-him-ep-coming-september-4/|title=LAUREN ALAINA GETTING OVER HIM EP COMING SEPTEMBER 4|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=July 29, 2020}}</ref> Alaina's first single from the EP, \"[[Getting Over Him]]\", featuring [[Jon Pardi]] was released on February 23, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alainas-getting-over-him-ft-jon-pardi-impacts-country-radio-today/|title=LAUREN ALAINA's \"GETTING OVER HIM\" FT JON PARDI IMPACTS COUNTRY RADIO TODAY|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=February 23, 2021}}</ref> Alaina released her third studio album, ''[[Sitting Pretty on Top of the World]]'', on September 3, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-announces-sitting-pretty-on-top-of-the-world-album-out-sep-3/|title=LAUREN ALAINA ANNOUNCES SITTING PRETTY ON TOP OF THE WORLD ALBUM - OUT SEP. 3|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=July 30, 2021}}</ref>\n\nIn March 2021, Alaina revealed that she had tested positive for [[COVID-19]].<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.billboard.com/amp/articles/columns/country/9543923/lauren-alaina-covid-19-positive|title=Lauren Alaina Tests Positive for COVID-19|last=Iasimone|first=Ashley|publisher=Billboard|date=March 20, 2021}}</ref> On December 18, 2021, Alaina was asked to become an official member of [[The Grand Ole Opry]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://eu.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2021/12/18/lauren-alaina-invited-trisha-yearwood-become-newest-grand-ole-opry-member/8912891002/|title = Lauren Alaina invited to become newest Opry member: 'I've only cried that hard twice in my life'}}</ref>\n\nOn July 25, 2022, Alaina signed with Big Loud Records.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2022/07/lauren-alaina-signs-with-big-loud-records/ | title=Lauren Alaina Signs with Big Loud Records | date=July 25, 2022 }}</ref>\n\n==Other ventures==\nIn September and October 2016, Alaina filmed her very first movie ''The Road Less Traveled'', which took place in [[Knoxville, Tennessee]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7526452/lauren-alaina-american-idol-film-debut-road-less-traveled|title='American Idol' Alum Lauren Alaina to Make Film Debut in 'Road Less Traveled': Exclusive|last=Angermiller|first=Michele|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 29, 2016}}</ref> The film was released on June 6, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B071Z2DLS8|title=Road Less Traveled|website=Amazon}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y8Fk3bqjl4Q| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/y8Fk3bqjl4Q| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Road Less Traveled - Official Trailer - MarVista Entertainment| website=[[YouTube]]|date=May 23, 2017}}{{cbignore}}</ref> It then premiered on [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]] on November 10, 2017.<ref>[https://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/cmt-debut-lauren-alainas-romantic-comedy-road-less-traveled-november-10/ CMT To Debut Lauren Alaina\u2019s Romantic Comedy \u201cRoad Less Traveled\u201d On November 10] ''The Country Note'', October 16, 2017</ref>\n\nIn August 2019, Alaina was announced as one of the celebrities to compete on [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 28)|season 28]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Thorbecke|first=Catherine|title=''Dancing With the Stars'' 2019: Hannah Brown, Karamo Brown, Lamar Odom and more to compete on new season|url=https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/culture/story/dancing-stars-2019-hannah-brown-karamo-brown-lamar-65080101|work=[[Good Morning America]]|date=August 21, 2019|access-date=November 26, 2019}}</ref> She made it to the finals and finished in fourth place.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.goldderby.com/article/2019/dancing-with-the-stars-finale-recap-live-blog-dwts-news/|title='Dancing with the Stars' Finale recap: Who won the Mirror Ball Trophy at the end of topsy-turvy season 28?|last=Montgomery|first=Daniel|date=November 25, 2019|access-date=November 26, 2019|work=[[Gold Derby]]}}</ref>\n\nIn 2021, Alaina starred in the film, ''Roadhouse Romance,'' which premiered on September 11, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2021/06/roadhouse-romance-lauren-alaina-tyler-hynes-hallmark-rom-com-to-kick-off-fall-harvest-programming-event-1234773436/|title='Roadhouse Romance': Lauren Alaina & Tyler Hynes Hallmark Rom-Com To Kick Off \"Fall Harvest\" Programming Event|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=June 14, 2021}}</ref>\n\nShe was a contestant on ''[[Beyond the Edge (TV series)|Beyond the Edge]]'', a survival competition series that premiered in March 2022. She tore her ligament, ending her time on the show, later admitting that her exit was the right call.<ref>{{cite web |last=Schneider |first=Michael |title=CBS' 'Beyond the Edge' Sent Celebrities to the Jungle \u2014 And Producers Were Terrified They'd All Quit |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/beyond-the-edge-cbs-celebrity-survivor-2-1235206708/ |website=Variety |access-date=March 16, 2022 |date=March 16, 2022}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nAlaina's parents divorced in 2013. Her father was a recovered alcoholic who got sober in October 2013. Both her parents remarried.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://parade.com/541082/alison-abbey/with-a-new-album-and-a-top-20-single-country-singer-lauren-alaina-is-doin-fine/|title=With a New Album and a Top 20 Single, Country Singer Lauren Alaina Is 'Doin' Fine'|last=Abbey|first=Alison|newspaper=Parade: Entertainment, Recipes, Health, Life, Holidays |date=January 20, 2017}}</ref> In 2018, her stepfather died from cancer. Her father died in 2024.<ref name=\"Simpson\">{{cite news |last1=Simpson |first1=Kaitlin |title=Country Singer Lauren Alaina\u2019s Father Dies 6 Years After Her Stepfather Lost Battle With Cancer |url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/lauren-alaina-cancels-concerts-after-fathers-death/ |access-date=24 September 2024 |publisher=Us Weekly |date=July 24, 2024}}</ref>\n\nThroughout her teen years, Alaina struggled with [[bulimia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://motto.time.com/4324775/american-idol-lauren-alaina-bulimia/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160521000818/http://motto.time.com/4324775/american-idol-lauren-alaina-bulimia/|url-status=dead|archive-date=May 21, 2016|title=American Idol Star Lauren Alaina Opens Up About Her Past Struggles With Body Image and Bulimia|last=Amburg|first=Jessie|date=May 10, 2016}}</ref> She said in a 2016 ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' interview, \"I had an eating disorder for like four years, and I was just lost\" and \"I found myself in these last few years, through music and family and good people around me.\"<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/lauren-alaina-on-how-eating-disorder-led-to-redemptive-new-song-20160708|title=Lauren Alaina on How Eating Disorder Led to Redemptive New Song|last=Freeman|first=Jon|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=July 8, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7468472/lauren-alaina-literally-finds-her-voice-on-road-less-traveled|title=Lauren Alaina Literally Finds Her Voice On 'Road Less Traveled|last=Rowland|first=Tom|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=August 10, 2016}}</ref>\n\nAlaina is a [[Christians|Christian]] and often states that she lives for Jesus Christ.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/American-Idol-Lauren-Alaina-1033491.aspx|title=American Idol's Lauren Alaina on Vocal Problems: I Knew God Would Get Me Through It|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|magazine=TV Guide|date=May 24, 2011}}</ref>\n\nIn 2012, Alaina began dating Alexander Hopkins.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rare.us/story/american-idol-alum-lauren-alaina-turns-up-the-heat-in-her-latest-video/|title=\"American Idol\" alum Lauren Alaina turns up the heat in her latest video|last=Churilla|first=Ken|publisher=Rare Country|date=January 16, 2016}}</ref> In July 2018, the couple announced that they had become engaged.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://people.com/country/lauren-alaina-engaged-boyfriend-alex-hopkins/|title=Lauren Alaina and Alex Hopkins Are Engaged: 'Being Yours Forever Has a Nice RING to It'|last=Pasquini|first=Maria|magazine=People|date=July 21, 2018}}</ref> In January 2019, they announced that they had split after six years.<ref>{{cite tweet|user=Lauren_Alaina|author=Lauren Alaina|number=1087511481934065665|date=January 21, 2019|title=We ask for grace, compassion, and respect in this time. I don't regret a single second with Alex. I wish him the very best. Please do the same.}}</ref> She was in a relationship with comedian [[John Crist (comedian)|John Crist]] for several months in 2019.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Mizoguchi |first=Karen |title=Lauren Alaina Reveals She and Boyfriend John Crist Split Ahead of Her Dancing with the Stars Debut |url=https://people.com/country/lauren-alaina-john-crist-split-ahead-of-her-dancing-with-the-stars-debut/ |magazine=People |date=September 16, 2019|access-date=September 17, 2019}}</ref> In November 2022, she announced her engagement to Cam Arnold.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Lauren Alaina Announces Engagement Onstage at the Opry: 'Make Some Noise for My Future Husband' |url=https://people.com/country/lauren-alaina-engaged-to-cam-arnold-opry-announcement/ |access-date=2022-11-20 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref> The couple married on February 4, 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Lauren Alaina Marries Cam Arnold in 'Big, Loud' Nashville Wedding: 'We Have a Lot of People Who Love Us' |url=https://people.com/lauren-alaina-marries-cam-arnold-big-loud-wedding-nashville-8553175 |access-date=2024-02-06 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{main|Lauren Alaina discography}}\n\n'''Studio albums'''\n* ''[[Wildflower (Lauren Alaina album)|Wildflower]]'' (2011)\n* ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]]'' (2017)\n* ''[[Sitting Pretty on Top of the World]]'' (2021)\n\n==Awards and nominations==\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! The kids. And the dogs. The girls dominate\"|via=[[Instagram]]|date=August 24, 2019|access-date=August 26, 2021}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1979|12|27}}<ref name=\"Al.com\">{{cite web |url=http://blog.al.com/live/2011/01/mobilian_walker_hayes_hits_cou.html |title=Mobilian Walker Hayes hits country music charts with his song 'Pants' |author=Renee Busby |date=January 22, 2011 |work=Al.com |access-date=October 4, 2011}}</ref><ref name=\"allmusic\">{{cite web | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/walker-hayes-mn0002566358/biography | title=Walker Hayes biography | publisher=AllMusic | accessdate=January 2, 2022}}</ref>\n| origin          = [[Mobile, Alabama]], U.S.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://americantwang.com/walker-hayes-wax-paper-cups/ |title=Song Review: Walker Hayes \u2013 \"Wax Paper Cups\" |author=Jim Malec |date=August 3, 2010 |work=American Twang |access-date=September 30, 2010}}</ref>\n| genre           = [[Country pop]]<ref name=\"allmusic\"/>\n| occupation      = {{flatlist|\n* Singer\n* songwriter\n}}\n| instrument      = {{flatlist|\n* Vocals\n* guitar\n* piano\n}}\n| years_active    = 2010\u2013present\n| label           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Capitol Records|Capitol]]\n* [[Monument Records|Monument]]\n}}\n| spouse = {{marriage|Laney Beville|2004}}\n}}\n'''Charles Edgar Walker Hayes''' (born December 27, 1979) is an American [[country pop]] singer and songwriter. He has released four studio albums: ''Reason to Rhyme'' in 2011 on [[Capitol Records Nashville]], and ''[[Boom (Walker Hayes album)|Boom]],'' ''[[Country Stuff the Album]],'' and ''New Money'' in 2017, 2022, and 2023 on [[Monument Records]]. Hayes has charted multiple singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]] charts; his highest-peaking is \"[[Fancy Like]]\", which reached the number one position on both charts between late 2021 and early 2022.\n\n==Early life==\nHayes was born on December 27, 1979, in [[Mobile, Alabama]]. He has eight older half-siblings, four from his mother's previous marriage and four from his father's previous marriage.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Exit 209 with Storme Warren: Walker Hayes - Leap Of Faith on Apple Podcasts |url=https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/walker-hayes-leap-of-faith/id1653788476?i=1000606038777 |access-date=2023-05-06 |website=Apple Podcasts |language=en-US}}</ref> His father, Charles Hayes, was a [[realtor]] and died in 2021.<ref name=\"Al.com\"/><ref>{{cite web |title=Charles Hayes-Obituary |url=http://mobilerealtors.com/charles-hayes-obituary/ |website=Mobile Area Association of Realtors |access-date=October 18, 2021}}</ref> Hayes attended St. Paul\u2019s Episcopal School in Mobile and then graduated from [[Birmingham\u2013Southern College]] in 2002 with a bachelor's degree in music and an emphasis on piano.<ref name=\"Al.com\"/>\n\n==Career==\n\n=== 2005\u20132015: Beginnings ===\nHayes and his wife moved to Nashville in 2005, hoping to get in the country music business. He landed a job writing songs for a Nashville publishing company and then signed a contract with [[Mercury Records Nashville]],<ref name=\"post\">{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/music/walker-hayes-isnt-afraid-to-sing-about-failure-and-its-making-him-a-success/2017/09/13/23d1fece-8ea2-11e7-91d5-ab4e4bb76a3a_story.html|title=Walker Hayes isn't afraid to sing about struggling, and it's making him a success|newspaper=The Washington Post|access-date=November 2, 2017}}</ref> though he was quickly dropped and moved to [[Capitol Records]] Nashville.<ref name=\"Al.com\"/> In 2010, he released his first single, \"Pants\". It debuted at No.&nbsp;60 on the [[Hot Country Songs]] charts dated for the week ending September 18, 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1647566/lady-antebellums-need-you-now-recaptures-no-1-perch.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100915021839/http://www.cmt.com/news/country-music/1647566/lady-antebellums-need-you-now-recaptures-no-1-perch.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=September 15, 2010 |title=Lady Antebellum's ''Need You Now'' Recaptures No.&nbsp;1 Perch |author=Edward Morris |date=September 11, 2010 |work=[[Country Music Television|CMT]] |access-date=September 30, 2010}}</ref> Kyle Ward of Roughstock rated the single 3.5 stars out of 5.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/walker-hayes-pants- |title=Walker Hayes \u2014 \"Pants\" |author=Kyle Ward |date=September 6, 2010 |work=Roughstock |access-date=September 30, 2010 |archive-date=September 3, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100903145449/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/walker-hayes-pants- |url-status=dead }}</ref> Hayes debuted the video for the song in December 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theboot.com/2010/12/17/walker-hayes-pants-video/|title=Walker Hayes, 'Pants' (Making of the Video)|date=December 17, 2010|work=The Boot|access-date=December 22, 2010}}</ref> Hayes also appeared on an episode of [[19 Kids and Counting]], singing a song he wrote about Jill and her now husband, Derick's, proposal. \"Pants\" and a second single, \"Why Wait for Summer\", both appeared on an album for [[Capitol Records]] titled ''Reason to Rhyme''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/reason-to-rhyme-mw0002594490|title=Reason To Rhyme \u2013 Walker Hayes \u2013 Songs, Reviews, Credits|publisher=AllMusic|access-date=November 2, 2017}}</ref><ref name=\"post\"/>\n\nHayes co-wrote and sang guest vocals on \"Dirty Side\", a song from [[Colt Ford]]'s 2014 album ''[[Thanks for Listening (Colt Ford album)|Thanks for Listening]]''.<ref>{{Cite AV media notes |title=Thanks for Listening (Deluxe Edition) |others=Colt Ford |year=2014 |type=CD booklet |pages=2\u20138 |publisher=Average Joes Entertainment}}</ref> He also co-wrote [[Rodney Atkins]]' late-2014 single \"Eat Sleep Love You Repeat\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/rodney-atkins-eat-sleep-love-you-repeat/|title=Rodney Atkins Releases 'Eat Sleep Love You Repeat'|last=Allers|first=Hannahlee|date=October 30, 2014|work=The Boot|access-date=October 31, 2014}}</ref> After losing his contract with Capitol Records, Hayes worked at a [[Costco]] to support himself.<ref name=\"auto\">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7873034/walker-hayes-comeback-monument-records|title=Nashville Broke Up With Walker Hayes, But After a Stint at Costco He's Back|last=Stark|first=Phyllis|date=July 19, 2017|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=October 30, 2017}}</ref>\n\n=== 2016\u20132020: ''8Tracks Vol. 1'' and ''8Tracks Vol. 2'' ===\nIn 2016, Hayes signed a publishing and production deal with [[Shane McAnally]] and SMACK/RareSpark, through which he released two [[extended play]]s:<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/world-cafe/2017/06/27/534552977/world-cafe-nashville-walker-hayes|title=Walker Hayes' Mixtapes Keep Country Conversational|website=NPR |date=June 27, 2017 |access-date=November 2, 2017|last1=Hight |first1=Jewly }}</ref> ''8Tracks Vol. 1'' and ''8Tracks Vol. 2''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2018/03/walker-hayes-re-releases-8tracks-vol-1-2-as-thank-you-to-fans/|title=Walker Hayes Re-Releases '8Tracks Vol. 1 & 2' As Thank You To Fans|date=March 19, 2018}}</ref> This was followed by his first single for [[Monument Records]], \"[[You Broke Up with Me]]\".<ref name=\"auto\"/> It appears on his first Monument album, ''[[Boom (Walker Hayes album)|Boom]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/walker-hayes-boom-album-release-date/|title=Walker Hayes to Release Full-Length Album, 'Boom'|website=Taste of Country|date=October 9, 2017 |access-date=November 2, 2017}}</ref> It would be his breakthrough hit on the Billboard charts.\n\nIn August 2018, Hayes released a single titled \"90's Country\", whose song lyrics contain multiple references to titles of country songs from the 1990s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/walker-hayes-90s-country/|title=Walker Hayes Takes Us Back in Time With '90's Country'|date=August 30, 2018 }}</ref>\n\n=== 2021\u2013present: ''Country Stuff the Album'' and ''New Money'' ===\nOn June 4, 2021, Hayes released the EP ''[[Country Stuff]]''. One of its tracks, \"[[Fancy Like]]\", became a viral hit through [[TikTok]] and reached number 3 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]<ref name=\"Hot 100\">{{cite magazine |title=Walker Hayes Chart History \u2013 Billboard Hot 100 |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/walker-hayes/chart-history/hsi/ |access-date=November 30, 2021 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> and number 1 on the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart,<ref name=\"Hot Country Songs\">{{cite magazine |title=Walker Hayes Chart History \u2013 Country Songs |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/walker-hayes/chart-history/csi/ |access-date=November 30, 2021 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref> becoming Hayes' highest-charting effort to date.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/chart-beat/9590406/walker-hayes-fancy-like-tops-country-digital-song-sales-chart/|title=Walker Hayes' 'Fancy' Dance Moves Spark His First No. 1: 'Just Me Being Me ... With My Family'|magazine=Billboard|last=Asker|first=Jim|date=June 22, 2021|access-date=July 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://americansongwriter.com/behind-the-song-walker-hayes-viral-hit-fancy-like/|title=Behind the Song: Walker Hayes' Viral Hit \"Fancy Like\"|website=American Songwriter|last=Benitez-Eves|first=Tina|date=July 9, 2021|access-date=July 11, 2021}}</ref> It was subsequently released to country radio as his next single, and debuted at number 53 on the [[Country Airplay|''Billboard'' Country Airplay]] chart. \"Fancy Like\" appeared on an [[extended play]] titled ''[[Country Stuff]]'', the tracks of which also carried over to his third studio album, 2022's ''[[Country Stuff the Album]]''. The album has also produced the singles \"[[U Gurl]]\" and \"[[AA (song)|AA]]\".<ref name=\"toc\">{{cite web | url=https://tasteofcountry.com/walker-hayes-country-stuff-the-album/ | title=Walker Hayes announces 'Country Stuff the Album' | publisher=Taste of Country | date=November 19, 2021 | accessdate=January 20, 2022}}</ref> \n\nIn July 2022, Hayes released the single \"Y'all Life\".<ref>{{Cite web |title=When did Walker Hayes release \u201cY'all Life\u201d? |url=https://genius.com/Walker-hayes-yall-life-lyrics/q/release-date |access-date=2024-09-03 |website=Genius}}</ref>\n\nOn July 28, 2023, Hayes released ''Strait Two Stepping'', a two song [[extended play]] including the songs \"Stetson\" and \"Show Me the Country\".<ref>{{Cite web |last=O'Connell |first=Madeleine |date=2023-07-28 |title=Walker Hayes Drops A Set Of New, Dance Worthy Tracks On The 'Strait Two Stepping' Bundle |url=https://countrynow.com/walker-hayes-drops-a-set-of-new-dance-worthy-tracks-on-the-strait-two-stepping-bundle/ |access-date=2024-09-03 |website=Country Now |language=en-US}}</ref> These songs later appeared on his second studio album ''[[New Money (album)|New Money]]'', along with the single, \"Good with Me\", which released on August 25, 2023.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Dowling |first=Marcus K. |title=Walker Hayes confronts America's divisive ideals with a beer and a smile in 'Good With Me' |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2023/08/25/walker-hayes-good-with-me-takes-on-americas-divisions-with-a-smile/70680702007/ |access-date=2024-09-03 |newspaper=[[USA Today]] |language=en-US}}</ref> The album was released a month later on September 29, 2023.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web |last=Neeley |first=Ansley |date=2023-09-29 |title=Walker Hayes Releases New 8-Song Project ''New Money'' |url=https://www.monument-records.com/walker-hayes-releases-new-8-song-project-new-money/ |access-date=2024-09-03 |website=Monument Records |language=en-US}}</ref>\n\nIn July 2024, Hayes teamed up with [[Canadian]] rapper [[Connor Price]] on the song, \"Smoke\". It was met with negative reviews and was described as \"one of the worst songs ever made.\"<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hookstead |first=David |date=2024-08-26 |title=We've Found One Of The Worst Songs Ever Made: LISTEN |url=https://www.outkick.com/culture/smoke-connor-price-walker-hayes |access-date=2024-09-12 |website=OutKick |language=en-US}}</ref> On August 16, 2024, Hayes released \"Ball Player\", a song intended as an \"apology to his kids\" about his feelings towards their athletic careers.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Walker Hayes Releases A Letter To His Kids in Brand New Track, \u201cBall Player\u201d |url=https://www.rcarecords.com/news/walker-hayes-releases-a-letter-to-his-kids-in-brand-new-track-ball-player/ |access-date=2024-09-12 |website=RCA Records |language=en-US}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nHe lives in [[Estill Springs, Tennessee]], with his wife, Laney Beville Hayes, and their six children.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/2022/01/27/fancy-like-applebees-on-date-night-tiktok-walker-hayes-rides-waves-crossover-hit-new-album/6415684001/|title=If Nashville is a 10-year town, no one told Walker Hayes (and that's OK by him)|work=[[The Tennessean]]|last=Leimkuehler|first=Matthew|date=January 27, 2022|access-date=January 28, 2022}}</ref> The couple married in 2004.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://countrynow.com/how-did-walker-hayes-meet-his-wife-laney/ | title=How Did Walker Hayes Meet His Wife, Laney? | date=May 13, 2022 }}</ref> Their seventh child and fourth daughter, Oakleigh Klover Hayes, died shortly after birth on June 6, 2018. Laney had to undergo surgery due to profuse bleeding after the birth.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Country star Walker Hayes opens up about losing baby girl and almost his wife|first=Scott|last=Stump|url=https://www.today.com/parents/country-singer-walker-hayes-opens-about-losing-baby-girl-t136175|date=2018-08-22|access-date=2022-04-05|website=[[TODAY.com]]|language=en}}</ref> Hayes is a [[Christians|Christian]] and has been sober since 2015.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2022-02-17|title=Walker Hayes Shares the Story Behind 'AA' [EXCLUSIVE]|url=https://www.everythingnash.com/walker-hayes-shares-the-story-behind-aa-exclusive/|access-date=2022-04-05|website=Everything Nash|language=en-US}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{Main
